This one from Amazon Basics has held up over 2 months of regular use.We were skeptical, given the price .. it's like half of some of the others. But you'd never know it. We're so pleased.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing and heavy', 'author': 'AMG', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Made some amazing soup in this. It‚Äôs so worth the price and very cute.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nothing Exceptional but Gets the Job Done', 'author': 'Booksalottle', 'rating': 4, 'content': "The media could not be loaded. I‚Äôve owned this 4.5 Qt. Amazon Enameled Cast Iron Dutch Oven for almost two months and have used it three times to date. Upon arrival and at first glance, the gradient blue color is beautiful and super glossy; most importantly, the pot is heavy for its size - as it should be. It looks exactly like the product pictures, with a globular shape than square shape as others. Unfortunately, I also noticed that there was one pin hole and two tiny uneven protrusions on the enamel inside the pot.I own three other enameled cast iron cookware from two other brands (photos attached for size comparison) and performance wise, this cast iron by Amazon performs equally to them. The pot isn‚Äôt exceptional or special but it gets the job done. Other than the pin holes and protrusions, I have no complaints. This isn‚Äôt my first rodeo so when heating up the pot and while cooking, I have zero issues.I am starting the pan off at 4-Stars and will update my review as time progresses, or if I have any major issues with its durability or performance in subsequent months. For the amateur home cook, or for anyone who is new to cast iron cooking, below I‚Äôve included tips that you may find useful while using this or any other enameled cast iron cookware.================================Regarding the 3 Photos and 1 video I've Attached:(Note: all photos were taken with an iPhone under kitchen lights during the evening. Photos have not been edited nor enhanced.)Photo 1: Size comparison of this Amazon Enameled Cast Iron Dutch Oven compared to three other enameled cast iron cookware that I own from two other brands. From left to right: 7 qt. Tramontina, 4.5 qt. Amazon, 3 qt. Lodge 4 qt. Tramontina.Photos 2 and 3: fresh produce shown next to 4.5qt Amazon Dutch Oven for color and size contrast.Video: 4.5 qt. Amazon Enameled Cast Iron Dutch Oven on gas stove over medium heat, with food cooking.================================TIPS THAT YOU MAY FIND USEFUL While Using your cast iron dutch oven:(Note: I included these similar tips in my review of a different enameled cast iron pot from a different brand. My tips can apply to all enameled cast iron cookware)1. If you find that you have issues with food sticking, it could be that you are not heating up your cast iron pot properly to prevent undue hot spots.I heat my pot up gradually starting at low, then medium, then high heat. After my pot is very hot is when I add my fat/cooking oil. As the oil is heating up in the pot, I lift it and swirl the oil around to coat all sides of the pot that will come in contact with food.2. Take into consideration the temperature of the items you are adding to your heated pot. As a general rule for cooking: when ever possible, ensure that the items you are adding to a hot pot are at room temperature, rather than ice cold from the fridge; this will assist with even cooking.3. Also, get comfortable with adjusting your heat by lowering and raising it based on what you‚Äôve added to the pot. In general, you will need more heat at the beginning of the cooking process, and less heat towards the end. If you cook by recipe, I highly recommend that you read all the steps ahead before starting, so that you become familiarized with all the procedures, allowing you to maneuver accordingly when you start cooking.4. At the exception of searing meat to achieve a brown crust, deep frying, or when caramelizing onions, you should be stirring your pot (I recommend using a wooden spoon) every few minutes when cooking in cast iron that is placed over high heat. If you are braising on the stove at low heat versus braising in the oven, the frequency of your stirring will need to be adjusted. No matter how you‚Äôre cooking though, a watchful eye on the pot plus stirring, should both be a habit not an afterthought.5. For all cooking vessels in general but especially for cast iron: after cooking, allow your pot to cool down completely before cleaning. NEVER immerse a hot cast iron pot into cold water, nor pour cold dish water into hot pot. You risk not only being scald by dangerous steam, but you also risk weakening the enamel, therefore lessening the durability of your pots over time.6. This cookware and others like it from Tramontina and Lodge are economical and if used correctly, will perform well for most cooking; if used correctly, they should also last for years. Nonetheless, if you can afford it, authentic enameled cast iron cookware made in France by Le Creuset is the best way to go. Le Creuset is the gold standard in cast iron cookware and their quality is second to none. I definitely recommend this Amazon dutch oven but if you can afford to splurge, Le Creuset's reputation is stellar. As a professional chef, I've used them in high end kitchens and their quality and performance is premier.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 2, 2018', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I LOVE this pot!', 'author': 'Rebekah F.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I purchased this as a post-Christmas gift for myself. I consider myself a pretty good cook and I have a great selection of cookware--from plain cast iron to non stick and stainless. But never purchased an enameled pot. My sister has several and loves hers (like me, she loves to cook, too!) A couple of my large Dutch ovens were getting a little beat up after 30+ years of using them. I decided to look into an enameled one. I started doing a little research on the 'best' enameled dutch oven and I was absolutely gobsmacked when Amazon's brand came in second overall--even against the big, well-known brands! So, after checking it out here, and happily finding that it comes in RED, I ordered one.Since I got it, it has pretty much lived on my stove full time. I have made several soups , braises, and a vat of chili for Super Bowl in it. It cleans up beautifully. It IS heavy and it is big, but I love it. It has become my go-to pot for any soup, stew, chili, braise. It is just wonderful and I will probably buy the smaller one, as well. I just need to eliminate some of my lesser used cookware to make space for them. I do not think you will be disappointed with this purchase. FYI, I do hand wash ALL my cookware--even the ones that say dishwasher safe, and I do not stack my pots or pans without a separator between.As far as chipping of the enamel, I certainly have not had that issue, but then, I have only had this for a couple of months. But it has already been through some work and it has held up beautifully.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good quality and affordable', 'author': 'MacFlyer84', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'After a few uses, this Dutch oven is quality at a very reasonable price. No flaws, heavy duty, great heat distribution and easy clean up. The only flaw is the color: the Red oven is actually orange. Other than that great value and I recommend this product.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Dutch Oven. Great Price!', 'author': 'William Ryan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great Dutch Oven. I have 2 smaller Le Creuset Dutch Ovens and they, of course, are terrific. This one is a fraction of the cost of just one of my 4 1/2 quart Le Creuset Dutch Ovens. I am now able with this 6 1/2-quart Dutch Oven to bake sourdough bread without fear of having the dough held prisoner by the narrower vertical height from bottom of the Dutch Oven to the lid. I have baked several loaves of sourdough bread in this Amazon basic enameled Cast Iron Dutch Oven with no problems whatsoever. I love the larger capacity and I also love the far less expensive price. The Amazon basic version cleans up with no more elbow grease required that if I were baking in one of my Le Creuset Dutch Ovens. I would recommend this to anyone in the market for a 6 1/2-quart Dutch Oven and I would buy it again, however I suspect that this one will last as long or longer than I do. It appears to be a very durable piece of kitchen ware. Get one if you need a larger Dutch Oven to do sourdough bread baking!Bill Ryan, Sparks, Nevada', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars 6qt- Very good value', 'author': 'Mr. And Mrs. H', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have used this Dutch oven 5-6 times since it Arrived and I love it. For that price, who cares if it only lasts a year or two?At the priceIf it lasts 2 years I'll", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Amazon Basics Pre-Seasoned Cast Iron Round Dutch Oven Pot with Lid and Dual Handles, 7-Quart, Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Absolutely Perfect!', 'author': 'Austin David Lilly', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is a great product and I would definitely buy again. absolutely perfect! This cast iron pot with lid isn't just for cooking, you will make memories with your family and then one day it will be passed down to the next generation -cast iron lasts forever. Please do not hesitate to buy. (See Update Below)To care for this item: Once this pot is used and needs to be cleaned, preheat oven to 400 degrees. Boil in pot for two minutes or until food stuck to pot softens, etc. This is to sterilize the pot. Then scour this pot with dawn and brillo or some other metal scrubbing pad. Once all visible food is removed and pot appears clean, rinse with hottest water possible. Put pot and clean lid into the oven to dry. That's it :) No further efforts are required, no seasoning necessary. My family has used this method for more than twenty years on various cast iron pots and pans, I write this to assure you our method works perfectly.***UPDATE: Whenever food burns, due to the ridges in the bottom of the pan, it's extremely difficult to clean... I can't recommend this product. When buying a pan or skillet, make sure the bottom is smooth.God so loved the world that He gave His one and only Son. Anyone who believes in Him will not die but will have eternal life. John 3:16 NIRV ‚ÄúBelieve in the Lord Jesus [as your personal Savior and entrust yourself to Him] and you will be saved, you and your household [if they also believe].‚Äù Acts 16 :31 AMP And if anyone‚Äôs name was not found written in the Book of Life, he was hurled into the lake of fire. Revelation 20:15 AMPTherefore if anyone is in Christ [that is, grafted in, joined to Him by faith in Him as Savior], he is a new creature [reborn and renewed by the Holy Spirit]; the old things [the previous moral and spiritual condition] have passed away. Behold, new things have come [because spiritual awakening brings a new life]. 2 Corinthians 5:17 (Amplified Bible)", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great value', 'author': 'Kindle Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'So far have only used it to bake bread which is why I got it. Cleans easily so will use it for other purposes. Good quality.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful product', 'author': 'Peggy Parson', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Just what I wanted, a pot that is sturdy, large, and already cured. Perfect for a mom with a large family to cook for!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good Cast Iron', 'author': 'Miss Maggie', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I'm in my fifties. I'm from the south. I've been cooking with cast iron since before I was strong enough to lift it. This is a good pot. I liked the 2-quart pot so much that I bought a second one. Now I have two. Both pots were from the warehouse, discounted because they had been returned. They both work flawlessly. I have had cheap cast iron from family dollar and upscale cast iron from Cabellas. This pot from Amazon is mid range. Its not as nice as my great grandmother's pre-WW1 pot, but its about as good as Lodge. I like this size for cooking rice (2-cups dry, 4 cups water, 20 minutes on low after boiling). It makes better rice than you've ever had from a rice cooker and it keeps the rice warm for at least an hour without burning. Just leave the lid on and take it off the stove after cooking. It's also perfect for cooking dried beans. Whether you cook plain beans or add bacon or ham hocks (or turkey necks) for seasoning, the beans cook fast and evenly. They do not have to be watched every minute. On medium-low, covered, they're tender in an hour (assuming you soaked them overnight). I can cook beans in one pot, rice in the second pot, and dinner requires almost zero attention. Since I do a lot of simmering in my pots, they require regular care. I wash them with a scrub brush and a dab of Dawn dish detergent. I have never put one in the dishwasher. I think that would be foolish. After washing, I let them drip dry for a few minutes and then dry with a dish towel. Finally I rub cooking fat on both the lid and pot with a paper towel. I use vegetable oil. My grandmother used Crisco. My great-grandmother used lard. My mother didn't use cast iron, she preferred teflon. In my experience the type of cooking fat really does not matter. When the pot becomes rusty, as it inevitably will, there is a simple solution. Rub it liberally with the fat of your choice and cook it in the oven on low overnight. Voila! Instant no-stick coating. Cast iron is the very best cookware ever created. Even cheap cast iron lasts your and your grandchildren's lifetime. Just rub it lightly with fat after washing and then season it a couple of times a year. It never wears out and it adds iron to your diet which is especially nice for pregnant and nursing moms. The 2-quart pot from Amazon is reasonably priced for a pot that will last at least 2-lifetimes and its good enough quality to justify its price. If your pot is rusting, that's your fault and you have the power to correct it. If you don't, then that's on you, not the pot. By all means give it away to somebody who will appreciate it. I've gotten several of my favorite cast iron pieces that way.üòÅ", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 3, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars This is large and heavy, but very nice', 'author': 'Trish', 'rating': 4, 'content': "The weight surprised me, but it's cast iron, after all. I bought the big one for a party and have only used it once so far. There is a hairline crack on the inside of the handle that doesn't seem like a huge deal.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 1, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The coating has a issue', 'author': 'Mary Tow', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This cooks foods evenly and does not stick at all. I take great care of it clean it and dry it off immediately after food is out of it.My Autistic daughter loves using it to make her homemade soups she makes. But I am getting worried that it‚Äôs gonna put metal sharers in our food.So it sat for awhile put up before being used. And it was bought last January of 2022.But just after using it 3 times it started rusting..', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 2, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars 7qt', 'author': 'courtney', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I opted for the 7qt one.... it is big but I'm using it for sourdough baking so I think it's a big plus and it seems very good quality and nice", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Coating', 'author': 'maksea', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Love the size and sturdy feeling . title: 9 Quart Pre-Seasoned Cast Iron Dutch Oven with Lid and Lid Lifter Tool Outdoor Deep Camp Pot for Camping Fireplace Cooking BBQ Baking Campfire 9 QT
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This Dutch Oven has great quality and capacity.', 'author': 'Michael  K', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is a great all around size Dutch Oven. I got it because I wanted something that I could use outside on the fire, or inside on top the stove. It's not to big and not to small. It is pretty heavy at about 21.5lbs.The 9 quart capacity is perfect for large meals, and I like how the top doubles as a skillet. What's also great, Is that It came pre seasoned. So I was able to use it right away. The more you use it, the more seasoned it will get. The Dutch oven seems to be well made, and has stood up to the the heat of an open fire as well as directly on and in the stove.After I'm done using it, and it has completely cooled. I just use some hot water and and a soft sponge to clean it. If its fairly dirty I will use just a tiny bit of soap. A good thing to do is hand dry it when your done washing it, because if you leave it out to air dry it will rust. So be sure to rub a light coat of oil (I use canola) on it after it is all dried.Overall the Dutch Oven has been great!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Doubles as a skillet', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Well made and a good product.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cast iron pan', 'author': 'Unsatisfied customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Really nice pan and a great pan , exactly what I was looking for. üëå', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great price and quality', 'author': 'Adam Lawing', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great product. Lot cheaper than Lodge and works just as good.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This is good for the price', 'author': 'Not your avg. Bobby', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've been using cast iron for a while now and just so you know the sand casting on the inside of the pan is PRETTY rough! BUT I'm someone that has learned how to reseaon quite well so I have started cashing in on the cheaper cast iron products with a rougher finish.To be honest, I didn't even try to cook anything with this when it arrived. I took it straight out to the garage and went after it with a 60-80 grit flap disk. took it to bare metal and when the metal surface was smooth THEN I started the reseaon process. Which is really just very thin layer of cooking oil or lard and put it upside down in the oven at 400-425 for an hour at a minimum. Do that 2 or 3 times and your ready to cook. as you cook it keeps getting darker and darker. Now it looks like it came smooth from factory.It's great! I love cooking in this and I want another one!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Seasoned? Nope.', 'author': 'Tim B', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I like this Dutch oven. However it is NOT SEASONED.1st and foremost, The seasoning is terrible. Tastes like they used motor oil. I used it a couple times and ended up boiling water in it multiple times to get the taste out before using it again. After that I only cooked Bacon, Beef, Olive oil & salt, repeat many, many times. This oven needs serious seasoning. I've been using it once or twice a week for a few months now and still not satisfied with the results. To be fair my cast iron pans have decades of cooking on them and that finish is what I am after. Still, this oven is not even close to being seasoned.2nd seasoning continued... Let's be real. Most of us don't spend enough time around the camp fire to season a dutch oven. So on the stove at home is the most realistic. With that said the lid is really difficult to use on a stove top. I have a gas stove and I'd imagine electric is worse. Just the configuration of the lid handle and feet makes it a challenge to get on your stoves's grills. Then moving it while it's hot is scary.3rd It's awkward to clean. There are no feet or ridges on the bottom of the oven so tipping it is difficult. Making it hard to clean while still warm. Which is the easiest way to clean a cast iron pan/pot.Beyond that I really like this oven. It's solid and cooks evenly. Just realize you need to put some work into it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 20, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Dutch oven', 'author': 'Burt Baucom', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've always wanted to get a Dutch oven to cook my chili beans in, this was very reasonable and just what I needed, great investment for me!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent', 'author': 'Kelvin Camis', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Very good quality product', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good Pot!!', 'author': 'Wayne R. Rose', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My second one!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Stout and heavy for chili.', 'author': 'Roy B', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Keeps food hot for long periods of time.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Bruntmor 5 Quart Cast Iron Enameled Dutch Oven - Modern Squoval Design - Nonstick Seasoned Pot with Stainless Steel Knob - Ideal for Christmas/Thanksgiving Dinner - White with Blue Lid
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful!', 'author': 'Syl', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Got this dutch oven to make ghee. I wanted a smaller, hefty dutch oven (that didn't break the bank) with a white interior so I can see all the milk solids settle to the bottom as I cook my ghee. It has worked so well; however, I've also used it to make several different dishes, soups and sauces. The heat is evenly distributed throughout the pot. Clean up is easy.While the shape of this pot is very different, it looks great on my stove top. It is very well made. The pointed rim is useful when pouring out sauces or any liquid. Am very pleased with my purchase. The Bruntmor Store on Amazon carries other items that are worth perusing and possibly purchasing in the future.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 24, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Quality', 'author': 'Krista', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is very heavy, easy to clean, sturdy, & great for the price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Decent Pot for the Price', 'author': 'R. P.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'My biggest concern for buying Chinese-made enameled cast iron cookware is the possibility of lead content in the porcelain. I used a simple lead-testing swab for the interior of the pot, and it was negative. It was a crude test and while I do not trust the test result 100%, it was good enough for me since white porcelain is less likely to contain lead. The reason I took one star off is that the lid is not airtight. The reason enameled cast iron Dutch oven works well is because of the seal of the lid to keep moisture in during the braising process. I was disappointed and not at the same time because I was expecting too much at this price.It is a cute little pot, and the interesting shape allows me different ways to cook than a regular round pot. For example, I can boil veggies without breaking it up to fit the diameter of a round pot. I keep it on my stove top for everyday use without worrying too much about it. Overall, I am happy with the purchase.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 13, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect', 'author': 'Bossy', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've been looking for a medium size enameled cast iron pot and this is perfect. It is very easy to manage. Love it. Worth the money. Besides it's different and has two colors.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 8, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Not very non stick', 'author': 'ladylex', 'rating': 2, 'content': "I'm admittedly not much of a cook, but I've had things scorch very badly when I've cooked things in this pot. I used medium heat to cook in it. The pot scorched really bad, but at least the food I made was stiil edible. I kind of wish I'd returned this pot, even though I got it for a low price.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 7, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Love the innovative shape, easy to clean, enamel is cracking', 'author': 'Pentiumm', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'First, love the shape. Plus, since the handles make a flat surface when the pan is on its side, that makes it very easy to clean the outside of the pan (rather than a wobbly round pan). The handles are great‚Äîsturdy and easy to grab.I‚Äôve had the pan for about a month, used daily. And the enamel is cracking on the inside. See pics. Breaks my heart‚ÄîI really loved the shape.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars wanted to like it but', 'author': 'doggiemom5', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I really wanted to like it but the style is ok just feels awkward and lid did not sit well other than that the pot seemed like it was made well it was not too heavy I did not like the lid. sent it back because of the lid I could have gotten used to the semi square/oval of it but not the lid', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 23, 2021', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Goodful All-In-One Pot, Multilayer Nonstick, High Performance Cast Dutch Oven With Matching Lid, Roasting Rack And Turner, Made Without PFOA, Dishwasher Safe Cookware, 4.7-Quart, Sage Green
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great, versatile pan‚ÄîThis is a life saver for those with arthritis or arm weakness', 'author': "J. O'Donnell", 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I purchased this for my mother-in-law since she has arthritis in her hands and can‚Äôt lift anything heavy. This pan is incredibly light and it‚Äôs become a favorite with everyone who cooks in this kitchen. It holds a lot, cooks evenly and even gets clean in the dishwasher. I can‚Äôt say enough good things about this pan. You won‚Äôt be sorry if you purchase it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars SO glad I found these!', 'author': 'P Gilroy', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I was searching for a dupe for a more expensive all-use pan and Google led me to this one. Since I typically like certain types of pots/pans for certain uses, I was happy to note that there was not only a saut√© pan, but a Dutch oven style pot as well. I am enjoying both of them.The pot:The handle on the top of this one seems to be some kind of hard plastic, and I think it's because it's supposed to be oven safe. However, it's ONLY oven safe up to 400 degrees for 30 minutes per the instruction guide. It has smaller metal handles on each side that DO get HOT, so you'll want to have some kind of potholders or mitts at the ready when handling it. The sage green color is beautiful, and the nonstick surface on the inside of the pot is very smooth. Like many others, I cannot help wondering what it is made of, and I really hope that it is safe, because I plan to use these for many years to come if possible. I tend to cook soups, stews and chilis in a Dutch oven style pot, and this one has been extremely easy to use AND clean. It doesn't require a lot of heat to get going, and once it does I typically have to turn it down a bit. The nonstick surface is fabulously easy to clean, and I DO season the surface prior to storing it away. I also seasoned it prior to first use per the instruction guide. I have cooked chili, red beans and chicken soup, all with zero issues.The pan:This is a lovely piece of cookware to have on hand for saut√©ing and browning. It features a long soft touch handle on one side and a smaller metal handle on the other. Like the pot, you will want to have a mitt or potholder readily available if you plan to touch the smaller handle. The sage color is a perfect match to that of the pot. As many others have stated, it is pretty deep. I have cooked butter chicken and nacho meat and also boiled macaroni (and made the cheese sauce) in this one. All of the dishes came out perfectly, and the pan was super easy to clean. I also season the pan after use.I use silicone utensils to cook with, as I am not a fan of wooden spoons or spatulas.I noticed a bit of discoloration on the bottom of the pan after first use, and I'm not sure whether it was from letting water dry on it or what. I was able to use a cleaning paste to restore it, so I think that I will do this from time to time if I notice any further problems in the future. I also handwash these pots and will probably not put them in the dishwasher. I plan to provide an update in 3 months or so, since that is when several others have noticed issues with the cookware. As for now, I am totally in love with them and hope that that they will last for years to come.Update 1/14/2023: I no longer season the pan after each use and it is still beautifully nonstick. I'm still in love!Update: 1/28/2023: The underside of the handle of the saut√© pan is singed, as I have a gas stove. I do not have the flames up high, but somehow the heat has gotten to it. Hopefully this will not effect the performance in the long run, but it COULD compromise the integrity of the handle over time.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 25, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This pan is amazing! reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome!', 'author': 'Fantaisie D.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Finally, after waiting almost a year until I could afford to buy, it became my birthday present to myself. And as for weight, yes it is heavy, as expected for this size pot. But I am 81 and it is not too heavy for me. I do know how to care for these pots, and the dishwasher will dull the finish inside and out. Also, tomato sauces left in will etch the inside (it did on the Le Creuset). So, empty those things out rather than let them sit. I surely like this dutch oven. I will be making my bread in it this week, and it will get lots of use. I was on the fence for the 7 qt or this 6 qt, and I am glad I got this one. It is a nice size. I will say, cast iron cookware takes care. I dropped the heart shaped Le Creuset and it broke in half, and I had the shamrock which the handle broke off. So, high cost doesn\'t mean they are without issues. All need care and they can chip and the inside finish can flake off any brand. Take care of them and they will perform well. I am so pleased with the Lodge Brand. It has a good reputation and can withstand up to 500 degrees which I was looking for. I am thrilled with my purchase beyond words. It really is a quality pot. I really like the knob, it is larger than most LC\'s better grip, and I love the silicone pot protectors that came with it. Shipped perfectly in 3 boxes. Go for it. You won\'t regret it. The color selections are fabulous.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for Us!', 'author': 'I_Yam_Who_I_Yam', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We were looking for a Dutch Oven that would retain heat evenly, could master soups, stews, and spaghetti sauces, and could brown/caramelize efficiently. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Gorgeous Cast Iron Dutch Oven!!', 'author': 'PieTOgo', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I am very happy with this Mueller 6 Quart Enameled Cast Iron Dutch Oven. It is a beautiful and durable piece of cookware that can handle any kind of dish. It has a vibrant blue color that adds a pop of style to my kitchen. I love displaying it on an open shelf when not in use. It has a heavy-duty lid with a stainless knob that seals in the moisture and flavor of the food. It is easy to clean and maintain, and it works on all stovetops, including induction. It is also oven-safe up to 500¬∞F. I have used it to make soups, stews, roasts, breads, and more. Everything comes out delicious and tender. It is a great value for the money and I would highly recommend this dutch oven to anyone who loves cooking.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Simply Put: AMAZING', 'author': 'Stevo', 'rating': 5, 'content': "When it comes to elevating your cooking experience, few kitchen tools can compare to the Mueller DuraCast 6 Quart Enameled Cast Iron Dutch Oven Pot with Lid. This Dutch oven has quickly become an indispensable part of my kitchen arsenal, and I can't stop singing its praises.Exceptional Durability and Craftsmanship:The first thing that strikes you about this Dutch oven is its impressive build quality. Crafted from durable cast iron, it feels substantial and robust, promising a lifetime of cooking adventures. The enameled coating not only adds to its durability but also gives it a sleek and timeless appearance that enhances the aesthetics of any kitchen.Versatile and Multifunctional:One of the standout features of the Mueller DuraCast Dutch Oven is its incredible versatility. Whether you're searing, braising, roasting, simmering, or baking, this pot handles it all with ease. Its 6-quart capacity makes it ideal for preparing meals for both intimate dinners and larger gatherings. From stews and soups to pot roasts and artisan bread, the possibilities are endless.Even Heat Distribution:One of the hallmarks of cast iron cookware is its ability to distribute heat evenly, and the Mueller DuraCast doesn't disappoint. The heavy-duty cast iron construction ensures that every inch of your food receives uniform heat, leading to consistently delicious results. Say goodbye to hot spots and uneven cooking!Effortless Cleanup:Cleaning up after cooking can often be a hassle, but not with this Dutch oven. The enameled surface makes for a non-stick cooking experience, which translates into a breeze when it's time to clean up. A gentle soak and a soft sponge are usually all that's needed to have it looking as good as new.Beautifully Designed Lid:The Dutch oven comes complete with a snug-fitting lid that retains heat and moisture, allowing you to achieve that perfect slow-cooked tenderness. Its ergonomic handle ensures a secure grip, and the stylish knob adds a touch of elegance to the overall design.A Timeless Addition to Your Kitchen:Beyond its functionality, the Mueller DuraCast Dutch Oven is a timeless piece of cookware that adds a touch of elegance to any kitchen. Whether it's on display or in use, it's sure to catch the eye of your guests.In conclusion, the Mueller DuraCast 6 Quart Enameled Cast Iron Dutch Oven Pot with Lid has exceeded my expectations in every way. Its exceptional durability, versatility, and even heat distribution make it a must-have for any home cook or professional chef. It's an investment that will pay culinary dividends for generations to come. If you're serious about your cooking, don't hesitate to bring this Dutch oven into your kitchen‚Äîit's a game-changer.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have used this Dutch oven several times now and I am incredibly impressed with it! I have the expensive Le Cru. version in a larger size, it‚Äôs too large for meals for two. So I took a chance on this one, best decision I‚Äôve made in a while! Everything about it is better than my other one. I heats evenly and handles nicely. It is a dream to clean up, the interior has stayed beautifully creamy white. Seems like a backwards compliment to say it is amazing for the price point, it‚Äôs amazing at any price point! Don‚Äôt think twice.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A Culinary Revelation: My Dutch Oven Journey', 'author': 'Marta Fitzgerald', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've always considered myself a decent home cook, but it wasn't until I stumbled upon the magic of the Dutch oven that my culinary world was turned upside down. To say that I'm amazed would be an understatement; I'm positively enchanted by this versatile kitchen tool. Baking and cooking in my Dutch oven has become nothing short of a delightful obsession, and I find myself unable to resist the temptation to bake bread in it again and again.From the moment I brought my Dutch oven home, it felt like the missing piece in my kitchen puzzle. Its sturdy construction and classic design exude timeless elegance and durability. The heavy lid fits snugly, creating a perfect seal that traps in moisture and heat, resulting in dishes that are consistently mouthwatering.Let's talk about baking, shall we? I've always been a fan of freshly baked bread, and now, I can proudly say that I've become a bread-baking enthusiast. The Dutch oven's ability to mimic the environment of a professional bread oven is nothing short of astonishing. Every time I slide a perfectly shaped boule or artisanal loaf into the preheated Dutch oven, I'm met with the promise of a golden, crusty masterpiece. The high, even heat distribution and the steam retention within the pot create the ideal conditions for bread to rise and form a beautifully crisp crust. The resulting loaves are nothing short of artisan-quality, with a tender crumb and a rich, caramelized exterior.But the Dutch oven's talents don't end with bread alone. It's a true kitchen chameleon. Whether I'm braising a pot roast until it's fork-tender, simmering a hearty stew, or slow-cooking a flavorful chili, this culinary powerhouse never disappoints. Its remarkable heat retention ensures that my dishes are cooked to perfection, and the non-stick surface makes cleanup a breeze, even after those savory, sticky, slow-cooked marvels.The Dutch oven has also revolutionized my baking game. From mouthwatering casseroles to delectable desserts like cobblers and fruit crisps, this versatile pot has elevated my baking prowess to new heights. The even heat distribution ensures that everything cooks uniformly, and the easy transfer from stovetop to oven simplifies the cooking process significantly.In conclusion, my Dutch oven has become the hero of my kitchen. I can't help but marvel at its remarkable ability to transform my culinary creations into works of art. Baking bread in it has become a cherished ritual, and its versatility for all my cooking needs has left me completely enamored. If you're a passionate home cook or an aspiring bread baker, don't hesitate to invest in a Dutch oven. It's a game-changer that will forever redefine the way you cook and bake. In my kitchen, the Dutch oven is now the reigning champion, and I can't imagine my culinary journey without it", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 25, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Heavy and classic', 'author': 'fjc320', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Held heat perfectly while cooking our first pot of beef stew. Not only does it look classic, the ceramic makes for easy cleanups. Very well made and it's heavy.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Pretty to look at an very practical', 'author': 'Coolchick777', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Perfect pot for large suppers like chili or when you have a lot of pasta to make. Shown next to a smaller set of pots for reference (the other teal one is 3.5 quarts, the yellow is 2qt). The sale price made it a steal. It‚Äôs beautiful too. Very happy.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great addition to my kitchen equipment', 'author': 'Sheree L.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I recently started making sourdough breads, and wanted a cast-iron and enameled Dutch oven for that purpose. The prices for these items cover a very wide range, and frankly, I suspect some just have cashe‚Äô associated with the name. I‚Äôm an experienced cook and baker, and appreciate a quality piece of cookware, but I don‚Äôt think a name is necessarily exclusive to a great piece of equipment. I own a couple of items manufactured by Mueller, so out a large field of contenders, this Dutch oven stood out for a reasonable price, and the reputation for quality the manufacturer has earned from me. The item is heavy (be forewarned if you have problems with handling weight - like arthritis). But, a good cast iron Dutch oven of this size will be heavy, regardless. The color is gorgeous, and the enamel is beautifully applied. The lid fits tightly, allow the Dutch oven to circulate heat and retain moisture, which is what a Dutch oven does or should do. This Dutch oven is the perfect marriage of form and function, and it pretty enough to leave out on your stovetop or on a kitchen shelf. I highly and confidently recommend the Mueller Duracast 6 quart Dutch oven.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good Quality Product Marred by Small Details', 'author': 'Dex', 'rating': 4, 'content': "In terms of the Dutch Oven when it comes to cooking and cleaning this is a 5/5 product, so far. It also doesn't hurt that it is quite beautiful in the Grey finish that I purchased it in. The reason I'm giving this 4/5 stars instead of 5 is because of a few small details in the quality that tarnish this otherwise great dutch oven.1) As another reviewer had already mentioned, the lid fit on the dutch oven leaves a bit to be desired. It doesn't close completely flush and will leave one side slightly lifted up. Time will tell if this leads to a leak that allows steam to escape, if it does I will come back and bring this down to a 3/5.2) This doesn't affect the performance of the dutch oven whatsoever but as someone who works in manufacturing the lack of attention to detail and quality just bothers me. The handle on the top of the lid has the Mueller name laser engraved into it but the engraving was done with improper settings and instead of engraving the name nicely into the handle it instead burned the logo into it. As a result it almost looks like the logo is rusted, I know this is caused by improper power settings on their machine from first hand experience with laser engravers. Also, the handle was ever so slightly too loose out of the box, nothing that a quick turn of a screwdriver didn't fix though.3) There is a small and inconsequential blemish on one of the edges of the enamel on the lid. Does not look like it was caused by damage during shipping, but instead probably during the manufacturing process. Once again, does not affect performance of the lid but just sucks to see from a product right out of the box.Aside from these small details the dutch oven is a perfect size, heats very evenly, and maintains its heat effectively. I would recommend that when you first receive your dutch oven that you go through the steps of seasoning the exposed edges of cast iron under the lid and on the top of the dutch oven rim. It‚Äôs so worth the price and very cute.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nothing Exceptional but Gets the Job Done', 'author': 'Booksalottle', 'rating': 4, 'content': "The media could not be loaded. I‚Äôve owned this 4.5 Qt. Amazon Enameled Cast Iron Dutch Oven for almost two months and have used it three times to date. Upon arrival and at first glance, the gradient blue color is beautiful and super glossy; most importantly, the pot is heavy for its size - as it should be. It looks exactly like the product pictures, with a globular shape than square shape as others. Unfortunately, I also noticed that there was one pin hole and two tiny uneven protrusions on the enamel inside the pot.I own three other enameled cast iron cookware from two other brands (photos attached for size comparison) and performance wise, this cast iron by Amazon performs equally to them. The pot isn‚Äôt exceptional or special but it gets the job done. Other than the pin holes and protrusions, I have no complaints. This isn‚Äôt my first rodeo so when heating up the pot and while cooking, I have zero issues.I am starting the pan off at 4-Stars and will update my review as time progresses, or if I have any major issues with its durability or performance in subsequent months. For the amateur home cook, or for anyone who is new to cast iron cooking, below I‚Äôve included tips that you may find useful while using this or any other enameled cast iron cookware.================================Regarding the 3 Photos and 1 video I've Attached:(Note: all photos were taken with an iPhone under kitchen lights during the evening. Photos have not been edited nor enhanced.)Photo 1: Size comparison of this Amazon Enameled Cast Iron Dutch Oven compared to three other enameled cast iron cookware that I own from two other brands. From left to right: 7 qt. Tramontina, 4.5 qt. Amazon, 3 qt. Lodge 4 qt. Tramontina.Photos 2 and 3: fresh produce shown next to 4.5qt Amazon Dutch Oven for color and size contrast.Video: 4.5 qt. Amazon Enameled Cast Iron Dutch Oven on gas stove over medium heat, with food cooking.================================TIPS THAT YOU MAY FIND USEFUL While Using your cast iron dutch oven:(Note: I included these similar tips in my review of a different enameled cast iron pot from a different brand. My tips can apply to all enameled cast iron cookware)1. If you find that you have issues with food sticking, it could be that you are not heating up your cast iron pot properly to prevent undue hot spots.I heat my pot up gradually starting at low, then medium, then high heat. After my pot is very hot is when I add my fat/cooking oil. As the oil is heating up in the pot, I lift it and swirl the oil around to coat all sides of the pot that will come in contact with food.2. Take into consideration the temperature of the items you are adding to your heated pot. As a general rule for cooking: when ever possible, ensure that the items you are adding to a hot pot are at room temperature, rather than ice cold from the fridge; this will assist with even cooking.3. Also, get comfortable with adjusting your heat by lowering and raising it based on what you‚Äôve added to the pot. In general, you will need more heat at the beginning of the cooking process, and less heat towards the end. If you cook by recipe, I highly recommend that you read all the steps ahead before starting, so that you become familiarized with all the procedures, allowing you to maneuver accordingly when you start cooking.4. At the exception of searing meat to achieve a brown crust, deep frying, or when caramelizing onions, you should be stirring your pot (I recommend using a wooden spoon) every few minutes when cooking in cast iron that is placed over high heat. If you are braising on the stove at low heat versus braising in the oven, the frequency of your stirring will need to be adjusted. No matter how you‚Äôre cooking though, a watchful eye on the pot plus stirring, should both be a habit not an afterthought.5. For all cooking vessels in general but especially for cast iron: after cooking, allow your pot to cool down completely before cleaning. NEVER immerse a hot cast iron pot into cold water, nor pour cold dish water into hot pot. You risk not only being scald by dangerous steam, but you also risk weakening the enamel, therefore lessening the durability of your pots over time.6. This cookware and others like it from Tramontina and Lodge are economical and if used correctly, will perform well for most cooking; if used correctly, they should also last for years. Nonetheless, if you can afford it, authentic enameled cast iron cookware made in France by Le Creuset is the best way to go. Le Creuset is the gold standard in cast iron cookware and their quality is second to none. I definitely recommend this Amazon dutch oven but if you can afford to splurge, Le Creuset's reputation is stellar. As a professional chef, I've used them in high end kitchens and their quality and performance is premier.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 2, 2018', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I LOVE this pot!', 'author': 'Rebekah F.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I purchased this as a post-Christmas gift for myself. I consider myself a pretty good cook and I have a great selection of cookware--from plain cast iron to non stick and stainless. But never purchased an enameled pot. My sister has several and loves hers (like me, she loves to cook, too!) A couple of my large Dutch ovens were getting a little beat up after 30+ years of using them. I decided to look into an enameled one. I started doing a little research on the 'best' enameled dutch oven and I was absolutely gobsmacked when Amazon's brand came in second overall--even against the big, well-known brands! So, after checking it out here, and happily finding that it comes in RED, I ordered one.Since I got it, it has pretty much lived on my stove full time. I have made several soups , braises, and a vat of chili for Super Bowl in it. It cleans up beautifully. It IS heavy and it is big, but I love it. It has become my go-to pot for any soup, stew, chili, braise. It is just wonderful and I will probably buy the smaller one, as well. I just need to eliminate some of my lesser used cookware to make space for them. I do not think you will be disappointed with this purchase. FYI, I do hand wash ALL my cookware--even the ones that say dishwasher safe, and I do not stack my pots or pans without a separator between.As far as chipping of the enamel, I certainly have not had that issue, but then, I have only had this for a couple of months. But it has already been through some work and it has held up beautifully.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good quality and affordable', 'author': 'MacFlyer84', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'After a few uses, this Dutch oven is quality at a very reasonable price. No flaws, heavy duty, great heat distribution and easy clean up. The only flaw is the color: the Red oven is actually orange. Other than that great value and I recommend this product.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Dutch Oven. Great Price!', 'author': 'William Ryan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great Dutch Oven. I have 2 smaller Le Creuset Dutch Ovens and they, of course, are terrific. This one is a fraction of the cost of just one of my 4 1/2 quart Le Creuset Dutch Ovens. I am now able with this 6 1/2-quart Dutch Oven to bake sourdough bread without fear of having the dough held prisoner by the narrower vertical height from bottom of the Dutch Oven to the lid. I have baked several loaves of sourdough bread in this Amazon basic enameled Cast Iron Dutch Oven with no problems whatsoever. I love the larger capacity and I also love the far less expensive price. The Amazon basic version cleans up with no more elbow grease required that if I were baking in one of my Le Creuset Dutch Ovens. It appears to be a very durable piece of kitchen ware. Get one if you need a larger Dutch Oven to do sourdough bread baking!Bill Ryan, Sparks, Nevada', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars 6qt- Very good value', 'author': 'Mr. And Mrs. H', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have used this Dutch oven 5-6 times since it Arrived and I love it. title: Lodge Cast Iron Serving Pot Dutch Oven with Dual Handles, Pre-Seasoned, 7-Quart,Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars My favorite Lodge item! Perfect for bread.', 'author': 'Joe MacBu', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have been cooking with Lodge cast iron for about 7 years and own 8 pieces from their inventory. The Double Dutch Oven is my favorite Lodge cookware due to its versatility.When using a dutch oven, I usually sear the meat first to add flavor. Usually, this requires searing the meat in several batches. The best part about the Double Dutch is that you can sear the meat in the big pot and in the lid simultaneously, thus reducing the time needed to brown the meat by half. Since the lid is then used for the braising step (after deglazing), you\'re not increasing the number of items to be cleaned later.I like the lid so much that I often use it by itself for pan frying. Due to the smallish size (about 10 inches in diameter) and the inherent properties of cast iron, the lid can get incredibly hot if you want it to. Perfect for cooking a steak (it puts on a better crust vs my 12" Lodge skillet). I\'ve even used it as a pie pan in a pinch. When properly seasoned, the lid also works great for cooking eggs without them sticking. A seasoned cast iron pan is the original nonstick and will outlast any synthetic-coated nonstick pan in the market (and without the toxic fumes).When used as a Dutch Oven, it works like it should. It retains heat well and cooks evenly. There is very little steam that escapes. The smaller 5qt capacity (vs a 7qt Dutch Oven, which I use less now that I\'ve got this one) is also better for cooking moderate amounts of food. Generally, you want little empty space when using a Dutch oven.In response to the reviewer who has problems getting the lid off, I suggest the following. When setting the lid on the pot, don\'t align the handles of the two. This will allow you to remove the lid easily, without having to worry about injuries. I\'ve owned another Lodge 5qt Dutch Ovenwith a more traditional handle - I don\'t miss that one at all...nor do I miss not having a standalone 10" skillet.UPDATE (December 2010):I\'ve been using this thing for over two years now, several times per week. It is still my favorite, but ever more so. Here\'s one more thing that you can use this for: Baking super awesome bread that rivals anything you can get at your bakery. One of the secrets of making great rustic breads with a thick chewy/crunchy crust and great oven spring is to use a lot of steam for the first 10 minutes of baking. Bakeries use a steam-injected oven. For us at home, using a covered pot, such as this one, is the easiest way to replicate the effects of a steam oven. After shaping a boule, I place it on the lid, cover it with the main pot and let it proof (so the whole pot is upside down). When the dough is ready, I score it and place the covered pot on a preheated stone in the oven for 10-15 minutes. Then I remove the lid and let the top crust brown while the interior reaches the proper temperature. Depending on your oven, you might have to remove the bread from the lid halfway though cooking so the bottom doesn\'t burn - I usually put it on a cool baking tray on a rack without a stone. It\'s a minor inconvenience, but it\'s easier than trying to steam an oven with boiling water, ices cubes, mister, etc. And the results can\'t be beat!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 26, 2008', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Heavy, Dude', 'author': 'Tsacerof', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Well, it‚Äôs supposed to be heavy! Well made. Great value. Cooks evenly. Holds heat. Love the lid that keeps water from dripping around edges. Good design!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Not sure why I waited, oh yeah, the price', 'author': 'James Fox', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I bought the 2 quart version last month. I really like it for it's size and versatility if you're making a meal that you serve. I found that the 2 quart was a bit deep to eat directly out of so I looked at the 1 quart. I put it in my wish list since I couldn't convince myself that the 1 quart was more expensive than the 2 quart. Well last week the price of the 1 quart went down to more than $15 lower so I immediately place an order.I have purchased many Lodge pans from Amazon as well as Lodge itself. Except for the 12 inch Wok arriving in a generic Lodge box (order from Lodge) this 1 quart came factory sealed in a nice yellow Lodge box. This was the first thing that impressed me. Then I opened the box, there were a few excess seasoning around the handle edges but nothing that a little bit of use and re-seasoning can't fix.Even though it arrived late (9pm), I needed to find out if another reviewer was correct about it being the perfect size for a simple packaged ramen. As you can see in the attached picture, it was in fact a perfect size. The hard noodles were very slightly bigger in a couple of corners but a seconds in the boiling water took care of this issue. I usually don't cover ramen when I cook it, but since I had a cover, it worked perfect and it seemed like it helped with the cooking. No boil over at all. No issue with eating right out of the pan; mind the hot handles.Last night I tried out a concentrated Campbell soup. Again, perfect size for a the can content with a can of water. Covered again and heated on a low flame. Can out perfect and again was the right depth for eating right out of the pan.I was still hungry, so I wiped the pan, sprayed with vegetable oil and cooked up a ground beef patty, added onions, pepper and mushrooms. Very versatile. I've done this same thing with the 2 quart but I end up making too much. This 1 quart prevents me from over eating. Yeah, yeah, I should have stopped with just the soap but I was excited with my new pad.I see that today the price is still down so if you're on the fence, today is your day.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great piece of cookwear', 'author': 'R. Corso', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've been trying to collect functional, solid pots and pans, to replace the stuff I've randomly collected over the years. It occurred to me that iron pans would be the way to go, as there's no coating to flake off, no cheap handles to come apart, etc. And my skillets often seemed to not be quite enough for my much loved batches of chili or pasta sauce. That's where this came in. So far, I've used it numerous times, and it works wonderfully. Easy to clean, easy to use, and I don't have to scrape it with scouring powder. That's part of the wonder of iron.... if something doesn't come off perfectly, it basically\xa0joins in and becomes part of the flavor of the next food. :)I love it. Someday when I die, some unknown person will likely find themselves some nice cookwear. Whoever it is, I hope you enjoy it, and get more use ouf of it than I apparently will have.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good bread maker', 'author': 'Homer B', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Quick arrival. Great for no-knead bread. Heavy, as most cast iron cookware is. Mainly used in the oven, but sure it will work well on the stovetop. Comes pre-seasoned, but will continue to clean and oil after each use. Lid can be used as a skillet, but doesn‚Äôt have a handle. Takes up less room in the oven, but a little awkward as a frying pan. Would purchase again.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for baking sourdough, among other uses', 'author': 'LS', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love Lodge and this dutch oven is no exception, I use it mainly for my sourdough boules, there is no need for enamel that can be stained in the high heat of a 450+ *F oven, this works great. I use the skillet to hold the bread dough and the pot as the lid. title: 2-in-1 Pre-Seasoned Cast Iron Dutch Oven Pot with Skillet Lid Cooking Pan, Cast Iron Skillet Cookware Pan Set with Dual Handles Indoor Outdoor for Bread, Frying, Baking, Camping, BBQ, 5QT
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best sourdough Dutch oven for the price', 'author': 'Marc Lee', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Excellent quality. This is a very basic cast iron Dutch oven and it bakes the perfect sourdough bread loaf. I‚Äôve baked 12 innit this far and have another 10 to go. It‚Äôs absolutely as good as my $350 Le Creuset, and much leas stress if I stain it or mishandle it. This thing is just as good as ANY high dollar Dutch over. When I wrote this it was the cheapest one on Amazon for its size. It‚Äôs the perfect size, weight, and structure. Holds heat beautifully. The lid is particularly useful. It just bakes a perfect loaf. In fact, for baking, it‚Äôs better than the enameled Le Creuset. And you can beat it up because there is no fancy finish to scratch. Just love this thing. Sturdy and just right. Don‚Äôt know how those Chinese do it. I hate that a domestic cast iron Dutch oven Costa $200 and this does the same for $40.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 26, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Durable and even heat distribution', 'author': 'Haley', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Its durability and even heat distribution make it a kitchen essential. Whether I‚Äôm simmering stews or baking artisan bread, this versatile piece delivers exceptional results every time. The robust construction ensures longevity, and the enamel coating adds a touch of style. Cleaning is a breeze, and the lid‚Äôs tight seal locks in flavors. Investing in this cast iron Dutch oven has elevated my cooking experience, making it an indispensable part of my kitchen arsenal.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars SOLID CAST IRON', 'author': 'M. I haven't used the top to cook with--yes, the top can be used as a small skillet. A 2fer! Gonna Keep this .", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great price..good quality', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Nice heavy duty versatile camping cookware.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Cooks bread like a champ!', 'author': 'wei888', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Love the fact that the lid doubles as a frying pan but the texture is super coarse. It's going to be a nightmare to clean. However, once it's non stick, I assume it's going to be like any other cast iron pan and will eventually be a breeze to clean up.One note about the seasoning... I washed it before first use and there's a heavy odor of iron. Don't wipe with a paper towel because you'll just get paper towel dust all over the thing -- use a good cloth towel. Coat the pan with a good wipe of vegetable oil (I used peanut) and bake it in the oven again to re-season it before cooking in it.. you want everything to burn off before having food make contact with whatever they put on it at the factory. So far, my first loaf of bread came out perfect and there's no off flavor from the smoke from it's first use. I like this pot, you probably will too :)", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Season it first!', 'author': 'MMMartin', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is such a good value! Very versatile I have one thing to say‚Ä¶SEASON IT FIRST. It says ‚ÄúSeasoned‚Äù but it‚Äôs not Seasoned FOR COOKING! Coat LIGHTLY inside and out with oil. Wipe off. Put in Cold oven and let warm up to 500*. One hour later turn off oven and let cool. Your house will STINK. But you MUST do this. I did this twice and scrambled an egg in butter and it was as nonstick as any new Teflon! After cleaning with water while still warm, dry thoroughly on stove a couple of minutes and then give another light coating of oil. All good to put away.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly what one would expect from the pictures', 'author': 'Phil Boyd Studge', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I strongly recommend that Avocado oil or bacon fat be used to season these with.Use NO SOAP to clean.NOT DISHWASHER COMPATIBLE. Not light weight. Great for car-camping.I wipe mine out with a paper towel and a dab of fat because nothing sticks after some seasoning. More like sweeping than wiping.The parts serve well as two pans or as a workable dutch oven.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great for sourdough', 'author': 'mozart', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I‚Äôve made only 2 loaves with my new pot but am completely satisfied so far. Heats evenly and doesn‚Äôt burn the loaf bottom. Very easy to load the dough into the ‚Äòlid‚Äô instead of reaching or manipulating a parchment paper sling down a 450 degree 5‚Äù well. My first cast iron, and it‚Äôs a bit more trouble, but just a bit, and more than worth it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice heavy duty product', 'author': 'Holly Quant', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Used mostly for sourdough bread. The inside is a little rough but so far I love this product.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice heavy iron pot', 'author': 'This is a great product!definely ordering more!', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Just used pot !my food spoil as black stuff from cover fell in my food!probably black paint!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

So', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Love this pot, I use to make soups. It is heavy and the handles do get very hot, but I just use pot holders. I've been reading reviews saying it is hard to clean. I found an easy tip online to keep my pot clean -- as you can see from my photos, it looks almost new even after several uses. I put a small amount of liquid Glass Cook Top cleaner & polisher on a paper towel and wipe the specific spots where food is cooked in. With a little elbow grease, the stain wipes off like magic! I then soft scrub and thoroughly rinse the pot in hot water so there's no chemical residue. I've only used my pot several times so far, so not sure if this method works on caked in or longer term stains. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars My "Desert Island" Pot', 'author': 'Steven', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'In my opinion, this might just be the ultimate cooking vessel! It truly is a ‚Äújack of all trades‚Äù, yet it excels in so many!What isn‚Äôt this great for? It can handle searing heat, or low and slow, it can easily be transferred from the stove to the oven, and back again. It‚Äôs a great heat conductor with fantastic heat distribution so it can bake breads, deep fry, or keep a dish warm for serving. With a little aluminum foil and a small wire rack, you can even turn turn it into quite an effective makeshift mini-smoker!I use the 5.5QT version, which is a nice medium-to-large ‚Äúall around‚Äù size that can comfortably serve 6 people. It‚Äôs wide enough to easily use a spatula for flipping (it even sears a nice burger!), yet it‚Äôs also tall enough to go all out on nice chunky stew or bake an artisanal loaf of bread.The enamel coating is also an overall upgrade over traditional cast iron. It cleans up reasonably easily, and it won‚Äôt react to highly acidic foods such as tomato sauces. While it‚Äôs not exactly a non-stick surface, this is actually an advantage because it‚Äôs great for creating that perfect fond.On top of it all, it‚Äôs beautiful to look at. My Le Creuset Dutch oven sits on my stove as a permanent fixture because I use it for just about everything - from searing steaks to you-name-it!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars High quality.', 'author': 'Claudine', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Beautiful and very functional. title: Herogo 6 Quart Enameled Cast Iron Dutch Oven with Lid and Silicone Trivet Mat, Round Dutch Oven Pot Blue with Dual Handles for Bread Baking Stewing Roasting Various Stoves & Oven Safe
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent 6 qt Dutch Oven at a bargain price', 'author': 'Bonz4248', 'rating': 5, 'content': "First of all this Dutch Over came beautiful packaged, it was wrapped completely in foam to absolutely insure there would be no damage in shipping. The lid was surrounded in cardboard so it could not contact the pot and cause chipping or other damage.Upon removing the Dutch Oven and lid I was immediately impressed with the beauty and flawlessness of the enamel finish. The handles are large and easy to use, everything about the appearance and condition of the set was great.I've now used it to cook on my stove, in my oven, and on an induction heating plate and it worked well on all. The heat distribution was excellent and the food was delicious. The cleanup was easy as well.This product arrives with a set of very useful instructions and pointers that is well written by an obviouly native english speaking individual.I also have a 7¬Ω qt Le Cruset Dutch Oven and in the short run this one seems to hold it's own against it. I know Le Cruset items are supposed to last forever, and at this point I can't vouch for this one in the same way. However for such a great price this one is really a bargain and in my hands I can't tell much difference in the performance of either oven. I would thus highly recommend this Dutch Oven to you, I don't think you'll be disappointed.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing - true to picture', 'author': 'AKGIRL', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The cast iron pot is beautiful glazed and is a good value for the money as it appears expensive. 6Qt- should work for most family sizes. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Braises Wonderfully!', 'author': 'Dale in North Carolina', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've had this Dutch oven less than a month and already I've cooked several dishes with it. It looks gorgeous, cooks evenly, and cleans like a dream.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 11, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Get one NOW!', 'author': 'Hank Henry', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Performed amazingly.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Lovely Dutch Oven. How does it compare to a Lodge?', 'author': 'G. E. Graham', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This 6qt. blue Dutch oven from Mercer is truly lovely. This finish, both inside and out, is perfect; smooth and clean. It heats beautifully on our induction cooktop and, if it will heat evenly on induction, it will heat well on gas or electric.The design of the Mercer is almost indistinguishable from that of the Lodge 6qt. oven. There are a few exceptions: 1) The Mercer is a smidge taller. 2) The bottom of the Mercer is smooth and unadorned while the Lodge is stamped with their logo. 3) The lip of the lid on the Mercer has a few little stand-offs that the Lodge does not have. These keep the lid from having full enamel to enamel contact with the oven and, I assume, help to prevent chipping. I was concerned that these stand-offs might lift the lid so much as to allow steam/moisture to escape the oven in waves. However, a quick boiling-water test showed that the lid still seats well and keeps in the steam....I noticed no steam escaping from between the lid and the oven. 4) The Mercer oven weighs a significant 12oz. (2/3 lb.) more than the Lodge while the lids of each weigh the same. So, there is more iron in the Mercer which should provide better heat distribution and retention in the Mercer. So far, the Mercer has a slight edge on the Lodge. Now for 5) The knob on the top of the Mercer lid is not as substantial as that on the Lodge (see the photo with the Lodge knob on the left and the Mercer to the right). Even the screw is smaller, and a washer is used to help keep the screw and lid well attached. There is room for a larger screw, which would offer more support to a more substantial knob. This seems to me like a shortcut that is unseemly for such a nice dutch oven. Having said this, the knob is not loose or wobbly and I see no reason that it should affect your decision to buy the Mercer. In full disclosure, my Lodge oven was dropped and the enamel shattered so I took the knob off of my old Lodge and used it on the new Mercer....and I like it better that way.By every measure that matters, this Mercer Dutch oven is a winner and should be considered right along with (if not ahead of) the Lodge when making your buying decision....you won't go wrong with either. I highly recommend it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome!', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This Dutch oven feels like a very heavy, quality piece! title: Amazon Basics Pre-Seasoned Cast Iron Round Dutch Oven with Dual Handles, 2-Quart, Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Absolutely Perfect!', 'author': 'Austin David Lilly', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is a great product and I would definitely buy again. absolutely perfect! This cast iron pot with lid isn't just for cooking, you will make memories with your family and then one day it will be passed down to the next generation -cast iron lasts forever. Please do not hesitate to buy. (See Update Below)To care for this item: Once this pot is used and needs to be cleaned, preheat oven to 400 degrees. Boil in pot for two minutes or until food stuck to pot softens, etc. This is to sterilize the pot. Then scour this pot with dawn and brillo or some other metal scrubbing pad. Once all visible food is removed and pot appears clean, rinse with hottest water possible. Put pot and clean lid into the oven to dry. That's it :) No further efforts are required, no seasoning necessary. My family has used this method for more than twenty years on various cast iron pots and pans, I write this to assure you our method works perfectly.***UPDATE: Whenever food burns, due to the ridges in the bottom of the pan, it's extremely difficult to clean... I can't recommend this product. When buying a pan or skillet, make sure the bottom is smooth.God so loved the world that He gave His one and only Son. Anyone who believes in Him will not die but will have eternal life. John 3:16 NIRV ‚ÄúBelieve in the Lord Jesus [as your personal Savior and entrust yourself to Him] and you will be saved, you and your household [if they also believe].‚Äù Acts 16 :31 AMP And if anyone‚Äôs name was not found written in the Book of Life, he was hurled into the lake of fire. Revelation 20:15 AMPTherefore if anyone is in Christ [that is, grafted in, joined to Him by faith in Him as Savior], he is a new creature [reborn and renewed by the Holy Spirit]; the old things [the previous moral and spiritual condition] have passed away. Behold, new things have come [because spiritual awakening brings a new life]. 2 Corinthians 5:17 (Amplified Bible)", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great value', 'author': 'Kindle Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'So far have only used it to bake bread which is why I got it. Good quality.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful product', 'author': 'Peggy Parson', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Just what I wanted, a pot that is sturdy, large, and already cured. Perfect for a mom with a large family to cook for!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good Cast Iron', 'author': 'Miss Maggie', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I'm in my fifties. I'm from the south. I've been cooking with cast iron since before I was strong enough to lift it. This is a good pot. I liked the 2-quart pot so much that I bought a second one. Now I have two. Both pots were from the warehouse, discounted because they had been returned. They both work flawlessly. I have had cheap cast iron from family dollar and upscale cast iron from Cabellas. This pot from Amazon is mid range. Its not as nice as my great grandmother's pre-WW1 pot, but its about as good as Lodge. I like this size for cooking rice (2-cups dry, 4 cups water, 20 minutes on low after boiling). It makes better rice than you've ever had from a rice cooker and it keeps the rice warm for at least an hour without burning. Just leave the lid on and take it off the stove after cooking. It's also perfect for cooking dried beans. Whether you cook plain beans or add bacon or ham hocks (or turkey necks) for seasoning, the beans cook fast and evenly. They do not have to be watched every minute. On medium-low, covered, they're tender in an hour (assuming you soaked them overnight). I can cook beans in one pot, rice in the second pot, and dinner requires almost zero attention. Since I do a lot of simmering in my pots, they require regular care. I wash them with a scrub brush and a dab of Dawn dish detergent. I have never put one in the dishwasher. I think that would be foolish. After washing, I let them drip dry for a few minutes and then dry with a dish towel. Finally I rub cooking fat on both the lid and pot with a paper towel. I use vegetable oil. My grandmother used Crisco. My great-grandmother used lard. My mother didn't use cast iron, she preferred teflon. In my experience the type of cooking fat really does not matter. When the pot becomes rusty, as it inevitably will, there is a simple solution. Rub it liberally with the fat of your choice and cook it in the oven on low overnight. Voila! Instant no-stick coating. Cast iron is the very best cookware ever created. Even cheap cast iron lasts your and your grandchildren's lifetime. Just rub it lightly with fat after washing and then season it a couple of times a year. It never wears out and it adds iron to your diet which is especially nice for pregnant and nursing moms. The 2-quart pot from Amazon is reasonably priced for a pot that will last at least 2-lifetimes and its good enough quality to justify its price. If your pot is rusting, that's your fault and you have the power to correct it. If you don't, then that's on you, not the pot. By all means give it away to somebody who will appreciate it.
