Looking forward to gumbo or chili nights!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': False}]

title: Scanpan Classic 6.5 Quart Covered Dutch Oven
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly what you expect.', 'author': 'James Wakeley', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Perfect size for winter cooking, and super easy to clean. Made well, of high-quality material.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Scanpan is my all-time favorite', 'author': 'Faith', 'rating': 5, 'content': "First, there is a discrepancy in the reviews about the size of the 4-qt pan. The box says 5.25qts (now the smallest Dutch oven style Scanpan makes but out of stock on their website) but the pot itself that I ordered directly from Amazon is 4qts. I filled it with water and it's 4 qts to within an inch of the top.I have some Scanpan cookware that I have had for years. Frying pans lasted at least five years - pans we used every day. But it was time to replace the big stock pot and the 3.5-qt Dutch oven. The 3.5qt with the double handles is no longer made, so I looked for a replacement and did a lot of research on non-stick cookware. Even though I have a great stainless set, I'm not making my holiday cranberry sauce in anything but non-stick.Scanpan still gets the highest marks for durability in reviews, and now with improved coatings. Most important, it's quality cookware. I've had it with my husband coming home with pans from the junk closeout stores that last a month, especially when he uses high heat and metal utensils. I told him - no more new pans for you until you mend your ways, and he has.I will say that it's probably not quite as hefty as the pans I bought 15 years ago, but still very well made and sturdy. I tested its heat distribution: perfectly even bubbles when boiling water. No hot or cold spots anywhere. It also retains heat extremely well. Even my husband noticed that he had to turn down the heat after it was completely heated. My husband's chili was beautifully evenly cooked. And everything slides right out. I've hidden all the metal utensils and I make sure he doesn't go over medium heat. No matter what any non-stick cookware manufacturers tell you, NO metal, NO heat over medium, and hand wash. These are the keys to long lasting non-stick cookware.We originally bought our Scanpan cookware at a really true closeout store, and I didn't even know it was still sold in America. Of course, I can't attest if it will last over a decade like my original Scanpan cookware. If I have any issues, I will certainly edit my review.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 19, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome brand', 'author': 'graciela amaya', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love this pan, it‚Äôs excellent to cook well the food and cleaning easily. Great invest', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 27, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Scanpan rocks!', 'author': 'jocerana', 'rating': 5, 'content': "After reading ratings in Consumer Reports, I gave my old set to my niece when she got her first apartment and carefully choose Scanpan classic pots and pans to make a small but complete set as they are a little pricey. Amazon's prices were as inexpensive as I found. I love them! They cook evenly and clean up so easily it's almost ridiculous.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 19, 2013', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Not as described', 'author': 'jp777', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'This is a 6.5 liter (7 quart) pot not a 6.5 quart, clearly stated on the box. Very disappointed I did not get a 6.5 quart. Returned.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 13, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great pot; beware handle on lid; highly recommend', 'author': '–êmazon\xa0Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Love this pot and use it once a week. Only word of caution, the screw holding the handle onto the lid loosens over time and can come off. It dropped off on my husband and shattered on our tile floor. Fortunately, we had another one. Just be aware and check each time you use.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 25, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A very good pan', 'author': 'Jo Ann Hakola', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Cooks well and is easy to clean.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 28, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Interior chips', 'author': 'Linda Dazey', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'Have used this 4 times and the finish is chipping on interior. Have already sent back one, now here we go with another one. There is no free return shipping, so get ready to pay a high price just to return and be sent another one that will probably do the same thing. THUMBS DOWN!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 15, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars different color', 'author': 'Karyn W', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I do like my Scanpans, so far. They clean so easily. And they\'re relatively light weight compared to my other set of "good" cookware, making them easier to use and wash (though not so light that they seem at all cheap or flimsy). I haven\'t had them long, so don\'t know how well they\'ll last.What annoys me about this pot is that, while my other two Scanpan Classic pieces are a dark gray, this one is black. Not terribly important, I know, but I did want a matching set.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 16, 2018', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Cleaning ease', 'author': 'pseudandry', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'After years and years of using our old scanpan, and not saving the receipt for its warranty, we both this new one. Not as sturdy(?), hefty(?), substantial (?) as the older models, but still easy to clean and good heat distribution.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 12, 2020', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Lodge L8DO3 Cast Iron Dutch Oven, Pre-Seasoned, 5-Quart,Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This is HUGE', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "9 Quarts. Nine. That's around twice what a normal enamel dutch oven holds, which average around 4 or 5.This thing is big enough to cook almost anything you want. It can replace an entire set of pots and pans for one-pot/one-pan meals. It's wide enough to use as a skillet, it's got enough capacity to use as a stock pot. It can be thrown in the oven or into hot coals. You can probably even use it like a griddle and put short handled pots or pans into it, though I haven't tried this. If you have enough space I don't doubt you could broil in this thing as well. I'm pretty sure it can fit a whole bird, so if you throw a trivet in you won't need a special purpose pan for the holidays either.But that also is a downside. It's big, it's heavy, you need a lot of space to clean it. If your sink is wide and deep enough, no problem. But if you have a small apartment sink? It can be a little tough. The actual methods and ease of cleaning is the same as any cast iron. And the handle is a great one with a wire bail for grip and (stovetop only) insulation.If you want to meal prep, this can do it. If you're cooking for a family, this will handle it. If you do potlucks, you'll make enough for everyone. With a large pot comes the ability to process large amounts of food, so if you're being frugal this can save effort as you're not having to cook in small batches.Anything bigger and you're outside the territory of a normal domestic kitchen, and into the realm of outdoor cooking or high end huge ovens.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This is heavy', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Can't go wrong with Lodge cast iron Dutch oven. Retains heat very well Cooks evenly just a great cast iron Dutch oven. Just know that this is heavy if you have problems lifting you might think about it. On the other hand for all those who love cooking with cast iron this is the product! You can make cobblers, stews, beans, stewed apples, just a wonderful cook pot. Do yourself a favor by yourself one, by a friend or family member one of these. You will not be disappointed. Be sure after you have washed and dried this pot that you keep it oiled and you don't want to wash it with a lot of harsh chemicals or soap nor do you want to soak it in water for very long. After you've washed it you can put it on the burner and dry it that way turn your burner off and then take some oil while your pan is still warm and season your skillet or your Dutch oven or what other cast iron you're using. Maintaining cast iron Dutch oven. Lodge is my go-to for cast iron cookware.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Game changer!', 'author': 'Liz', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is my first Dutch oven. So far, I‚Äôve only used it to bake bread but am looking forward to finally being able to follow recipes that call for cooking on both the stove and in the oven. It will also be great to use over a campfire on camping trips! It is heavy but it also seems to be top quality. It should last for at least a lifetime!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very sturdy', 'author': 'Susan Holsan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Love my Lodge Dutch oven! Great for fixing meals when all of the family gathers. Great for the stovetop, oven, and pellet smoker. Only comment I have, which is not negative, is that it is very heavy! But it is, after all, quality cast iron! Again, love it and recommend it!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great size', 'author': 'Steph Jose', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is the perfect size! I tried the 7 quart which was way too big. This will be perfect for my Dutch Oven bread. üëå', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Wanted this for about 6 months. Amazon had an open box deal for $42. SCORE!!!', 'author': 'MBeau58', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I'm thrilled with this purchase. I purchased a 5qt Lodge Dutch Oven which I love. But, I wanted something that would fit a large roast or meal because I like cooking for my whole family. Even if it's just the two of us, I like cooking extra so I can freeze some. I've been looking specifically at this pan & wanted to buy it when the price was around $60. But, I needed other things at the time. This was a want, not a necessity. Then the price started going up to over $70. I found this offered by Amazon for $42 because the original packaging was damaged. But, the pan is brand new. It arrived & the Lodge box was in one piece but had been taped in several places. The pan was in perfect condition. I took the chance because Amazon would take the pan back if I wasn't happy with it. The pan is well made as are my other Lodge pans. I like using this brand because it is made in the US & I don't have to worry about questionable metals being used. The handle really makes it easy to lift the cover. I'm still getting used to cooking with cast iron. But, having this size pan will make it possible to cook larger items or large one pan meals. The pan is quite heavy. I'm 60 yrs old, female, & not in the best shape of my life right now. But, I can still lift the pan to use it. Of course, it will be even heavier when full. Still, I'm sure I'll be able to lift it. Just be aware that if you don't have arm strength, you might find this a bit difficult to maneuver. That said, it'll be worth it. I cooked fried chicken in it the other day. My chicken came out perfect & the pan cleaned up in a breeze. I've slowly been purchasing different Lodge cast iron pans as I have found that many things I cook come out better in the cast iron pans. Also, even though the pans are preseasoned, I season them 2 more times just to be safe. Foods rarely stick to the pans. When they do, I use the small scraper & brush that come in the Lodge Seasoned Cast Iron Care Kit Red Hot Handle Holder. I also use a cast iron chainmail cleaner. The pans are so much easier to clean than my expensive hard anodized nonstick Circulon pans or my stainless steel pans w/ copper bottoms. My daughter, son-in-law, & 2 grandkids love to go camping. They love using cast iron to cook over a campfire. My son-in-law was amazed at the price I paid for this pan on Amazon. It retails on the Lodge website for $120. Guess I'll watch for another bargain price on this & buy one as a Christmas gift for them.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 11, 2018', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars LODGE is the Best!', 'author': 'Pam R.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I got this Dutch Oven for a friend‚Äôs birthday. She really enjoys it! I have many cast iron LODGE cookware; cooking in them for years. They‚Äôre the best! Easy to clean and take care of, and will last forever.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Worth the money!', 'author': 'Tori', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. This cast-iron Dutch oven came preseasoned and is worth it‚Äôs weight and gold. I love cast iron for its durability and safe cooking! We prefer it to nonstick or ceramic because it will last forever if you take care of it. This particular item is 9 quarts and holds an 8 pound bone in pork shoulder. We use it most for cooking large batches of Carnitas for family gatherings. I highly recommend getting the preseasoned one because the lodge does it perfectly for you, then all you have to do is maintain it. We are going to end up passing this Dutch oven down to our kids one day.üòâ', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 6, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Gift for my man', 'author': 'Jess', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'He told me sometime last year that he wanted to cook something in a dutch oven over fire and I decided that his birthday this year that would make a good present. He doesn‚Äôt like gifts, so I just made it casually appear on top of his woodstove and when he noticed it, he got so excited!!!!! üòÜ We can‚Äôt wait to try different recipes in it, whether on the woodstove /oven/campfire. If you love someone, buy them some Lodge cast iron‚Ä¶ ü§åüèºüòç', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Lodge cast iron cookwares are the best!', 'author': 'Gerald Burris', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Nothing fancy about this Lodge Cast Iron Dutch Oven. title: Stansport Pre-Seasoned Cast Iron Dutch Oven
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Compact size but very heavy-duty w/thick side, base & lid -- great for so many uses!', 'author': 'SuLu', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is such a versatile little cast iron Dutch oven. I have been wanting a cast ion mortar and pestle and so far the largest one I have found is 16-ounces and I ended up ordering it. The pestle is great -- very heavy and solid and it is very sturdy. However, the mortar doesn't quite measure up -- it seems rather small in comparison to the pestle and it is also considerably lighter in weight than I expected + the sides and base are fairly thin (for cast iron, anyway). I thought this Dutch oven might make a good substitute for the mortar even though it doesn't have the usual rounded bottom. It works perfectly! And the entire construction is very heavy and robust with very thick sides and base. This will be useful for so many other things, too. I like the cute shape and I'll be using it for butter on baking day, for BBQ sauce when grilling and it is excellent for small meals for just one. I like the heavy-duty lid, too; it has a flat top to allow coals to be placed on it if the oven is to be nestled in a campfire and there is a ridge around the inner circumference to help keep it in place, but still allow enough movement so I can actually open it when I want to. The logo and little loop handle has a charming, vintage look, too. Of course, being made of cast iron, this will need occasional seasoning. The price is fantastic, as well. I'm very happy to have found this...", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cast Iron Dutch Oven - & Functional!Cute', 'author': 'Patty836541', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This 2 qt cast iron Dutch Oven is lovely! reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars What a deal', 'author': 'Urmelausdemeis', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Love this pot, it is light weight, non stick, easy to clean, and you can bake bread in it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars its very nice', 'author': 'Norma L.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I like this pan and I will use it a lot.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Lightweight, yet will not hold heat.', 'author': 'stampy', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I use this pan all the time. It is attractive, the non stick finish works well, easy to clean and so easy to cook an egg or two and clean up afterward. But it's not good for Indian food, large stews or even thicker chops, or what you call braising.It loses a star just because they could've put a heatproof handle on top instead of an aluminum one. I replaced the knob, there are many available on Amazon that work, just so I could remove the lid without two mits (one to hold the slippery pan, the other to remove the top).Now, this pan, being very lightweight and aluminum, cannot really be used as a dutch oven, because the heat is transmitted quickly from the burner to the pan (and lid !) and sometimes it seems the pan sides and lid get hotter than the food. For real dutch oven use, try a heavy cast iron (w ceramic coating) a Le Creuset or clone. But I don't detract any stars because it's unfair to compare this to a much more expensive, heavy pan and you can't have it both ways, there's no getting around the laws of thermodynamics", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 4, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love this pot!', 'author': 'Tammy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'But first attracted me to this pot was the color. title: Cuisinart French Classic Tri-Ply Stainless 4.5-Quart Dutch Oven with Cover
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars French Beauty!', 'author': 'NHReviewer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Excellent size and shape to perform many tasks; quality make and drop dead gorgeous (yes, for a pot!). I added this one to my kitchen after collecting a few pieces of Cuisinart French Classic to replace my old cookware. This one can replace pots 3.5 - 5 quarts in my opinion. I have used it to boil pasta (1 lb dry pasta) and fresh corn (6 medium size ears of corn). It did a beautiful job. Initially I wish for a glass lid but the stainless lid is an integral part of the pot and so beautiful it is just fine! Also, love the loop handles instead of stick handles!I did quite a bit of research -- as much as I would love to own All-Clad, I believe Cuisinart French Classic is a close match-up in quality, made in France and without the exorbitant price. It is the best I can get without paying All clad price. To set the record straight, the height of the pan is 4" (without lid) and the diameter is 9.5" (without handles). This item displays on my stove daily now.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 20, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars the measurements in the description are wrong- but this is a perfect sized pot', 'author': 'JennaC', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a lovely pot. It is the perfect size to use every day for pasta, greens, chili, soups, etc.Be aware - the measurements they quote for the pot are wrong. I suspected as much becausei was trying to replace a 4.5 qt. pot I already had- The ACTUAL dimensions of this highlyversatile pot are 4.5" high and 9.25" diameter. And it\'s really PRETTY also. It\'s a great every day pot. I love that i can hang it easily on my pot rack also because it has sturdy handles. Very happy with this.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 25, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love these more then All Clad', 'author': 'Michelle M.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The way these feel in your hands are just amazing! These are thick and heavy, the handles are PERFECTLY shaped. This is a very good sized pot, one that will get used frequently! Great for cooking rice, pasta, anything that needs to be boiled. I just ordered their 2 qt sauce pan for cooking smaller side items like peas or making my breakfast porridge in. I have gone into a kitchen store and handled a huge variety of pots and pans, these by far felt the best in my hands. I have an All Clad skillet and I don't care for the way the handle feels in my hand. I wish I had the Cuisinart French Classic skillet instead.Here is my list of must have pots and pans (in case you don't want to buy a set)Le Creuset 5.5 qt dutch ovenLodge cast iron skilletCuisinart French Classic skilletCuisinart French Classic 4.5 qt dutch ovenCuisinart French Classic 2 qt sauce pan", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2014', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Highly recommended', 'author': 'FeebleOne', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Heats up quickly, solid construction, love the dimensions, can throw in the dishwasher. I wish it had was a see-through lid, but that's minor. Minus one star, because the handles will get hot, so will need mitts. (Got spoiled by a similar sized Calphalon pot where I didn't need mitts to hold when hot) Minor quibbles aside, I'd highly recommend this.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 25, 2014', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works as good as it looks', 'author': 'ACAR', 'rating': 5, 'content': "4.5 Qt Stainless Dutch Oven -- high quality multi-layered stainless dutch oven works great in the oven and stove top and is easy to clean. Sufficient thermal mass for an effective dutch oven without unnecessary weight. Takes a little while to heat up on the stove but that's to be expected. Perfectly sized for cooking for two. Highly recommended.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 13, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Absolutely TERRIBLE quality. Surface ruined after a single use.', 'author': 'Laura', 'rating': 1, 'content': "Looked nice at first. Heavy. Flat bottom. Lid fits well. One minor catch though, you can't cook in it or the surface is ruined! It has all these splotchy white blemishes that look like it's trying to chip or rust or something? After one use? What. Stainless steel should be able to go for years and scrub clean. This has only been used to boil water once and it's already ruined. Those white spots aren't cooked on food, they don't scrub off even with barkeeper's friend, they're actually permanent damage. Not sure if this one defective or if these are always terrible, but either way I got a bad product.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Dutch Oven', 'author': 'Dee', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I had wanted a Dutch over that I could lift and wasn\'t too big-this is it. Very nice mirror finish on the outside It\'s all stainless, even the lid. The handles and lid do get hot when cooking... the handles are large and easy to grab. The Direction say you can put it in the oven up to 500 degrees. It\'s made in France and made very well. It\'s heavy, but in a good way. I am so impressed with this line that I just purchased the 10" skillet.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2015', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This is a very nice dutch oven', 'author': 'G53', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a very nice dutch oven. I rated it high because of that. I ordered several stainless pots at the same time all made by Cuisinart. I wanted nice looking but functional cookware. If I had this to do over I would probably not spend $100 for this one piece. Several of the others were a third of the price and were very nice as well. It gets down to choice. This is the French Classic and has a little different shape. All the Cuisinart that I purchased should not be set at high while cooking. They were very similar with slight shape and size differences. You may prefer this style but for my needs other Cuisinart products would have worked just as well. Good luck and good cooking.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 12, 2016', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars A nice pot', 'author': 'ËåâËéâËä±', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I'm happy with the pot, it's a nice shape and size. It's so light weight, it makes cooking feel so easy. The only thing I don't like is the handles get really hot. I was using a caphalon that I accidently bought nonstick when I was pretty unknowledgeable about pans and it's handles would get a little hot after it had been cooking for a while but this one is much worse. I was debating between this pot and a stainless steel caphalon and while I like this pot, I can't say it's a clear winner although I am keeping it and I love the shape. It feels like more than a pot, like a wok or something. Making curry in it feels right.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 3, 2016', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I love it', 'author': 'Amar', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I know, this product a pocket pinch, but trust me its worth a buy.I cook too many Indian gravy and dishes with this, and I must say, it does wonders.Cleaning is super easy as well.Its heavy which is why it sits fitted on the electric coil.This is first time using stainless steel, and I love it. Hence, 4 Stars.I will definitely recommend this.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 14, 2020', 'is_verified': True}]

My only complaint is the paint chips off SOOOO easily. I wish there was a top coating or ceramic sealant on top.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful Minimalist Dutch Oven: A Stylish and Versatile Addition to Your Kitchen', 'author': 'Mark illy', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The Urooloo 2722 enameled cast iron Dutch oven pot with lid is a beautiful and minimalist kitchen tool that offers both style and functionality. Its square golden ratio appearance is visually pleasing, and the 3-ply porcelain enamel exterior not only adds to its aesthetics but also makes it easy to clean. This Dutch oven is versatile and suitable for various cooking methods, whether it's on an induction stovetop, electric, ceramic, or in the oven, and it can handle temperatures up to 500 degrees Fahrenheit.One notable feature is its spacious volume, which allows it to hold more food than a round Dutch oven of the same diameter. This makes it perfect for a range of cooking purposes, from braising long ribs to baking square loaves of bread. The heavy-duty cast iron construction ensures unmatched heat retention and uniform heating, making it ideal for slow-cooking, simmering, braising, baking, and more.The lid of this Dutch oven is designed to lock in moisture and flavor, resulting in juicy and tender roasts. It's also great for creating a moist environment when baking goods, keeping them tender and flavorful. The pan tips until there is food in it which is very annoying!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love this cookware but pay attention to heating and cleaning instructions', 'author': 'Tina', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Absolutely love this cookware. Following instructions for use carefully and haven't had a scrub a pot since. Anything that does stick a bit, I just heat some water in it and add a bit of salt and then swish around a paper towel with my silicone spoon and it's clean - but hardly ever need to do this. Be sure not to overheat as well - pay attention to the max amt of heat you should use and that also protects the non-stick qualities - I had to get used to cooking at a lower temp than I had before but got used to it. I bought some felt to put between pots for storage to protect the finish from small scratches and also take care to put it in a place in the drainer where sharp items won't scratch. Seems like a lot to protect them but these easy habits forms quickly and makes cooking/cleanup so much easier. Pots were a little pricey but so glad I got them - with proper care, I believe they will last a good long time and the ceramic coating seems to be one of the healthiest options for non-stick cookware.One caveat - you might want a different dedicated pot for cooking pasta that you could put on higher heat - takes a long time to heat up a large pot of water with the lower temp requirement for this series.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 17, 2022', 'is_verified': True}]

Other than that I love cooking with these pots on a regular stove.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Rough finish with good results', 'author': 'Richard Rivera', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The IMUSA Caldero is the cheapest option for cooking Caribbean style rice with that specific kind of pot. It is approximately 8 1/4 inches in diameter (2 Qt. And sufficient for 1 to 3 people), made of aluminum single piece construction, where the handles are not bolted on but rather part of the unibody cast in one piece, which means that they get very hot when you‚Äôre cooking. The pot has sharp edges, a rough embossed bottom, which will definitely scratch any glass-top cooking surface, and the lid has a screw-on knob (plastic ?) that never gets hot during cooking. The pot arrived wrapped in plastic with minor grease stains on the inside of the lid and pot. This is clearly not a premium product, but it is affordable and works acceptably well. Even though I seasoned the pot with a light coating of oil and letting it heat up, twice, there was still a bit of sticking of the rice. This is fairly typical and not a problem. Whatever doesn‚Äôt come out in the serving, will be loosened by letting it soak overnight with a bit of water. Although I am not happy with the rough finish and scratchy bottom of the pot, it does work really well. It is good values for money IF YOU TAKE THE TIME TO SEASON the pot. Seasoning the caldero does help the cooking process and you will get less sticking. I have cooked traditional ‚Äúrice and beans‚Äù twice with it with great results. If you don‚Äôt expect a premium product, you will be pleased.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Size is best for a neighborhood feeding', 'author': 'Thedy Legros', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This size was WAY too big for our family, we were looking for more of a paella pot where we could fit enough in without overflow. However, it was difficult, without putting it on a fire or grill big enough to fit, to cook on the stove without uneven cooking. It one of my most used pot in my kitchen.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Thumbs up cast iron pot.', 'author': 'Chrissy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Needed a heavy pot to make fudge for the holidays. It worked beautifully. Absolutely no scorching. Only dislike I have about cast iron is how heavy it is but on the other hand you need a heavy pot from time to time. It will last forever with proper care.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 22, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love my Dutch!', 'author': 'Jen Teel', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Such a great Dutch Oven. It‚Äôs my favorite pot for anything stovetop in addition to bread baking.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars High quality product.', 'author': 'Wayne M', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We replaced our Teflon coated Dutch oven with a cast iron model that won\'t "shed". This is a high quality product that can be used for beef or pork roasts and any other oven or stove top use.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fun way to cook', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I am a fan of cooking with cast-iron products, some people are afraid of using this type of product. There is more work on the front end because you have to season the pans, but after that, they actually clean pretty easily with just warm water and a nylon scouring pad. The biggest advantage with cast-iron is it cooks very evenly, so my pot of baked beans is not burning on the bottom because the entire pot is the same temperature. Make sure you clean it immediately after cooking and wipe it down with some oil for storage and you‚Äôll have a lifetime of use out of this.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Solid Dutch Oven with a Minor Drawback', 'author': 'b g', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I recently purchased this Dutch Oven and overall, I'm quite pleased with its performance and versatility in the kitchen. This durable cooking pot has proven itself to be a reliable companion for various cooking needs. However, there is one drawback worth mentioning that prevents me from awarding it a full five-star rating.the one downside I've encountered is that the Dutch Oven has a tendency to develop rust if water is left inside for a period of time. While it's important to note that this can be easily avoided by promptly drying the pot after each use, it would have been more convenient if the Dutch Oven was more forgiving in this regard.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great pot', 'author': 'Carol Cook', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Bought for my husband at Christmas time he loves to cook. Great product will recommend.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cast iron is the best cooking pot I have. Love it.', 'author': 'Nancy Murphy', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I love cast iron cooking couldn't wait for my stock post to srrive.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing Dutch Oven', 'author': 'Teerah Gliwa', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was so impressed during unboxing this. The packaging was attractive and full of information. I followed the instructions for seasoning it and have used it for sourdough bread baking and soup. It‚Äôs been perfect and easy to clean.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Wash with warm soapy water and dry with soft cloth as soon as it arrives', 'author': 'Benjamin L.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Once I followed the instructions I found on the internet on how to season, it was a breeze. Wash the Dutch oven and lid with warm soapy water with non abrasive scrub pad to remove all manufacturing residue, rinse with warm clean water then dry with a clean, white lint free rag. Failing to use a lint free rag will result in the fabric threads getting stuck to the coarse pan metal finish. If you fail to follow these directions you will be shellacking all the excess fabric threads into the pan when it seasons in the oven. Start from scratch to remove if this happens. Preheat oven to 350 and place a sheet of tin foil on the rack below to catch residue.Once you have cleaned and dryer the Dutch oven, take a clean lint free rag, dip it in olive or grape seed oil and wipe on a thin sheen of oil on the inside of the Dutch oven, lip and handles. Make numerous passes to ensure you get the oil into all the pores. There should not be any oil dripping off this pan when done. Flip the Dutch oven over and wipe a thin sheen of oil on the bottom and sides of the Dutch oven and ensure you apply to the bottom of the handles also. Repeat this same process over on the top and bottom of the lid. Putting on a thick layer of oil will result in a very sticky finish on the Dutch oven. When done open the oven and place the Dutch oven on its top with the bottom facing up. Set the lid with handle up next to Dutch oven. Set time for one hour and allow pan to season. Once this has completed, leave the oven closed and allow the Dutch oven to cool to room temperature in the oven. Take the Dutch oven out and repeat the seasoning and heating process twice more always ending with a thin sheen of oil prior to placing back in oven. You are now ready to use this Dutch oven for cooking.To clean, wipe out excess food residue and cooking oil from the Dutch oven and lid using clean paper towels. DO NOT USE water or soap to clean your pan after cooking. You will destroy the seasoning. If there is excess food residue remaining after wiping, place a half a cup of coarse salt inside the Dutch oven and and wipe it until clean. Re-season after two to three uses.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Camp Chef 12 Qt Seasoned Cast Iron Dutch Oven
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars 2 years later....', 'author': 'Dusty Dawson', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I intentionally waited almost 2 years to do this review and after over probably 300 uses, this is an investment of a lifetime. Personally, the lid alone is worth the cost.. this has become an invaluable tool that I am so glad I bought. This thing is thick, old school cast iron at its best. If you take care of it properly, your super great grandkids will wonder how you cooked dinosaur meat in that thing way back then. Buy it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 19, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great dutch oven', 'author': 'Nozoki', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is my first dutch oven. My internet research found that a lot of people seem to have either Lodge or Camp Chef cast-iron on all the camping forums. I picked this one because I like the lid that doubles as a griddle and also because the price was better than Lodge. I do like that Lodge is made in the U.S., but I wish they were more competitively priced. A 12 quart lodge dutch oven was double the cost of this one. And as I said, I like the legs on the Camp Chef lid.I was afraid that 12 quarts might be too big, but the lid actually accounts for about 3 of those quarts, so the pot is only about 9 quarts which is a perfect size for me. It was pre-seasoned and the first thing I made was a cobbler. Clean up was easy. After cleaning I heated it on my grill to dry it and then rubbed some more oil all over it. A few days later I wanted to test how well the lid worked as a griddle. The legs on the lid let me sit it right on the coals and I made some bacon and eggs. I cooked the bacon first and the lid held a whole pound of it. After that I drained the bacon grease and fried a half dozen eggs and there was no trouble with sticking. Again, clean up was a breeze. While still warm I wiped it out with some water and a small scrub brush. Re-oiled it and it's ready for my next meal.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 11, 2010', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good product, can be added more additional products for sale', 'author': 'Goodman', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Good product. I made my own stowe. It would be gr to offer ez fire stand like on other picture.Gulas recipe (10 liters)Up to 5 lbs of beef4-5 lbs onionoil 1, Into heated oil add 1 tablespoon (TS) of salt and sliced \u200b\u200bonion. First fry the onion about halfway without a lid and then cover with a lid. The state does not evaporate and remains in the goulash. The onion is boiled and made a stew density. When the onion is drowned in its own liquid, throw in into the pot: 2, Add to pot: 1 TS McCormick Dark Chili Powder 1 TS Hickory smoked powder 1 TS smoked paprika (or 1 more TS spices above) At the end of the handle of the spoon of Mace (nutmeg) Add: few bay leaves, 5 cloves, 10 whole peper, 10 allspice 3, Stir it and hand in the meat. Stir often and keep under cover. When the meat is solid, add water to the full pot then cook till meat is cooked. 4, 2 large potatoes cut into small pieces either toss with water into the pot or precook in a extra pot and throw the potatoes into the pot with water. Potatos disapear and will make density of goulash. If you like potatos in it just put 2 more sliced to larger pieces after meat is soft. 5, when the meat is soft to throw a pair of steamed sliced \u200b\u200bpeppers. Cook for a few minutes and eat with bread', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 30, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome Cast Iron', 'author': "Trey's", 'rating': 5, 'content': "Love, love, love this dutch oven. It's huge, preseasoned and great for both the home and camping. We took this out to South Dakota on a camping trip as soon as it arrived. We appreciated that we could use it right away because it was already preseasoned. It was big enough to make a big batch of chili at the campsite. We are slightly obsessed with cast iron cookware here and were a little wary of ordering a product that wasn't a Lodge product, but this is great.On a side note, we also bought another, smaller, cast iron dutch oven from Cabella's. It was not preseasoned (an essential process with cast iron in which you coat the product with cooking oil, place in an oven and turn it on to 350 degrees. Then you turn off the oven, let the cast iron cool, and repeat a few times). It was also, in our opinion, slightly lesser in quality.We would definitely buy more of these products in the future.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 8, 2016', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Must have', 'author': 'Your Mama', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I love this it's the best thing for a large family camping. I love that the lid turns into a skillet that makes it almost the only cookware you need for camping. I take this and one large regular cast iron skillet. I think if you had a small family it would be all you need. I have 8 kids and a husband go figure lol This is really good quality too because I used it on a fire with a ring of rocks and cooked like a champion. Made the perfect amount of soup for my family as well. I can't say enough about it and can't wait to use it again. I also bought the liners for it and that made clean up a snap while camping. It's heavy but that is to be expected as all cast iron is and that's why I love cast iron so much. Pretty indestructable.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 10, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Oustanding!', 'author': 'quiverful', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is the first Dutch Oven I have ever purchased and after a long search I decided on this one. I liked the features of the legs on the lid which allows you to use it as a skillet by itself and it had just the right capacity for my hungry brood. Although not mentioned in any reviews I could find or in the specifications, it also has a notch in the lid and lip of the pot for your typical thermometer probe. I waited until it arrived to confirm this before I acquired a digital thermometer to help me monitor the internal temperature of the oven. There are many good sites on-line that discuss how to control the temperature but I felt that being new to this method of cooking a thermometer would help until I get used to it. The pot is well built, pre-seasoned and ready to go right out of the box. It was also an excellent price compared to other brands I looked at. For my first dish I made an Apple Crisp in it that was delicious and very well received. All in all this is an excellent compliment to by custom campfire spit cooking equipment and I look forward to creating many more wonderful recipes in it for years to come.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 16, 2012', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Camp Chef Grand Canyon 12-Qt Dutch Oven', 'author': 'Amy', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Recieved this product a few weeks ago. So far I\'ve used it serveral times, and have cooked a variety of meals in it. Its performance thus far has been great. It holds heat very well, and is solidly constructed. I was a little disappointed to see that it was manufactured in China, but I should have researched before. With that said, it performs on par with it\'s "Lodge" counterparts as I also own a Lodge 8qt. and a 6qt. dutch oven. Plus you\'ll save between 20-40 dollars with this purchase over the Lodge products. This dutch oven is slightly thinner than it\'s Lodge counterparts though, but I\'m not sure if it\'s a quality issue, or if all 12qt.\'s and higher have slightly thinner walls. The slightly thinner wall doesn\'t seem to be an issue though, as again, it does hold heat in very well. It comes \'pre-seasoned\' but as I do with all my new or used cast iron, I go ahead and give it a good scrub down with an abrasive brillo pad and a little Dawn liquid soap and re-cure it myself. I know there are some who will scoff, or react in horror at doing this, but I\'ve cooked with cast iron for well over 20 yrs and as long as you give it a good scrub, and then rinse it clean, then promply dry it with a towel then add another light coat of veggie shortening or oil, you will have no problems with pitting or rust. The top of this dutch oven has a nice retainer lip for hot coals to be placed on top for even heat distribution and has a good sturdy lifting ring that\'s well balanced. It can even be turned upside down to make a nice cooking griddle for pancakes or eggs and even has its own support pegs for this purpose My box also came with a new lifting tool, so there\'s no need to purchase one if you don\'t already have one. It\'s plenty big enough to cook a full sized chicken and all the sides. You could probably even cook a young turkey in it too, if you split it in half, and lay the halves down flat. I hauled this in for a little over 50 bucks and so far it has been worth every penny. In fact, if I was only going to own one dutch oven, this would be the one. If I ever find myself in a "bug-out" survival/flee situation...This dutch oven will come with me. I would give this a full 5 stars, but again...China..', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2013', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very good quality and perfect size.', 'author': 'Jaroslav K.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This thing works great. Very heavy duty material and will last a lifetime. Worked especially well on my camp chef 16" 3 burner, and with my camp chef dutch oven dome cover. Had a brain waive using it for the first time and used it as a smoker and turned out some amazing smoked baked beans. I took the lid of the camp chef dutch oven, and placed on the camp chef stove as a pan. I then put a few small apple wood chunks (not touching each other) down on the pan. Put the dutch oven on top, covered with the oven dome and voila! A perfect little smoker. I\'ll be using this for a long time and I can tell you some of the people camping with us this weekend are going to go out and buy this. I fed 20 hungry people with this size, and a few people came back for thirds. 5 stars!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 26, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Built like a tank', 'author': 'PAUL', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Nothing', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 2, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice design, not quite to standards of Lodge', 'author': 'Camp Cook', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Let me start by saying it is a beautiful dutch oven! I love the legs molded into the lid, and the depth of the lid. (very handy) It dwarfs my 12 inch Lodge dutch oven. The design in the lid is a nice perk, but if anything, it probably makes the lid weaker. I still like it though.I don\'t have a caliber handy, but going by feel, I believe the Lodge is slightly thicker. I also noticed the Camp Chef does not seem to be an even thickness all the way around. Defiantly a quality issue. It may be my imagination, but the cast iron doesn\'t feel as solid as the Lodge dutch oven. All things being equal I would go with the Lodge which is American made, but they aren\'t equal. The Lodge is considerably more expensive so I am happy with my purchase. If the Camp Chef cracks on me, or food burns easily, I\'ll change my tune in a hurry, but I don\'t think it will, and the design with legs built into the lid, is so much better than the basic Lodge design. I like the Grand Canyon casting in the lid even though it is simple, it adds charm to the pot. I now have a 10", two 12" and the new Camp Chef which is 14". At this point I would give it two thumbs up, but only 4 stars because it does feel a little thinner, and being a bigger pot it should be slightly thicker than the 12". If you can afford the Lodge go with it, but if you\'re on a budget like me, I think the Camp Chef is a good value.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 11, 2012', 'is_verified': True}]

The only thing is that the enamel turns yellow and stays yellow.. any ideas on how to clean it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars What a deal!', 'author': 'KEM', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Bought these for my daughter for Christmas so we haven‚Äôt used them yet, but I have the real, Le Crueset and these look and feel comparable. I was really shocked at how nice these are.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 4, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Pan - Needs Additional Seasoning', 'author': 'Nikole Marie', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love this skillet! We have used it a couple of times and are pleased with our meals.I have family from the south, so I know a well-seasoned cast iron skillet when I see one. While this product was pre-seasoned, it is not seasoned enough to prevent your food from sticking to the skillet.Here are the steps I took to season and clean my skillet:Seasoning the skillet:I placed foil on the bottom of the oven and preheat to 400 degreesI fried some bacon in the skillet and lid and as I suspected the meat stuck to the bottom. Once the bacon cooked down, I was able to move the food around with ease.After the bacon was fully cooked and the skillet was still hot (please use oven mitts), I took tongs and a paper towel and rubbed the bacon fat all over the inside of the skillet and the lid. You can also use vegetable oil to wipe down the skillet ‚Äì I chose to use bacon because‚Ä¶well, it‚Äôs bacon.I placed the skillet and lid upside down on the oven rack and set the timer for one hour. Be advised: the oven does get smoky so don‚Äôt be alarmed.Once the hour was up, I turned off the oven and let the pan cooled a bit before removing the skillet.Cleaning the skillet:It is easier to clean the skillet when it is still a bit warm, but please use cautionUsing Morton‚Äôs sea salt and a paper towel I began to scrub the skillet (you can also use a raw potato and sea salt)Once clean I rinsed out the skillet and immediately put it on low heat for about 2 minutes to evaporate any waterStore in a cool, dry place to prevent rustingA couple of notes:NEVER submerge a cast iron skillet in water as it will cause rust)NEVER use soapNEVER put a cast iron skillet in the dishwasherIf you do have rust ‚Äì use steel wool to scour and remove the rust. Repeat the steps for cleaning with the sea saltI would recommend this skillet, and if taken care of properly, it can last generations!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 28, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Please get these! In love!!!', 'author': 'Anna', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'First off, let me start off by saying. I got the 3quart and it doesn‚Äôt weight 4lbs as the description says. Real cast iron is heavy, and I ordered because someone said it‚Äôs heavy. So I weighted it myself when I got it. It‚Äôs around 10.5lbs for the pot and lid. I love how versatile it is and you can use it for camping or even for little daily things. Once I got it, I thoroughly washed it, let it dry then seasoned it with oil and cook it in the oven. Now it‚Äôs ready to use. I have used it every morning to make omelettes and they turn out so beautifully and cook so evenly. My favorite part is that the cast iron gets so hot that it melts the cheese and cooks the omelette perfectly. I use the so called lid for this! I love that you can use the lid as a lid and as a pan! Would buy again to gift! Such a beautiful piece.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 31, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Love it, but a little disappointed‚Ä¶', 'author': 'Emmy', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'When I first got this I would have given it 5 stars. It‚Äôs a great one, cooks beautifully, cleans easily. I purchased because I wanted the cooking properties of cast iron, but just a little bit easier clean up. 5 months after purchase with moderate use, the enamel on the handle is chipping. I‚Äôm really disappointed because I‚Äôm not rough on my cookware at all. Not sure why it‚Äôs chipping so easily. I buy cast iron for the longevity, but I‚Äôm not sure how long this set will actually last.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars We just love cast iron pans', 'author': 'Kathy Salem', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My son asked for one after coming over and cooking in ours He loves his too', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

This is a Christmas gift for a good friend.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Chipped but still darling', 'author': 'jill', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'There was a chip on the lid, but this is still an adorable Dutch oven', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Chipped two minutes out of the box!', 'author': 'Wilson', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'Just bad ordered before no problems so won‚Äôt buy this brand again', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars M-COOKER 4 Quart Dutch Oven Induction Ready and Oven Safe', 'author': 'BTW', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was looking forward to trying out the M-COOKER 4 quart enameled cast iron pot. The enameled interior of the pot is smooth and that makes it easy to clean. The lid fits snugly to the pot which helps retain heat and minimize evaporation. This helps me to simmer and braise veggies in a moist environment at a lower temperature to help retain more nutrients. A Dutch oven with a tight-fitting lid is ideal for braising because it allows the food to cook slowly and evenly in a moist environment.I use this pan on my induction burner which allows perfect control of the temperature and turns it into an excellent slow cooker (and it also makes a wonderful bean pot). It\'s the perfect companion pot for my induction cooker, but it has the added versatility of working on my other cooktops and it even goes right into the oven!I decided to try this pot out by making my favorite braised and roasted potatoes. I sauteed a minced shallot and some chopped scallions and garlic cloves in a few tablespoons of olive oil and butter with a few skewers of Rosemary briefly, then I added some baby red potatoes, browned them for a few moments, then I covered the pan, tossing the potatoes to be sure they were well coated with the olive oil herb mixture.I transferred the pan to a 350F oven to finish the potatoes, covered, for an hour or so or until fork-tender. Then I removed the cover to brown for 15 minutes at 425F. Can I say "Yum"? This cooking method is really only possible in a cast iron Dutch oven like this, and the M-Cooker 4 quart Dutch oven is the perfect size for this dish.It works equally well for steaming potatoes in their jackets for making perfect potato salad because steamed in this pan with their jackets on, potatoes retain all the flavor and nutrients that are lost when potatoes are peeled and boiled! I would highly recommend this 4 quart M-Cooker Dutch oven - and I wouldn\'t want to be without it! It\'s essential cookware in my kitchen!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 6, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Can't Go Wrong With Cast Iron", 'author': 'J. Asher', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Ordered for my husband, at his request, as he does most of the cooking in our home.Included with the dutch over and lid was a set of instructions for use and care. The enamel on this oven is nice and even, and the lid has drip points as well, which is a bonus feature I didn't even realize it had when it was ordered.The first thing cooked in this oven was a pot roast, and it came out just as good as it does in the slow cooker.For the price of this oven, I'd say it is well worth it, and you can't really go too wrong with cast iron anyway.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 6, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Solid and Stylish', 'author': 'Jess B.', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This 4 quarter Dutch Oven arrived to my house securely packed with an easy to read, trifold, use and care instruction guide. I appreciate that, as I will be referring to them frequently since this is my first dutch oven. I like this is a smaller pot, as my plan is to make sourdough bread rounds for myself, so for me this was the exact size I needed. The lid fits securely and the enamel coating is evenly coated throughout the pot and lid. The beautiful flower design on the lid carries over to the pot's handles that are designed to look like leaves, which have functional grooves on them that can help with holding this heavier pot more securely. My only concern is the handles feel a little small for the weight and size of this pot. I have petite hands, but I feel like someone with larger hands would have a harder time gripping them. Still that said, there is no question that for the price this is a high-quality pot worth adding as a staple to any kitchen.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 20, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works well', 'author': 'Clayton B.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It works well, and it looks fantastic. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Have to have this pot to make good rice and beans.', 'author': 'Diana Rodman', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Color is festive and it's what you need to make a good batch of rice and beans. Good for Asian style cooking. Needs very less oil to fry doesn't stick anything. I have used for deep frying also. It's almost similar to Indian kadai. Only one problem is that handles are getting heated up and you need to hold it with some cloth pads.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 17, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars NOT for glass top stove!', 'author': 'MCA', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I had an Imusa caldero in the past that I loved with my gas stove. I bought this one because the manufacturer stated that this model can be used on glass top stoves. It cannot. It has a bare aluminum bottom with sharp ridges. The bottom is not smooth at all. It would not create even heat on a glasstop, it would badly scratch and leave bare metal residue on the stove. Disappointed at the misleading description. It amazes me that sellers still rarely show the bottom of a pot or pan considering how common glass top stoves are.? It makes it a guessing game to purchase online.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 13, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Disappointed', 'author': 'april', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'I keep reading the description and it says it comes with lid but to my surprise my caldero did not come w glass lid at all. title: Oster Dutch Oven, Stainless Steel, 4 QT, with Lid and 3 section dividers, Gibson, Sangerfield, 128612.05
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great for steaming dumplings', 'author': 'ER', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Bought this steamer for dumplings and it‚Äôs fantastic. Large enough for big batches, steams evenly, and offers great value. Solid build, highly recommend.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The reviewers complaining should learn about cooking', 'author': 'mediawatcher', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I\'ve used this great steamer insert 3 qt. pot for over a year and it\'s perfect. Easy to pick up not super heavy, wash quickly and comes up to a boil just fine. I just made a home made chicken soup with it yesterday and it was on the stove for hours. A perfect size for the 3 lb. store rotisserie carcas. Yes, stainless might show "rainbow" stain known as heat tint on the bottom. When stainless steel is heated to high temperatures, the oxidized top layer can thicken, which causes a rainbow tint. So you throw some diluted vinegar in for 3 seconds, rinse, and it\'s like new. Really people? It\'s a commonly known fact with all stainless. Even my $300 Demeyere pan. Learn how cooking works.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good for me an old lady!', 'author': 'Lynda Johnson', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I am in my 70's and I did not want to buy expensive cookware. Mine was old and grungy. I Hated using them. If you are a newly wed just starting out, good for you if your on a limited budget. They are very lightweight and not top of the line. However for the price you can't go wrong. While I haven't tried them as yet, I am sure they will suit me just fine.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great for dumplings or soups', 'author': 'Kindle Customer', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Good quality pot. Dishwasher safe. No issues with burning.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works perfect!!', 'author': 'Wolfman 1958', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Only takes about 1 cup of water or less to steam my vegetables, broccoli , cauliflower, squash, zucchini mix...Well worth the cost and easy to clean, very high polish is easier to clean...', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Paper-thin', 'author': 'ILoveBooks', 'rating': 3, 'content': "Pros:* Cheap and somehow works for now.Cons:* Some steam leaks around the edges, so you have to be careful not to burn yourself.* The whole thing is extremely light (almost like it's a toy) and can easily be knocked over.* The metal is paper-thin so it's hard to imagine it lasting long.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works Well And Multifunctional', 'author': 'jb66', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I made this purchase to cook potatoes, yams and other root tubers. The product does a pretty great job, I wanted the strainer in the cover so that I won't have to use a collander, it does that function well. I like the part to steam vegetables, this is a great bonus also, since it performs two functions. The product is a little light in weight, but it works wonderfully for my purposes. I bought a used one and the quality was excellent, just like new, no signs of wear and tear at all. Over all I'm extremely pleased with my purchase.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I use it almost ever day!', 'author': 'Germaine Ianniello', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Use it mostly for steaming vegetables. Good size and cooks evenly. I handwash and it cleans easily. It also looks nice on the stove top.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars It Is Functional For The Price', 'author': 'JustinBuyer', 'rating': 4, 'content': '***** QUALITYNot many complaints at this price point which is the deciding factor in my 4 star rating. The stainless steel is not of the best quality and thickness of say a more expensive well polished heavy weight stainless steel pot. For higher quality think of the inner pot of an Instant Pot is you are familiar with that appliance.A close up view of the pot will show a ‚Äúbrushed‚Äù stainless look rather than a perfect smooth finish. The magnified views on the amazon product page will show this.***** SIZESome reviewers mention this pot is too small. It could be depending on the intended usage. The product page clearly states the oil capacity is 3.65 quarts so the size should not be a surprise. In my opinion the pot will only work for a one or two person meal unless you want to cook multiple batches.Some notes on the pot dimensions. The product page says the dimensions are \'16.25"D x 8.25"W x 6.75"H\': * The 16.25D inches is the end of the long handle to the outer edge of the half round handle. See photos 1 and 2. * The 8.25W inches is from the edge of the pot to the half round handle. The actual cooking diameter is about 6-1/2 inches inches. See photo 1. * The 6.75H is the height of the bottom of the pot to the top of the long handle. The actual cooking height is about 5-1/2 inches. See photo 3.Basket Dimensions: * The diameter of the basket is about 6 inches. See photo 4. * The height of the basket including the ‚Äúfeet‚Äù is about 4-1/2 inches. The usable height is about 4-1/8 inches. See photo 5.***** CLEANINGOur first try was fries from fresh potatoes. No problem with the fries.Our second use was frozen fish fillets. A ‚Äúburnt‚Äù (?) residue was left on the sides of the pot. See photo 6. I was able to easily clean using a scratch resistant pad and Bar Keepers Friend. See photo 7. The residue came off with hardly any effort as shown in photo 1. I will admit we made a mistake and overloaded the basket with the fish and I don\'t know if this would have made a difference.Note on my attached photos: the pot as shown was after only cleaning off the residue so any other crap still on it will be taken care of by the dishwasher.Keep in mind highly polished stainless steel will clean easier than the ‚Äúbrushed‚Äù type. I\'ll keep the pot and use my cleaning option as stated above if necessary.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good quality for the price', 'author': 'hlymacro', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This 3qt pot with steamer is a bit thin on the stainless steel, but will serve its purpose and maybe sometimes, be a benefit with lesser weight.Only a couple of notes: handles get exceptionally hot; and when I was washing it, there was a sharp bit of metal where the handle curls underneath. Other than that, totally functional and can't argue with the price.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: 7QT Dutch Oven Pot With Lid,Ceramic Dutch Ovens for Sourdough Bread Baking,Enameled Cast Iron Bread Cooking Pot,Non-Stick,Oven Safe,Blue (10 Pcs Bread Paper Liners)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Versatile Cukor Cast Iron Dutch Oven', 'author': 'Nozama', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Overall, the Cukor Cast Iron Dutch Oven is a great choice for a Dutch Oven or pan that is versatile and durable. It could be used to cook a variety of dishes, but I wanted this pan for when I braise my meat in the oven. Typically I brown it on the stove top and then move it to the oven to slowly braise. I like that I can use the same pan for the stove top and the oven. I also prefer to use cast iron. This cast iron is coated with a white enamel. I will need to learn how to care for this, but it is nice to be able to have the enamel because I can cook tomato products without damaging the cast iron. I did realize that I need to not use metal utensils with the enamel. I already use wooden spoons and spatulas. I found the Dutch oven heated very evenly on the stove top. My food did not stick to the pan. It was very easy to clean. The crusted material on the sides from the roast being braised for 2 hours easily wiped off. I did end up slightly staining the white enamel with my red wine and tomato sauce. I like that I don‚Äôt have to worry about the pan rusting like I do with my iron skillets. It says it is dishwasher safe, but does not recommend it. I have decided I will only hand wash mine. The Cukor Cast Iron Dutch Oven is a great option. It looks like and performs like the pricier brands of enameled cast iron Dutch Ovens. The Cukor Cast Iron Dutch Oven is very reasonably priced. I am very happy with my purchase and would buy this again. However, I doubt that I would need to because it will last forever.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars My dream come true', 'author': 'Kindle Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It had taken me ages to save up to buy a dutch oven. Finally, it was time to choose. I searched and read the reviews of a lot of dutch ovens. My dream was to be able to bake bread in it. Finally after much deliberation, I decided to buy the Cukor dutch oven. I tell you, I was not disappointed! My first bread (using a recipe from my sister) looked at first like it was too soft. I was sure it was going to fail. Then the Cukor dutch oven did its magic. It turned out great!!! Now I just have to worry about the calories I will put on making so much bread.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect', 'author': 'Lori', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Absolutely perfect for sourdough bread!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars works great', 'author': 'Douglas Van Gundy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'love it', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars sturdy Very', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "time long a last should and made well very is This . it to forward looking I'm but yet this used haven't I", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars the best Dutch Oven on the market, definitely will buy 1 more in the near future', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'my dishes cook to perfection and taste is wonderful thanks to this fantastic Dutch Oven', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars works great', 'author': 'Stephanie Hogan', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'this dutch oven works really really nicely in the oven or on the stove top. easy to clean although it seems to have stained. the only complaint is it looks bigger than it actually is so ive had to move things to other pots or to my crockpot.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 15, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Dutch oven', 'author': 'Sandy Vanderhoff', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Used first time Sunday to make bread.
