title: Enameled Cast Iron Pot: 2.6 Quart Heavy Duty Dutch Oven with Lid and Dual Handles in Blue - Silicone Accessories and Sponge Included, Ideal for Braising, Stewing, Roasting and Baking
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars havent used it yet BUT......many experiences with this type of cookware from over seas', 'author': 'RjS803', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I will tell you 1st call out to the vendor, You my friend did a phenomenal job in packaging this unit. Very well protected from the rigors of what a package goes thru in the shipping industry today. Thank You!! Now the unit:This pot is beautifully enameled and very heavy gauge which I like & the enamel is even coated no drips chips or imperfections, BRAVO to you !! ...This vendor added 3 silicone heat protector items ..2 handle grips ( thumb & 4 finger grip type) & also a silicone trivet to rest on the table coming from the oven or cook top.I highly suggest if your looking for enamel cast to check them out, and of course Prime day the vendor made it even sweeter by discounting it!! I will tell you that I own several CN enamel cast iron products. I treat them like they were Le Creuset which means I dont heat them up past medium,I never put an empty skillet or pot on the stove with out either oil or water . I hand wash them and enjoy cooking everything from baking bread in them to one pot meals like stove top dutch oven Lasagna ...Its hi heat that causes food to burn in them, causes hazing ( small cracks all over the pans bottom) and I also found on others that used high heat for extended times ( they didnt know as most dont know how to cook in Cast Iron , let alone Enamel cast) and didnt let pot cool down and started cleaning.. had slabs of the enamel pop off. Let these things cool all the way down. My experience has been you need to be kind to them ( not over heating them... using proper utensils when cooking with them), and know if yu bang & clang them around with other pots & pans they will chip. So long as the chips are on the outside, no worries dry them good put a smidgen of oil on some outside cast showing to prevent rust....if big chips on the inside, well then you may want to plant flowers in it .... but if your good to them, 97% of them hold up fine.I do not use metal utensils in them ( only silicone or wood) and one Dutch oven is my 1st from 4 yrs ago (Lodge) not a chip and not a hazing crack or scratch on the inside and these types of pots /pans yu can get a good sear on fleshy proteins with medium heat and my chuck roasts ( pot roast ) never stick & come out with a great crust/ sear on them.All of these CN enamel cast iron dutch ovens big or small in my experience simmer beautifully on medium low after 30 mins with the lid on.I couldnt be happier.. :-)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for two people.', 'author': 'HJS', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Very well made, and heavy. Basically indestructible. Good size for 3 cup bread recipes.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Just what I wanted', 'author': 'M.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is heavy and well made. I'm using it for three people servings and it's plenty big. (5 qt size) Recommend.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Dutch Oven', 'author': 'joshua reaves', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is a beautiful piece that adds a little pop of color to the kitchen. It's easy to clean and is built solid. Great for making stews, soups and bread. It's a great value as the same product from other brands is hundreds of dollars. You won't be disappointed.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Small Dutch Oven for 2', 'author': 'Bonz4248', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This Dutch Oven is very well made of enamel covered cast iron. It heats evenly and is easy to clean. It's also very attractive with a beautiful gradient red enamel coating on the outside. The lid fits securely on the pot.The set comes with some accessories including a sponge, a silicone trivet, and 2 silicone flapper deals which I suppose are finger protectors for lifting the handles of the pot when hot, but look more like some weird hand puppets to me...I think I'll rely on towels, pot holders or kitchen mitts for my heat protection, but still it's very thoughtful of the company to provide them.I've found this Dutch Oven to be perfect for cooking for 2 people. It's also good for making a small loaf of bread. It's definitely a welcome addition to my kitchen armamentarium and with proper care as outlined in the accompanying literature, should last for many years. I highly recommend it for anyone looking for a small reasonably priced, yet good quality Dutch Oven", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A Beautiful and Practical Pot for All Seasons', 'author': 'Jason Loosle', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this pot in the gradient Red shade, and I was amazed by how eye-catching and elegant it looked in my kitchen. It arrived in perfect condition, thanks to the secure packaging and careful handling. The pot is versatile and durable, made of thickened cast iron and high-quality enamel. I have used it to make stews, pasta, casseroles, and more; it consistently delivers excellent results. The heat-conductive base and spiked lid ensure even heat distribution and moisture retention. The pot is also easy to clean and maintain, as the enamel coating prevents food from sticking and protects it from chipping and scratching. The pot also comes with matching silicone accessories, which are very useful and convenient. I am delighted with this purchase, and I recommend it to anyone who loves cooking and wants a stylish and functional pot for their meals.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 27, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great quality', 'author': 'Ethan F.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'A heavy duty Dutch oven that looks great. Not much else to say other than it is comparable to big name brands. If you like the color and size, then you can‚Äôt go wrong with this choice. Note that the handle isn‚Äôt enamel, as stated.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars EXCEPTIONALLY WELL-MADE, EVEN HEATING, EASY TO CLEAN, AND BEAUTIFUL TO BOOT', 'author': 'TRIPLE CCC', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This enameled cast iron dutch oven is slightly more petite than I expected. I got it because our son went off to college and I no longer had to cook for him and his entourage (lovely kids, all, but a hungry bunch). I love making one pot meals for my husband and myself, and thought this little Dutch oven would come in handy. It has. I‚Äôve made some chicken fricassee and some lamb stew in it, both of which turned out terrifically well. The lid of this Dutch oven has a precise fit, so steam doesn‚Äôt escape, and the lid is also spiked, which allows the moisture from the food to drip back onto the food, thereby basting it.But the oven has two applications that hadn‚Äôt occurred to me: frying and baking (though I now see both these applications described on the Amazon site). The oven is small enough, yet deep enough, that it‚Äôs the perfect size to fry plantains, or fritters, both of which are family favorites. And ‚Äî I bake sourdough bread. I like giving away sourdough boules. But I can only make 2 at a time using a 5qt Dutch oven. With this petite baby, I can separate my dough into 4 boules and bake them in the oven. The Blue Parmedu has found its purpose in our home.A final thought, the blue enamel of this Dutch oven is absolutely eye-catching ‚Äî the way the blue fades from light to dark and vice versa. I was born in the Caribbean and I think that‚Äôs why I was attracted to this color. It reminds of the ocean, turquoise blue fading to near navy at its depths.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 24, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very Nice 2.6 Qt. Enameled Dutch Oven', 'author': 'JFR', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love the cooking benefits of cast iron, so an enameled cast iron Dutch Oven, for me, is a kitchen essential. I have a name brand, mid priced, 6-quart enameled Dutch oven that I‚Äôve used for years, and it‚Äôs held up well with only slight crazing and discoloration to its light-colored interior. It‚Äôs been excellent for larger meals but have wanted a smaller size for diversity. I‚Äôve used the Parmedu Dutch oven twice now to test it out. Once on the stovetop and once in the oven. One thing I noticed right away is how well the lid fits on the pot. It overhangs slightly from the edge of the pot making for a nice seal. Cooking with it, I found that it conducts heat very well and its lid, with rounded spikes on the underside, causes condensation to drip off the lid evenly into the pot. That evenly dispersed condensation made for an exceptionally moist small pork roast because it served to baste the meat while cooking in the oven. The roast was fork tender and evenly cooked. On the stovetop, I used the Dutch oven to cook a small pot of beans that simmered for several hours. I used three kinds of beans and all cooked evenly. The Dutch oven cleans up easily and so far, shows no sign of discoloration or crazing. Although light-colored enameled interiors do tend to discolor some over time and show eventual crazing, I prefer it to a dark interior. I like to clearly see what I‚Äôm cooking, and a light interior helps. The Parmedu Dutch oven has a nice smooth finish and does seem durable to me, at least as durable as my 6-quart, so believe it will last. I‚Äôm very happy to have it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 18, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love this bakeware!', 'author': 'Vanessa C.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I‚Äôve wanted one of these for quite some years but until now, have not been able to afford one. While I‚Äôve always wanted one in red, My favorite color is actually dark blue. When this blue ombre popped up on my suggested items, and when I saw the extremely affordable price, I did not hesitate to purchase at once. I love the overall design and quality, it‚Äôs even better in person, the stock photos do not do it justice! It is very heavy, beautifully crafted with attention to detail, coloring is throughout with no unpainted handles. Would make a wonderful gift. Very pleased with my purchase & highly recommend.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 13, 2023', 'is_verified': False}]

title: Dutch Oven Yellow,Enameled Cast Iron Dutch Oven with Lid, 4 Quart Round Nonstick Enamel Cookware Crock Pot,Dutch Oven with Dual Handle and Cover Casserole Dish 8.66 Inch
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I LOVE this pan- great quality for the price!', 'author': 'amys', 'rating': 5, 'content': "You won't regret this purchase! This is the best . You can do anything you want in this vessel. I was surprised by the quality. I'm a fan of cast iron and I own antique hand-me downs, new Lodge, and some new low-end enameled. The two latter have been the workhorses in my kitchen, but I needed a smaller vessell for everyday cooking so I decided to try this. So glad I discovered this beauty- I knew it would perform well because it's cast iron, but wasn't sure if the enamel would be quality. Well it IS. It cooks and cleans up like a dream. The lid fits perfectly and the knob is comfortable and seems to stay cool enough. This is a lovely vessel that a novice or a pro would love. Thanks for making a QUALITY product that is affordable! I LOVE MY NEW PAN!! This would make a great gift- it was perfectly packaged and arrived in pristine condition. GET IT- you'll love it too!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 25, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This pan is PERFECT for my needs!', 'author': 'Paul Sampson', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'All my pots & pans are non-stick, (Teflon). There are just some recipes that are better if you\'re able to create "fond" on the bottom of a pan. Non-stick pans don\'t let you build up a fond. So, I needed enameled cast iron. I\'ve only had this pan for 18 days, but have already used it 3 times. I love it! I plan on ordering a larger one, (I got the 3 quart size), for bigger recipes. Nice, heavy weight; very even heat distribution; great seal with the lid; and it\'s about $200 cheaper than the same sized Le Creuset! I highly recommend this brand, (Ailiboo), though I had never heard of it before. Great pan!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So glad to have purchased', 'author': 'Chriss', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Great sturdy pot, VERY easy to clean, multifunctional, nice color, awesome addition to my cookware. Couldn't be more please to have bought this pot for a reasonable price. Delivery and packaging was spot on!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars It is heavy.', 'author': 'DCS', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The ad for this Dutch Oven said it was lightweight but it is quite heavy for a 3.5 pound oven. I was looking to replace my old Dutch Oven that had scratches on the nonstick surface and was looking for a smaller and lighter version . Got smaller but actually heavier. BUT ‚Ä¶ I love it anyway! Keeping it. And love the color!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love this pot!', 'author': 'Fl Gal', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love this 3 qt cast iron pot, it was just the perfect size for two ppl, and a pot with a lid was the icing on the cake. It cooked evenly, baked in the oven wonderfully and washed up terrifically. I have several dutch ovens and love cooking with them.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for 2-3 hungry people', 'author': 'Jan Lundquist', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I wanted a stove to oven cast iron pot for my small toaster oven, but they are difficult to find, either because they are a skosh too wide or a skosh too tall.This one ALMOST fit, but the "almost" is what convinced me to replace my old TO, that no longer toasted as well as it once did.I kept the pot, and ordered the slightly-wider and taller TO. After appropriate seasoning and burn it, I used both for a trial run "short cut" chicken pot pie, to see how useful this will be for two person meals.I knew the cooking would go fast once the pie was assembled and in the oven so I diced and parboiled 3 small Yukon (chosen for their buttery creaminess) potatoes. While they cooked, i prepped and sauteed some onion, celery and carrots.When the aromatics were softened, I scraped them into a bowl and added a drained large can of chicken, drained potatoes, and frozen peas.Use the same pot, I made approximately 1.5-2 cups, of the white sauce (beurre blanc), seasoned with what came to hand, and cooked until it was as thick as I wanted. I mixed this with the ingredients in the bowl, wiped out the dutch oven, then poured the mixture back into it.I put the pot into the oven and heated it to 400 F. "biscuit baking" temperature, while separated small canned biscuits into two layers. FYI It took the took 10 halves or 5 biscuits to cover the surface and there were approximated 4 healthy servings in the filled pot.I was out of a few essential things that I had envisioned as contributors to the taste i was aiming for, like sage and fresh milk, so I substituted with what i had on hand. The test audience (Italian American) says that though this is a different flavor profile for him, it may be good enough to have leftovers for lunch tomorrow. We\'ll see how the flavor holds up overnight.But I am very happy with the size and functionality of this pot. Next up Coq Au Vin! Ham and scalloped potatoes! Pasta bakes...and, maybe, eventually, this recipe again, with fresh ingredients next time.My wooden lid fits tightly by the way, if I center it on the pot with the handles to the left and right and the name straight and level. But would i use it in the oven? Only for low and slow cooking.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 31, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars DO NOT BUY !!Beautuful but chips easily', 'author': 'Ruby S.', 'rating': 1, 'content': "Further update: I Spent over an hour yesterday with Amazon customer service chats. I was told I would hear back in 6 hours, after lengthy chat. It is the next day and nothing. I was not asking for a refund or replacement. I was asking for manufacturer and seller's information. This is dangerous to have a dutch oven inside enamel blow up in your kitchen!! Update: last night i was browning ground beef for chili and the inside bottom blew up!!I love the color the size is perfect. I make homemade dog and it work well for that. However, the problem is it is chipped in 2 places. I'm extremely careful with it. I don't understand why it's chipping. It goes from the stove to the sink. I cleaned it out right away. It doesn't sit anywhere. It doesn't get put on a dishwasher or dish rack.I really love it, but it is not holding well if it can chip twice in a little over a month.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 13, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Well made heavy duty', 'author': 'Jennifer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Was a lil bit smaller than I thought, but my fault for not reading description better most likely.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Just the sweetest color', 'author': 'J. Venter', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Ok, I was swayed by the color - friendly and inviting!Seriously though, this is my third Dutch Oven. I bake sourdough bread and wanted a smaller one. This one is perfect.Instructions come with the pot which was very carefully and securely packaged. Firstly, you'd need to season all raw edges and bake it UPSIDE DOWN so the oil does not run into the pot. Make sure you clean the pot TOROUGHLY before you bake to season, it as you'll have to use elbow grease to remove those baked-on spots after it comes out of the oven. So just clean and mess (if you messed) before you pop it in the oven.The lid fits securely and the heat distribution is even. And it is easy to clean if you do so while it is till a little warm, just use warm water. ALWAYS dry pots immediately as you don't want the exposed iron to rust.I am happy, the color makes me happier!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars It's my dog's. I need my own.", 'author': 'momof3punkins', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Gotta be honest... I bought this for my dog. Why? Because every freaking food bowl I've tried with her has been a waste of money. She either destroys it, or carries it all over the house spilling food everywhere. What's worse is when it's a metal bowl and she throws it down the stairs onto the tile floor spilling food down the stairs, and shattering my nerves from the metal bouncing on the tile.Anyway, back to this amazing Dutch oven. I decided to get this because I figured it was heavy enough that she couldn't pick it up and throw it down the stairs. I needed it to be enameled so it wouldn't rust.This little baby has been life saver. I don't step on food anymore. My nerves are intact. It's pretty and looks great in the kitchen. She loves it and it's wide enough that her whiskers don't touch the sides when she eats.Definitely buying another one for me.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Light Weight Covered Dutch Oven,5Qt,Blue,Cast Aluminum Nonstick
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This was the PERFECT one...after "Goldilocks" tried another!', 'author': 'Lizzie', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Oh my... at 75 and loving to cook I never had an actual Dutch Oven! I just used old big pots my whole life. Then my Hubby gave me a gift certificate to Amazon for my birthday and I thought...this is my time! So I ordered...after much review...what I thought was the perfect Cast Iron Dutch Oven...awaited it\'s arrival...it was beautiful...and I could barely lift it! Even the lid was too heavy. I did have a wrist broken in 2 places less than 2 years before but it is good...I\'m no athlete...but the pot weighed almost 15 pounds alone...which I didn\'t really think about! I thought...my Hubby would have to get it out for me to cook...help move it...and how the heck much is it going to weigh full of food!!?!! So...boxed up my beautiful present and sent it back tearfully. More careful review...I was not crazy about the color choices on this but it seemed great...and light! I ordered it with trepidation...it came...it is so wonderful. I LOVE it...could not be easier to cook in and clean after. Some folks did not like the way the lid fit and I worried it would slip off...no problem...plenty of "connection" to the pot...handles do get warm but that is something I am used to. I adore this pot...the "red" is more an old fashioned look...more of a burnt brickish color to me...looks terrific. I am so happy to have the perfect pot in my later years...maybe my cooking will improve! The 5 quart size is just right too...holds lots of soup, stew, etc. My Hubby likes to bake bread and is eagerly planning to try that in it too! This is a good decision...hope that helps someone else decide...it is a complicated choice!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Delightful Dutch Oven', 'author': 'LT', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I am very pleased with this handsome Dutch oven. The pot's shade of red is perfect. I've used it in my gas oven and on my gas stove top. The pot heats the food evenly. Clean-up is a breeze with its nonstick interior. The lightweight aluminum is a bonus for me as it's not as heavy to lift with the weight of the food I cook in it. I really like the roomy 6.8 quart size. I'm glad I purchased this product so I gave it 5 stars.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 4, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Aluminum DO. Use mostly in an oven & it‚Äôs really non stick & easy to clean.', 'author': 'Brian W Gorman', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I really like this, I own both regular cast iron & ceramic coated cast iron Dutch Oven But they are heavy & even though take a lot of work to keep the coating on the inside, but mostly my wife won‚Äôt lift them, because they‚Äôre so heavy.These are the opposite, less then 3 pounds, and we‚Äôve been using for about 6 months & the non stick coating is so good. I can make sourdough bread in it & it just falls out.Because of my other DO experience, I washed it really well, then put it in the oven at 400 degrees F for about 30 minutes. There was some smells of either the outer paint or ceramic liner gasing off, I had my vent fan going the whole time. I then put a light coating of 450 degree avacado oil on the inside & wipe it down.I haven‚Äôt had any smells or taste in my food at all.One thing I don‚Äôt understand is people saying the handles get hot. Hello, this is solid cast Aluminum, it‚Äôs supposed to transmit heat extremely well. So if the bottom gets hot, everything is going to get close to the same temperature.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 23, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Love it but‚Ä¶Is it 5 quart though?', 'author': 'Jackelin Furuyama', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'It is definitely light and looks durable, but the lid gives me a little concern since it does not fit tightly and could be dislodged easily by bumping. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love this especially with the price', 'author': 'Wanna', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is a set of very affordable cast iron cookware that works great with my induction cooktop. I've had trouble finding compatible cookware in the past, but these pieces distribute heat evenly and are easy to clean. I've found that spraying a little oil (Pam) on the surface before frying prevents burning, unlike with some of my stainless steel cookware. I've also used them to bake without any issues. Used it a dozen times already and cleans up new looking.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars awesome', 'author': 'Wanda barrs', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'i use it to make bread and soups. it is an awesome pot. it cooks my bread evenly. i love it', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect', 'author': 'Becky', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is the perfect size for my small loaves of sourdough!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars If you take care of these properly, they'll last a lifetime.", 'author': 'Carol Baker', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I am very pleased with these. Gave them as a gift and she loves them.Couple things to remember with these:1. Most important. Let them cool completely before you attempt to clean them. For years I've seen people complain about the ceramic coating coming off. In every case, I can assure you the complaining party has plunged a smoking hot pan into a sink full of dishwater or run tap water in them while very hot. Just let them cool completely. If there are baked or cooked on items, let the cool pan soak with some water and they'll come clean.2. Never EVER use metal kitchen utensils in these. In vest in a Dutch oven you won‚Äôt be sorry.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Cast iron covered enamel pan n fry pan.', 'author': 'Veronica Adinolfi', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Well I like this item to cook in. It is convenient cuz it has a pot n a fry pan on top. The only thing is that the enamel turns yellow and stays yellow.. any ideas on how to clean it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars What a deal!', 'author': 'KEM', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Bought these for my daughter for Christmas so we haven‚Äôt used them yet, but I have the real, Le Crueset and these look and feel comparable. I was really shocked at how nice these are.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 4, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Pan - Needs Additional Seasoning', 'author': 'Nikole Marie', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love this skillet! We have used it a couple of times and are pleased with our meals.I have family from the south, so I know a well-seasoned cast iron skillet when I see one. While this product was pre-seasoned, it is not seasoned enough to prevent your food from sticking to the skillet.Here are the steps I took to season and clean my skillet:Seasoning the skillet:I placed foil on the bottom of the oven and preheat to 400 degreesI fried some bacon in the skillet and lid and as I suspected the meat stuck to the bottom. Once the bacon cooked down, I was able to move the food around with ease.After the bacon was fully cooked and the skillet was still hot (please use oven mitts), I took tongs and a paper towel and rubbed the bacon fat all over the inside of the skillet and the lid. You can also use vegetable oil to wipe down the skillet ‚Äì I chose to use bacon because‚Ä¶well, it‚Äôs bacon.I placed the skillet and lid upside down on the oven rack and set the timer for one hour. Be advised: the oven does get smoky so don‚Äôt be alarmed.Once the hour was up, I turned off the oven and let the pan cooled a bit before removing the skillet.Cleaning the skillet:It is easier to clean the skillet when it is still a bit warm, but please use cautionUsing Morton‚Äôs sea salt and a paper towel I began to scrub the skillet (you can also use a raw potato and sea salt)Once clean I rinsed out the skillet and immediately put it on low heat for about 2 minutes to evaporate any waterStore in a cool, dry place to prevent rustingA couple of notes:NEVER submerge a cast iron skillet in water as it will cause rust)NEVER use soapNEVER put a cast iron skillet in the dishwasherIf you do have rust ‚Äì use steel wool to scour and remove the rust. Repeat the steps for cleaning with the sea saltI would recommend this skillet, and if taken care of properly, it can last generations!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 28, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Please get these! In love!!!', 'author': 'Anna', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'First off, let me start off by saying. I got the 3quart and it doesn‚Äôt weight 4lbs as the description says. Real cast iron is heavy, and I ordered because someone said it‚Äôs heavy. So I weighted it myself when I got it. It‚Äôs around 10.5lbs for the pot and lid. I love how versatile it is and you can use it for camping or even for little daily things. Once I got it, I thoroughly washed it, let it dry then seasoned it with oil and cook it in the oven. Now it‚Äôs ready to use. I have used it every morning to make omelettes and they turn out so beautifully and cook so evenly. My favorite part is that the cast iron gets so hot that it melts the cheese and cooks the omelette perfectly. I use the so called lid for this! I love that you can use the lid as a lid and as a pan! Would buy again to gift! Such a beautiful piece.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 31, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Love it, but a little disappointed‚Ä¶', 'author': 'Emmy', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'When I first got this I would have given it 5 stars. It‚Äôs a great one, cooks beautifully, cleans easily. I purchased because I wanted the cooking properties of cast iron, but just a little bit easier clean up. 5 months after purchase with moderate use, the enamel on the handle is chipping. I‚Äôm really disappointed because I‚Äôm not rough on my cookware at all. Not sure why it‚Äôs chipping so easily. I buy cast iron for the longevity, but I‚Äôm not sure how long this set will actually last.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars We just love cast iron pans', 'author': 'Kathy Salem', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My son asked for one after coming over and cooking in ours He loves his too', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Pre-Seasoned Cast Iron Camp Dutch Oven, 4.1 qt, including Lid Lifter, Lid Stand and Silicone Handle Holders
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Dutch Oven!', 'author': 'Bluestem', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is my 8th Dutch oven and I have to say I was pleasantly surprised by the quality (3 of which are for campfire use-the rest are porcelain coated and I used them in the kitchen). Great design with the coiled handle and lip on one side to aid in pouring. Looks well made and the finish is as good as my Lodge and Petromax camping ovens. I had planned to buy a Lodge but Lodge does not make one this size with the cooktop lid and no legs, This oven fills that niche well. I have not cooked with it yet but I did season it following directions in the manual and it seasoned perfectly using canola oil. The manual for the oven is well written and has excellent advice. If I fault anything it's that the manual is tiny and I had to use a magnifying glass to read it. Can't wait to cook with this, especially while camping and I will revisit this review if I discover that it does not work as well in the woods as I hope it will. A nice touch adding the lid lifter and the silicone handle holders.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great pot, needs initial prep', 'author': 'JA', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Upon arrival, it was very rough and coarse. It fits in my camper oven perfectly for storage and is big enough to cook a nice pot of soup for my family. It‚Äôs been a workhorse, and I have no complaints.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars How something this well made, so inexpensive?', 'author': 'Yes, I am a real person', 'rating': 5, 'content': "If you are looking for a high quality dutch oven with feet, then look no further. This pot is beautifully made and will last for generations if you care for it properly. It does come seasoned but you will want to wash it and re-season it yourself before use. I clean my cast iron with olive oil and salt, then I rinse it and put it on a hot burner or oven to dry.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 7, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Dutch oven time', 'author': 'Tom Fodell', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Cooks well. Hard to clean and needs constant reseasoning', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great quality and price', 'author': 'Zombywolf', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Very nice quality, cast finish was smooth and pre-seasoned.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 25, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect gift for someone who loves camping!', 'author': 'Mary Gray', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It was a Christmas gift for my husband and he loves using it every chance he gets.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 25, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very good casting', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I know there are many that think if it‚Äôs not glass smooth it‚Äôs not good. I own a number of of cast iron cookware and grew up with them. If you follow the directions in the instruction sheet provided you will have a great piece of cookware that will be fun to cook with. Only one of the six pieces I have are smooth. Without the texture to anchor the polymerization you can get it flaking off in your food. The smooth one is used the least. Never have a problem with food sticking in the textured pans. For the price of this Dutch oven you can‚Äôt go wrong. Give cast iron a try and you‚Äôll find it‚Äôs a new adventure in cooking.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 16, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Love cooking with this!', 'author': 'Beren', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I use this Dutch oven all the time when camping. The picture shows that it comes with the metal stand but mine did not. I had to purchase that separately. But overall this is an awesome Dutch oven.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 4, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Rough surface. Needs some QC.', 'author': 'ME', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I ordered this dutch oven because I was looking for a pot with a Dutch oven lid, but without the legs so that I could use it on my stove. This Dutch oven met all of my requirements.As for quality, I have several Lodge cast iron products as a comparison.ProsInexpensive.No cracks.Came with a lid lifter and silicone grabbers.Lid fits well.ConsThere are a few imperfections in the casting in a spot just below the lip and on one side.The cast iron is extremely, and inconsistently rough throughout, rougher than Lodge for anyone that has a Lodge product to compare. There was also a 1" wide smooth spot on one section of the inside bottom, which only served to emphasize the roughness.I\'ve never felt the need to sand down new cast iron cookware before, but felt that this pot was unecceptably rough, and would cause issues while cooking.I spent 2 hours sanding this thing down, and reseasoned it. Now it\'s one of the smoothest cast iron pot I have.If you are willing to put forth the effort of improving the surface roughness I think it\'s worth the price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 3, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Cooks biscuits', 'author': 'Kyle Elam', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Great value for entry level Dutch oven cooking. title: Camp Chef 12 Qt Seasoned Cast Iron Dutch Oven
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars 2 years later....', 'author': 'Dusty Dawson', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I intentionally waited almost 2 years to do this review and after over probably 300 uses, this is an investment of a lifetime. Personally, the lid alone is worth the cost.. this has become an invaluable tool that I am so glad I bought. This thing is thick, old school cast iron at its best. If you take care of it properly, your super great grandkids will wonder how you cooked dinosaur meat in that thing way back then. Buy it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 19, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great dutch oven', 'author': 'Nozoki', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is my first dutch oven. My internet research found that a lot of people seem to have either Lodge or Camp Chef cast-iron on all the camping forums. I picked this one because I like the lid that doubles as a griddle and also because the price was better than Lodge. I do like that Lodge is made in the U.S., but I wish they were more competitively priced. A 12 quart lodge dutch oven was double the cost of this one. And as I said, I like the legs on the Camp Chef lid.I was afraid that 12 quarts might be too big, but the lid actually accounts for about 3 of those quarts, so the pot is only about 9 quarts which is a perfect size for me. It was pre-seasoned and the first thing I made was a cobbler. Clean up was easy. After cleaning I heated it on my grill to dry it and then rubbed some more oil all over it. A few days later I wanted to test how well the lid worked as a griddle. The legs on the lid let me sit it right on the coals and I made some bacon and eggs. I cooked the bacon first and the lid held a whole pound of it. After that I drained the bacon grease and fried a half dozen eggs and there was no trouble with sticking. Again, clean up was a breeze. While still warm I wiped it out with some water and a small scrub brush. Re-oiled it and it's ready for my next meal.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 11, 2010', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good product, can be added more additional products for sale', 'author': 'Goodman', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Good product. I made my own stowe. It would be gr to offer ez fire stand like on other picture.Gulas recipe (10 liters)Up to 5 lbs of beef4-5 lbs onionoil 1, Into heated oil add 1 tablespoon (TS) of salt and sliced \u200b\u200bonion. First fry the onion about halfway without a lid and then cover with a lid. The state does not evaporate and remains in the goulash. The onion is boiled and made a stew density. When the onion is drowned in its own liquid, throw in into the pot: 2, Add to pot: 1 TS McCormick Dark Chili Powder 1 TS Hickory smoked powder 1 TS smoked paprika (or 1 more TS spices above) At the end of the handle of the spoon of Mace (nutmeg) Add: few bay leaves, 5 cloves, 10 whole peper, 10 allspice 3, Stir it and hand in the meat. Stir often and keep under cover. When the meat is solid, add water to the full pot then cook till meat is cooked. 4, 2 large potatoes cut into small pieces either toss with water into the pot or precook in a extra pot and throw the potatoes into the pot with water. Potatos disapear and will make density of goulash. If you like potatos in it just put 2 more sliced to larger pieces after meat is soft. 5, when the meat is soft to throw a pair of steamed sliced \u200b\u200bpeppers. Cook for a few minutes and eat with bread', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 30, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome Cast Iron', 'author': "Trey's", 'rating': 5, 'content': "Love, love, love this dutch oven. It's huge, preseasoned and great for both the home and camping. We took this out to South Dakota on a camping trip as soon as it arrived. We appreciated that we could use it right away because it was already preseasoned. It was big enough to make a big batch of chili at the campsite. We are slightly obsessed with cast iron cookware here and were a little wary of ordering a product that wasn't a Lodge product, but this is great.On a side note, we also bought another, smaller, cast iron dutch oven from Cabella's. It was not preseasoned (an essential process with cast iron in which you coat the product with cooking oil, place in an oven and turn it on to 350 degrees. Then you turn off the oven, let the cast iron cool, and repeat a few times). It was also, in our opinion, slightly lesser in quality.We would definitely buy more of these products in the future.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 8, 2016', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Must have', 'author': 'Your Mama', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I love this it's the best thing for a large family camping. I love that the lid turns into a skillet that makes it almost the only cookware you need for camping. I take this and one large regular cast iron skillet. I think if you had a small family it would be all you need. I have 8 kids and a husband go figure lol This is really good quality too because I used it on a fire with a ring of rocks and cooked like a champion. Made the perfect amount of soup for my family as well. I can't say enough about it and can't wait to use it again. I also bought the liners for it and that made clean up a snap while camping. It's heavy but that is to be expected as all cast iron is and that's why I love cast iron so much. Pretty indestructable.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 10, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Oustanding!', 'author': 'quiverful', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is the first Dutch Oven I have ever purchased and after a long search I decided on this one. I liked the features of the legs on the lid which allows you to use it as a skillet by itself and it had just the right capacity for my hungry brood. Although not mentioned in any reviews I could find or in the specifications, it also has a notch in the lid and lip of the pot for your typical thermometer probe. I waited until it arrived to confirm this before I acquired a digital thermometer to help me monitor the internal temperature of the oven. There are many good sites on-line that discuss how to control the temperature but I felt that being new to this method of cooking a thermometer would help until I get used to it. The pot is well built, pre-seasoned and ready to go right out of the box. It was also an excellent price compared to other brands I looked at. For my first dish I made an Apple Crisp in it that was delicious and very well received. All in all this is an excellent compliment to by custom campfire spit cooking equipment and I look forward to creating many more wonderful recipes in it for years to come.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 16, 2012', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Camp Chef Grand Canyon 12-Qt Dutch Oven', 'author': 'Amy', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Recieved this product a few weeks ago. So far I\'ve used it serveral times, and have cooked a variety of meals in it. Its performance thus far has been great. It holds heat very well, and is solidly constructed. I was a little disappointed to see that it was manufactured in China, but I should have researched before. With that said, it performs on par with it\'s "Lodge" counterparts as I also own a Lodge 8qt. and a 6qt. dutch oven. Plus you\'ll save between 20-40 dollars with this purchase over the Lodge products. This dutch oven is slightly thinner than it\'s Lodge counterparts though, but I\'m not sure if it\'s a quality issue, or if all 12qt.\'s and higher have slightly thinner walls. The slightly thinner wall doesn\'t seem to be an issue though, as again, it does hold heat in very well. It comes \'pre-seasoned\' but as I do with all my new or used cast iron, I go ahead and give it a good scrub down with an abrasive brillo pad and a little Dawn liquid soap and re-cure it myself. I know there are some who will scoff, or react in horror at doing this, but I\'ve cooked with cast iron for well over 20 yrs and as long as you give it a good scrub, and then rinse it clean, then promply dry it with a towel then add another light coat of veggie shortening or oil, you will have no problems with pitting or rust. The top of this dutch oven has a nice retainer lip for hot coals to be placed on top for even heat distribution and has a good sturdy lifting ring that\'s well balanced. It can even be turned upside down to make a nice cooking griddle for pancakes or eggs and even has its own support pegs for this purpose My box also came with a new lifting tool, so there\'s no need to purchase one if you don\'t already have one. It\'s plenty big enough to cook a full sized chicken and all the sides. You could probably even cook a young turkey in it too, if you split it in half, and lay the halves down flat. I hauled this in for a little over 50 bucks and so far it has been worth every penny. In fact, if I was only going to own one dutch oven, this would be the one. If I ever find myself in a "bug-out" survival/flee situation...This dutch oven will come with me. I would give this a full 5 stars, but again...China..', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2013', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very good quality and perfect size.', 'author': 'Jaroslav K.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This thing works great. Very heavy duty material and will last a lifetime. Worked especially well on my camp chef 16" 3 burner, and with my camp chef dutch oven dome cover. Had a brain waive using it for the first time and used it as a smoker and turned out some amazing smoked baked beans. I took the lid of the camp chef dutch oven, and placed on the camp chef stove as a pan. I then put a few small apple wood chunks (not touching each other) down on the pan. Put the dutch oven on top, covered with the oven dome and voila! A perfect little smoker. I\'ll be using this for a long time and I can tell you some of the people camping with us this weekend are going to go out and buy this. I fed 20 hungry people with this size, and a few people came back for thirds. 5 stars!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 26, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Built like a tank', 'author': 'PAUL', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Nothing', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 2, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice design, not quite to standards of Lodge', 'author': 'Camp Cook', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Let me start by saying it is a beautiful dutch oven! I love the legs molded into the lid, and the depth of the lid. (very handy) It dwarfs my 12 inch Lodge dutch oven. The design in the lid is a nice perk, but if anything, it probably makes the lid weaker. I still like it though.I don\'t have a caliber handy, but going by feel, I believe the Lodge is slightly thicker. I also noticed the Camp Chef does not seem to be an even thickness all the way around. Defiantly a quality issue. It may be my imagination, but the cast iron doesn\'t feel as solid as the Lodge dutch oven. All things being equal I would go with the Lodge which is American made, but they aren\'t equal. The Lodge is considerably more expensive so I am happy with my purchase. If the Camp Chef cracks on me, or food burns easily, I\'ll change my tune in a hurry, but I don\'t think it will, and the design with legs built into the lid, is so much better than the basic Lodge design. I like the Grand Canyon casting in the lid even though it is simple, it adds charm to the pot. I now have a 10", two 12" and the new Camp Chef which is 14". At this point I would give it two thumbs up, but only 4 stars because it does feel a little thinner, and being a bigger pot it should be slightly thicker than the 12". If you can afford the Lodge go with it, but if you\'re on a budget like me, I think the Camp Chef is a good value.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 11, 2012', 'is_verified': True}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great little egg pan', 'author': 'Donna', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Washes with ease. I would not put this in the dishwasher. Looking at the comparable items, the price looks high.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Dishwasher Safe, Works on All Cookers', 'author': 'LSS', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Ordered this to replace a smaller Teflon Dutch Oven I have owned for many years that was scratched and worn. Was looking for a large Dutch Oven that would work on induction, electric and gas cookers: an added bonus of this is it is oven safe. Because it is cast aluminum, it is much lighter than cast iron and has properties of cast iron.The color of the inside of the pot is a different shade than outside, a dark turquoise inside and navy outside, which is visible in the listing photos: for me it would be more pleasing if the inside were a completely different color than looking mismatched, but maybe it has to do with the material of the inside and the outside?I haven't tried putting this in the freezer yet, but both top and pot went through the dishwasher well and it would be easier to wash by hand than cast iron. Regular cast iron is hard to clean and too heavy for me to handle. Price point is something to compare to other similar products. A set of silicon oven mitts that match the inside of the pot's dark turquoise color are a nice touch.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars lighter than cast iron', 'author': 'Martin Mortensen', 'rating': 5, 'content': "My wife has been making sourdough bread in our cast iron dutch oven. I've been helping her put it in and out of the oven because it's so heavy. This aluminum one is light enough she can handle it herself. I think it heats up and cools off faster than cast iron so cooking times need to be adjusted some. This first loaf came out a little darker than she wanted. Be advised on the first use it smokes. It set off our smoke detector. So use the stove exhaust fan the first time you use it. I assume it's burning off oils and volatiles from manufacturing. title: AmazonCommercial Enameled Cast Iron Covered Small Round Cocotte, 18 Ounce, Red
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Functional and cute, well made', 'author': 'Pupspicacious', 'rating': 5, 'content': "AmazonCommercial Enameled Cast Iron Covered Small Cocotte, 18-Ounce, RedI got the 18oz size and it's functionally about 15oz-16oz--you'd be at the brim with 18oz. Great size for single or double servings. Fits in my Cuisinart TOA-60 Convection Toaster Oven Airfryer too. Perfect for soup, oatmeal, reheating things or individual/double side dishes or desserts. Heavier than you'd guess at 2.8lbs! And it's so cute! I'm careful with it as I am with my large Dutch Ovens and haven't had issues with the enamel chipping. Lid sits perfectly and evenly so it doesn't let too much moisture escape. Hand wash to clean and be sure to immediately dry the exposed cast iron rim to prevent rusting. You can oil that edge if you want to, but I find that as long as I dry it promptly, rust isn't a problem. I got mine at a discount for $11.03, definitely worth it! I will probably pick up another one.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 29, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars It's Perfect!!", 'author': 'D Jones', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I wanted something I could use for roasted garlic as well as baked Brie. This is perfect for both, and it's so cute. I do use a bit of spray oil and so far, it's been really easy to clean. This was an awesome deal at less than $12, it would also be a cute gift.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 17, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Do not buy !!', 'author': 'Itai', 'rating': 1, 'content': "Very small! Not sutble for anything, this is really not fair to sell this kind of things.I spend over 1,000$ in the last week and the seller won't let me return it in a proper way, I need to drive so far just to drop it, and it's not worth the gas.Very disappointing. I'm stopping buying in Amazon.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 1, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great for small jobs!', 'author': 'Annie N', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this little pot to roast garlic. Works beautifully for small items. Heats well. Easy clean up. Very happy with purchase!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 26, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Tiny but very useful.', 'author': 'Paul Brew', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I like to experiment in the kitchen and I needed a dutch oven. I stumbled on this item and gave it a shot.I've used it for trying out micro recipes. Something of a lost art since it seems very few people can divide for ingredients.So far it's worked great for bread and stews. I even tried a chicken heart and veggie pie recipe I found in a very old cook book. It worked great and I would have never tried it on a full sized pie.. To much chance I'd hate it.Summation: Well worth the money.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Attractive but wrong volume advertised', 'author': 'Abraham B', 'rating': 3, 'content': "We just got this. We washed it and immediately set out to measure its volume. We transferred exactly 2-cups (16-oz) of water from a Pyrex 2-cup measuring cup into the cocotte and it was filled to the brim--nearly overflowing. Then we filled the pot with water to its brim and carefully transferred to a large glass measuring cup. It came up to the 2-cup mark. This is supposed to be 18-oz which would allow cooking 2-cups of food with more than a 10% volume play room. As it is, to cook safely in this, one must use less than 2-cups of ingredients--disappointing.We were going to return this, but for the price, it will still make a cool little summer fruit dish so you can eat fruit outside while limiting flying insects commandeering your dessert (sturdy lid). And it seems well made. A lot of enameled metal dishes have a very thin layer of enamel that's easily damaged. Amazon seems to have used many layers over this dish's underlying iron, though. So we'll keep the dish. Very attractive unit, but smaller than advertised.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 28, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Very small', 'author': 'Mrs. Debi Long', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Nice individual dish very small', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect little Coquette', 'author': 'Glenna L. Robinson', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Just what I was looking for at a great price, less than $12. I wanted a Coquette without the cost of buying four at a ridiculous price that other companies offer. The blue goes perfectly with my Lodge enameled cookware. It would be ideal to bake garlic when you have the oven going with a roast and small enough to tuck into a small space. Would also be good to bake an apple or pear. Packed very well, in a box that was constantly contained in another box secured with styrofoam, then in the shipping box. I love it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Too small', 'author': 'Tina.T', 'rating': 3, 'content': "Didn't look as small in pictures but this little pot is cute very small", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Was able to fill it with a measured only 14oz of water.', 'author': 'mhemp', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Smaller than the claimed 18 oz. Filled it with 14oz of water although 12oz is a more practical volume to avoid spillage. Looks like a larger Dutch oven and will keep it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Made In Cookware - Dutch Oven 5.5 Quart - Red - Enameled Cast Iron - Exceptional Heat Retention & Durability - Professional Cookware - Crafted in France - Induction Compatible
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Quality', 'author': 'Angie Haley', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Quality is amazing! This is a wonderful Dutch oven! I go out of my way to support companies who choose to manufacture domestically and in Europe, a region with one of the most stringent worker, material, and environmental safety standards.Made In, as their name suggests, cares about where their products are manufactured. They describe their commitment on their website: "We partnered with the best raw material providers and multi-generational, family-owned manufacturers in the U.S. and Western Europe to build superior culinary tools. With the world‚Äôs finest chefs as product development partners, Made In products are designed to perform and crafted to last."I cook exclusively from scratch for my family and spend a lot of time in the kitchen. So, my cookware needs to be up to the task. I now have a few items from Made In and have been happy with all of them. This Dutch Oven is the same great quality that I have come to expect from the brand.This Dutch Oven is made of heavy and sturdy cast iron. The enamel coating adds durability and functionality. I chose the "Red" color and it\'s a very fun pop of color. The handles and lid are easy to grip with pot holders. This is very well built - a true heritage piece!The 5.5 quart size is great for cooking or baking a variety of dishes, it\'s become a true workhorse in my kitchen. I have used it to bake fresh sourdough bread and also make stews and roasts. It has excellent functionality!I am thrilled with this 5.5 QT Dutch Oven from Made In. It has excellent performance and is a joy to use! I fully expect it to last a lifetime.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 14, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Buy it', 'author': 'Ty Haynes', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'That ‚Äúother‚Äù brand is nice but this one is right there with it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect', 'author': 'Tracie Germain', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Been wanting one forever. title: HaSteeL 7 QT Cast Iron Dutch Oven, Large 2 in 1 Camp Pre-Seasoned Deep Pot & Lid Skillet Pan, Heavy Thick 7 Quart Multiple Cookware with Feet for Outdoor Camping Baking, Bracket and Lid Lifter
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very nice Dutch oven', 'author': 'James H', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Quality Dutch oven. Gourmet meals with this one (don‚Äôt ask my kids LOL!) - From short ribs, to stews, to roasts and bread, you can make pizza, you can make fried chicken and mac and cheese, the list goes on! - Beautiful cast iron - I always season my own cast irons and this one came out like a champ! - Heavy, but GOOD - 11/10', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 18, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for camping!', 'author': 'Just Honest', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I love cat iron so I'm picky about quality. I can cook soup or steak with this set! Everything fits nicely in the pot for storage. Recommend this set for sure.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 30, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great for backyard fun', 'author': 'Jody D.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I‚Äôm very happy with its performance.We‚Äôve baked bread in it and made soup. Cleaned up well, and comes with everything you need.Oh and the price is phenomenal.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 18, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars heavy duty camping dutch oven with handy skillet lid', 'author': 'Roger Appelinski', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. I\'m helping start up a scouting type organization and we are gathering our camping supplies. I spotted this huge cast iron dutch oven from HaSteeL and immediately ordered it.This is a heavy duty 7 quart dutch oven. It comes with a round rack for cooking meat. The lid doubles as a skillet which may come in handy as well. There\'s a sturdy lid lifter as well.This is going to be solely for camping as we have a dutch oven for our home cooking already. This will be perfect for cooking parts of large meals over the fire. It will easily handle the wear and tear of a bunch of boys using it.I am a little confused by their instructions regarding "before first use." There\'s a card that says to wash it with detergent, but the user manual says no detergent is needed. What they show next is how to season the cast iron, but the listing claims this is pre-seasoned. So, I\'m not sure which is correct. I guess I will follow their instructions to re-season it just in case.I\'m really pleased with the construction of this.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 15, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars QUALITY IS COMPARABLE TO A WELL KNOWN AMERICAN BRAND - LEGS ARE PROBLEMATIC', 'author': 'Cleve', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Been using cast iron for over 40 years. This is a good set. Well molded and finished with no slag, snags, or evidence of weak spots. Nice handles. Nicely pre seasoned. My only problem may be burner use. Because of the three legs this will not work on all stovetops. Can probably adapt to gas stoves like mine.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 30, 2023', 'is_verified': False}]

title: IMUSA USA 4.9Qt Ruby Red Nonstick Dutch Oven with Glass Lid and Soft Touch Handles, 5 Quarts
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect For Us Bachelors!', 'author': 'Robert Klosterkemper', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've often wanted a Dutch Oven because of the great soups, stews, etc. that can be made in them. Honestly, a great pot with a lid is nice enough but the Dutch Oven is like the difference between a car and a luxury car. They both get you there but one gets you there in comfort.I'm all by myself and so a full size Dutch Oven is very much overkill for me. I love this thing because, while it is big, it's not too big.It's got a coating on it but it's not like Teflon or whatever. It's more of a porcelain coating and nothing sticks to it. It's great. And it cleans up like a boss. I don't have a dish washer and so easy cleanup is important to me. A little Dawn detergent and I'm good to go with this thing.I made a chicken and rice dish that was almost too much for the pot, tho. I mistakenly added 2 cups of rice, which is an ENORMOUS amount of rice. It was fine, though. I browned the chicken before adding it to the Dutch Oven and then I slow cooked it all together in the pot. It was delicious and I ate that for like a week. It makes a lot of food.I then made a pot of Cincinnati Chili, and I'm still eating on that. The thing makes a ton of food and so you need some good food storage containers and some room in your refrigerator for leftovers.I love this thing.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 7, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars My new favorite soup cauldron', 'author': 'Ivan Koretsky', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Lightweight, easy to clean, perfectly sized cauldron. It's lightweight but not chintzy; I'd feel confident making just about anything in it, and it washes up in a minute - hot soapy water does it faster than the dishwasher. The color is cheerful too. title: Cooks Standard Dutch Oven Casserole with Glass Lid, 7-Quart Classic Stainless Steel Stockpot, Silver
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Value Excellent Quality', 'author': 'M. Oze', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Love this pot. A great size for super size chilies, soups and stews. I also like the lid design, which has a pretty thick lower rim, so it hopefully won't ding up over time. The handles contain no plastic to crack, so hopefully it'll last a long time.On the downside, it's not the easiest to clean - but that is true of basically all stainless steel cookware; it's the price for not having to deal with Teflon or ceramic coatings flaking off over time. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars High value, enameled Dutch oven', 'author': 'pje', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The Segretto 6 qt Dutch oven is a great value (I paid $72). The enameling is high quality, beautiful and seems durable (though I've only had the item for 3 weeks). The handles are nicely sized - easy for a man's hand or to handle with mitts (unlike Lodge handles). It is easy to clean with a perfect-fitting lid - just enough space to let some steam out whilst retaining heat. The lid also has those little basting stalactites whereas the Lodge and Amazon Basics lids do not. The item is made in China and that is not easy to find out without reading reviews. That said, it is good quality. My one small complaint is heat distribution - there should be a bit more cast iron in the bottom. Of course that adds weight and at 14 pounds, this pot is plenty heavy. title: Cuisinart Contour Stainless 5-Quart Dutch Oven with Glass Cover, Silver
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A swell little pan that will give YEARS of use!!!!', 'author': 'Darkgardyner', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is a GREAT pan!!! The lid fits well, and its glass-so you can keep an eye on what you are cooking, the bottom hearts evenly and quickly, and if you follow the 'hot pan, cold oil' rule, you should have a nice surface that doesn't stick AND cleans up well.While I have ALWAYS used and loved the natural non-stick qualities of the large cast iron fry pans used to cook family meals, I wanted something that could go thru the dishwasher, wasn't hard on my wrists, and was big enough to cook a whole casserole. This pan TOTALLY fits the bill.I also love that it can go from stove top to oven, and that the handles aren't long, wieldy and clumsy. They do get hot if you are cooking for a long period, like a rice or one-pot pasta meal, however they are designed well, and nicely accommodate pot mitts.This pan is also very pretty, shiny inside and out, pretty enough to display on open shelving.I just want to say that think's it's unfair to compare this modestly priced item to pans that go for 15 times as much, and then give this pan an unfair rating. I have read a lot of reviews for pans around this price, and have found a few people saying that they prefer their $350.00 french chef pan they picked up while on holiday‚Ä¶.apples to oranges.All in all, this is swell little pan that is appropriately priced..I know I am going to get YEARS of use from this pan. The shape of this pan makes it perfect for Chicken pot pie, One-pot pasta, Shepherds pie, baked fish and chicken, enchiladas, breakfast casserole, stir fry, biscuits, and much more.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 12, 2013', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A weekday workhorse', 'author': 'Nathan S', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Perfect everyday pan. The handles are hefty and sturdy, the bottom is weighted and balanced nicely to sit very still while lightly stirring with one hand on a glass top or induction surface. This pan heats evenly and quickly and holds temperature surprisingly well when large cuts of cold meat or food enter the pan.This makes short work of sauteeing, simmering, braising, and just about anything other regular household cooking duties you can throw at it. Being dishwasher safe makes it even better, once the visible food particles have been sprayed or cleaned off this thing can just be popped right in the dishwasher to save tedious scrubbing that nobody wants to do after a meal. Comes out of a regular dishwasher cycle looking brand new.The only downside, and this isn't even really a huge deal but is just worth mentioning in case someone has delicate or sensitive skin on their hands, is the fact that the very outer lip edge of the pan appears to be slightly squared/angled instead of polished or ground to a smooth edge. The very edge of the lip is noticeably sharp to the touch, not enough to actually cut skin but it is uncomfortable to run your bare hand or finger over the lip of the pan while cleaning. Good thing the handles on this are top notch and minimize the amount of times you will ever realistically need to touch the edge of the pan itself. Minor detail, but it feels a little unfinished on the edge compared with how smooth and nice the texture of the handles, exterior, and interior of the actual pan are.Overall for the price point this is a no-brainer to pick up for a great all-purpose pan. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars It‚Äôs just perfect!', 'author': 'penny townsend', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Love the light wait of this and my breads turn out perfect!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Finally a 3quart one', 'author': 'JoAnn B', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'First one this size that I could find. Nice red color. Trying it out tomorrow.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars dutch oven', 'author': 'gram', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Very nice dutch oven perfect size for my breads very easy to clean', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars wonderful for sourdough bread baking', 'author': 'Mary Mary', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'So pretty and excellent for bread baking. I bought another as a gift for a friend.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great with one design flaw', 'author': 'Gene Leistico', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I bought this to make sourdough in. It produces a really great loaf with excellent crust but you need to account for its design flaw. The top necks in just a little which can make it difficult to get the loaf out once baked. If not for this design flaw, it would have definitely be 5 stars. After some expirementing, here's what works really well:-Keep your loaf size to 450 grams of flour or less-for the final proof, put a piece of parchment paper in a smallish bowl. I pleat the parchment paper to make it fit. make sure the edges of the parchment paper are high enough to extend about the top of the fully proofed loaf. You will use this to lower in and lift out the loaf after baking.-To extract the loaf after baking, I usually have to lift one side of the loaf out first and the use a wooden spatula under the bottom to gently pry it out. A second person can be helpful.-I preheat it in a 450 oven for an hour and bake at 450 also. For a fantastic crispy crust, I pour about a 1/3 of a cup of hot water in pot right before putting the loaf in and putting the cover on. Be careful of the steam!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 25, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very versatile!', 'author': 'William B.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Works great for in the oven & on the stove top.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Delivers!', 'author': 'Dan D', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This Dutch oven arrived safely and intact because it was so well packaged! Foam, cardboard, whatever, wherever it was needed. Big exhale.I then washed the Dutch oven thoroughly, and was ready to roll! The instructions recommended a small amount of oil (I used avacado spray) for that first use, and that's what I did.I put some cleaned and steamed veggies and assorted meat and potatoes and put it on my stoves gas burner, on a low flame, and gave it about an hour to cook.Following that I removed it from the heat but kept the lid on and put a pair of oven mitts on top and a cotton dish cloth on top of that and gave it another hour to slow cool. The heat retention of this pot is outstanding, and was just what I had hoped it would be able to do.But I wasn't sure how effective the dimpled interior of the lid would be in the stated claim of dropping little droplets of steam onto the contents.It works!! I finally removed the lid and was instantly impressed by by the sight and smell of what was inside. Perfect! The food was delicious and the oven delivered in every way. The nutritional aspects were intact, and the meal was several bowls delicious.Clean up was also a pleasant surprise. Some warm water, a small amount of dish soap, and it was good-to-go.In summation, this Dutch oven delivered in every way, from delivery to taste to cleaning. And, at this price (or twice this price) it has been money well spent.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 18, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great size for smaller loaves of bread.', 'author': 'William Pool', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought these to bake smaller loaves of artisan bread to give to friends. They are perfect and easy to clean. I was very pleased with the design and the appearance of these Dutch ovens and the price was the best of any I could find. The are ceramic, not cast iron coated with enamel, so you need to be careful not to hit them on anything. But they are not fragile either. About 1/4 to 3/8 inch thick. They should last a long time given the proper care.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Pretty little pot', 'author': 'Madiantin', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Debated pretty hard between this pot and an enamelled cast iron dutch oven, and eventually went with this one for four reasons:1. The price2. The colour3. The fact that it would get here the next day.4. The lighter weight.The pot arrived very well packed in sturdy foam. The box was a little scuffed, presumably in rough Amazon transit, but the pot was completely unscathed. There was a small amount of what appeared to be sticker residue of some sort on the lip of the pot, but that came off with no effort when I washed it.The difference in colour between the top and bottom is quite noticeable. The top is a lovely glazed blue, the bottom is matt, with a more indigo colour to it. If you're slightly OCD, this colour difference will drive you bananas.Upon receipt of the box, I immediately unpacked the pot, washed it, and promptly baked a loaf of bread. It turned out pretty well! I'm a very beginning baker, and by the looks of my boule it could use another few minutes in the oven, but overall it worked exactly as I hoped it would.The 3qt pot is perfect for a small loaf.Mindful of the reviews saying the lid did not fit, and the sides were slightly tapered, I paid attention to those things. The lid fits perfectly. The sides are indeed very very slightly tapered - but you'd only notice if you were looking very closely. I used parchment paper when baking the bread, and it lifted out of the pot with no problems at all. It may be an issue if you use a much larger amount of dough? I think it would take at least twice or three times the amount before removal became an issue.Overall I am very pleased indeed with this pretty little pot. If anything goes wrong in subsequent months I will update my review, so if you see no update you can assume all is well.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 21, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cooks excellent sourdough bread', 'author': 'Harland Butler', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Everything is great', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars When you need something a bit bigger than your standard dutch oven!', 'author': 'LaneyBee', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This pot is absolutely wonderful! reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to clean', 'author': 'DNelson', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I love this casserole/Dutch oven. I use it quite often.
