title: Le Creuset Enameled Cast Iron Signature Sauteuse Oven, 3.5 qt., Cerise
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A sturdy beautiful pot', 'author': 'Christine D', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. This strong Sauteuse Oven gets the job done. The color really pops and is so beautiful to look at. Everything cooks well and quick in it as it holds the heat. It is a bit on the heavy size when compared to its size. It is not the biggest pot by any means, but handles all the food I have put in it over the years. It is also very clean, still - no stains, nothing stock on it because it is very easy to clean. This pot will last me a decade or more and I hope to buy more in its line because of how well it has done in my home.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best pot/pan/casserole dish and more in my kitchen!', 'author': 'WildCheetah', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I cook a lot and this is by far the most versatile and now, the most used pot/pan in my kitchen. It‚Äôs a skillet/frying pan that browns food well, a deep skillet, a sauce pot, a soup pot, a casserole dish, and a stove-to-oven pan. So versatile! The size is great for 4-6 servings, depending on what you‚Äôre cooking.I bought the licorice colour and it‚Äôs a matte black, but with enough sheen not to be boring. Definitely pretty enough to use as a serving dish. I‚Äôve been using it so often, I keep it on the stove since it looks so nice.This is my first Le Creuset and I am very impressed. Heats well, easy to clean, and this size is easy to handle. Even fits in my Breville counter oven.I have a 5 quart inexpensive Chefmate Dutch oven and wanted the 5.5 quart Le Creuset Dutch Oven, but thought it silly since mine cooks fine. But having used this, I see such better quality, that it‚Äôs back on my wishlist now. That said, I‚Äôd still want this 3.5 quart size for its versatility and easy handling. I can see both getting a lot of use.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 20, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome Pot', 'author': 'Kevin F', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Love this thing. I already have a LC 5.5 Qt. Dutch Oven, and wanted something smaller, but not a brasier. This thing is about 3.5 Q and I use it for everything from cooking pasta, making sauce or chili, browning meat, cooking cabbage, or boiling water. The list goes on.I like that it\'s less weight than my other pot. The lid fits snugly. It\'s easy to clean. Any tough spots easily come of with Bar Keeper\'s Friend. It has yet to see the inside of my dishwasher, and probably won\'t.There are waayyy lower priced versions of enameled cast iron pots & pans, but, Le Creuset is built to last for Decades. Hi quality and top notch. I rarely give anything 5 Stars, but, this stuff is worth it. I didn\'t rate the "Giftable" category in this review, because it\'s Mine! LOL. Worth saving up for. Highly recommended.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars heirloom utility', 'author': 'rw24', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'what can i say, it\'s Le Creuset! quality & craftsmanship are superb. thankfully, nabbed this little guy via \'Flash Sale\' or i wouldn\'t have bought it. yes, these are ungodly expensive kitchen utensils but worth every nickel; they\'re consistently flawless & this is our 3rd piece of Le Creuset. i liked this particular 3.5 qt. model for it\'s size & utility (our other 2 pieces are significantly larger). our other pieces were gifts so this one was first we\'d ever bought ourselves & we\'re tickled that we did. my only "beef" (pun intended) is that like all enameled cast iron cookware, the inside will (eventually) stain & there\'s no avoiding this reality. the more you use them, the more \'seasoned\' they will become & the interior will, over time/ usage, begin to stain. i\'ve no tips on how best & safely to remedy this natural cause-effect myself but as for cooking applications Le Creuset is practically nonpareil IMHO. i enjoy cooking... A LOT & our stuff gets used. this handy little bugger though fits the bill when a behemoth cast iron piece just isn\'t necessary. it\'s versatile, lighter than other pieces due to size, extremely durable/ well made & very likely could wind up one of those \'heirloom\' pieces that gets passed down from generation to generation. does this justify the price tag? i don\'t know, you be the judge. however, if you buy it, just know you\'re making a legitimate investment that will pay for itself over and over and over again for decades to come. yes, i would recommend this piece - 100%. Happy Cooking!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars just what I ordered', 'author': 'elizabeth m white', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'A perfect order. Order is everything I hoped for.Right size, right color, right everything, I can always count on Le Creuset. Thank You', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars What‚Äôs not to love?', 'author': 'A G Pena', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It‚Äôs a Le Creuset (made by hand, in France, life time guarantee, with embossed serial number). Williams Sonoma sells this one for $320.00. Amazon had / has it on sale for $179.00. Buying it was a no brainier. (The rim on the first one they sent had a little chip. I returned it to Kohl‚Äôs on Saturday morning. The replacement arrived Sunday afternoon (USPS).) The best quality of all enamel coated cast iron pots; conducts heat really well, making it a pleasure to cook with; cleans easily; beautiful to look at (bought it in original, signature ‚Äúflame‚Äù color). If I cooked more frequently (and could afford it), I‚Äôd buy the whole line in every size (in flame).', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Just a cook‚Äôs dream', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I‚Äôve finally reached the point where my cooking skills deserve the very best cookware. Le Creuset is the epitome of best. The first thing I made were short ribs. Fall off the bone, succulent, decadent, delicious! I‚Äôve never been able to achieve this dish and have it compare to a restaurant. I‚Äôve discovered the trick. Le Creuset cookware. I plan to give one as a wedding gift. No one should have to wait as long as I did to own this amazing piece of culinary art.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Can't go wrong!", 'author': 'KL', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Can't go wrong with Le Creuset! I have a sauteuse that has seen better days and was bummed when they discontinued it in the cerise color. Was so happy to find a replacement at a great price! It's the perfect size for stews, frying, casseroles, etc. And I prefer the curved bottom of the sauteuse vs the flat bottom of the dutch oven. Super happy with my purchase!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Bella', 'author': 'Rafael Rivera', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Buena terminaciones', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice pot.', 'author': 'Mardi Moore', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Nice casserole pot. title: Crock Pot Artisan 5-Quart Round Dutch Oven - Matte Linen White w/Gold Knob

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Even heating and one pot use', 'author': 'Jack', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I purchased this to replace a 14 yr old Dutch oven because the internal enamel was wearing thin and the cast iron was beginning to show through.I use a Dutch oven on a regular basis especially in the winter making, soups, baked beans, chili, and sauces to freeze.Frying chicken in a Dutch Oven is easier, because of it even heating and retention of heat the chicken just looks better, it's evenly colored. I use it in the oven and on the top burners.This Dutch oven is heavier than the one it replaced. The heat distribution seems evenly distributed both in the oven and on top of the stove. Once it's heated and the burner is turned down it retains the heat longer and can burn sauces and soups if you don't know how to cook with it.When I make Baked Beans it stays in the oven at 300 degrees for 6 to 7 hours. There is no scorching or burning of the beans. I made beef stew started it on the stove top and placed it the oven for what ended up to be 5 hours for the most delicious beef stew you've ever tasted.Clean-up is a breeze, I fill it with hot water add some detergent and let is sit for maybe an hour and it wipes clean. I've never had to use scouring pads and I don't recommend them.I highly recommend this product it's cheaper than others but IMO just as good.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Dutch oven', 'author': 'Patricia Racioppo', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I used it to make Artesian Bread.It did a fantastic job. title: ZWILLING Spirit Ceramic Nonstick Dutch Oven, 6-qt, Stainless Steel
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Zwilling Thermolon is the best', 'author': 'G. Sollner', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Having tried three different pans before choosing this Zwilling JA Henckels Spirit Thermolon, this is just a purchase expanding on that choice. Here's a copy of the review I posted on the three test pans:........... Earlier review ..........I have had these pans for a couple of months now, so it's time to jot down my initial impressions. The three brands and the pans I have areCuisinart GGT19-18 GreenGourmet Tri-Ply Stainless 2-Quart SaucepanZwilling J.A. Henckels 3-qt. Thermolon Ceramic Nonstick Spirit Saute Pan, 6-qt. Dutch Oven, andDuxtop Whole-Clad Tri-Ply Stainless Steel 3-Quart Saucepan and 10-Inch Fry PanAll these pans are made from 3-layer sandwiches of magnetic stainless steel on the outside to absorb heat from any stove, including induction, an aluminum layer to distribute the heat over the bottom since stainless steel is a poor heat conductor, and another layer of stainless steel on the inside. All have riveted handles, which is probably inevitable with pots made from a tri-layer sandwich. All have a lifetime warranty. The nonstick pans have an additional layer to prevent sticking. I made a very rough estimate of the thickness of the aluminum layer, which is critical for heat distribution. Judging by how the edges are polished by the manufacturer, the three layers can, in places, be discerned and their thicknesses estimated. Here are my estimates:Duxtop: Total thickness: 2.7 mm (total thickness is the most accurate of the estimates). Outside SS: 0.7 mm, inside SS 0.3 mm, therefore the aluminum layer is about 1.7 mm.Zwilling-Henckels: Total thickness: 3.6 mm); Outside SS: 0.5 mm, inside SS 0.5 mm, therefore the aluminum layer is about 2.6 mm.Cuisinart: Total thickness: 2.7 mm; Outside SS: 0.8 mm; inside SS 0.6 mm, therefore the aluminum layer is about 1.3 mm.The Duxtop pans are by far the most beautiful, with a high polish to the stainless steel inside and out. The handles are heavy cast alloy, also highly polished, and the most comfortable handles in this group. The Duxtop, unlike the Cuisinart and Zwilling pans, do not have nonstick coating. They are ideal for cooking or heating soups and other liquids, and they do a fine job on eggs as long as there is sufficient butter in the pan. However, when it comes to foods that tend to stick, like oatmeal, the nonstick surfaces win out. Also on the negative side, the bottom of the 10-inch frying pan is sufficiently thin that on an induction heater that is only 4.5-inches in diameter, as many are, the edges of the pan are sufficiently cooler than the center that omelets are best done on gas. The highly polished interior does discolor when cooking some foods; however a light application of Bar Keepers Friend brings back the original luster. Not available with nonstick surface, and single piece selection is limited. An 8-piece set is quite reasonable priced.The Zwilling J.A. Henckels pans are somewhat more expensive than the other two and seem of the highest quality. The nonstick is free of both PTFE and PFOA, for those concerned with such things. The claim is that this coating is stable up to 850 F. The handles are perhaps the least comfortable of the three [not an issue with the dutch oven], but OK and not unattractive. The outside finish, while not having the high polish of the Duxtop, is businesslike. In general use, these also seem to spread the heat better than either Duxtop or Cuisinart, which is not surprising given their noticeably thicker aluminum layer. The see-through lids, which neither Duxtop nor Cuisinart have, are nice, though like the others the lid handles do get warm enough eventually that a pot-holder is advised. Of the three brands, this is my favorite.The Cuisinart pans have an outside polish similar to the Zwilling-Henckels with more-comfortable handles, but for their lower price they have thinner tri-ply and solid lids. The nonstick surface is claimed to be PTFE and PFOA free and good to 550 F in the oven. As I only have the 2-qt. pan, there's not much to say, but nothing to complain about. It has been fully nonstick for me, even for challenges like oatmeal, though some others with frying pans have complained about sticking. The bottom seems to spread the heat of a 4.5-inch induction heater better than the Duxtop does, in spite of the thinner estimated aluminum layer. That could be because the lower conductivity of the nonstick allows the aluminum to do its job before the heat makes it through the nonstick. There are reasonably priced sets available that should fill most kitchen needs, and several single pieces are available.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 13, 2013', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best Nonstick Dutch Oven', 'author': 'Tough Critic', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I needed to replace an old GreenPan nonstick Dutch Oven that had a nonstick coating that was no longer non-stick. I looked all over and learned that GreenPan no longer makes that dutch oven. After looking at many alternatives I found this Zwilling Ceramic Nonstick Dutch Oven that was the same size as my old GreenPan. This Zwilling cookware is really well made and features a thick aluminum bottom that heats quickly. When simmering food on my gas cooktop you can see how perfectly even it cooks all the way across the bottom of the pan. The ceramic Thermolon nonstick coating works great and the food slides out of the pan without any effort. I will be using this dutch oven several times a week because the cleanup is so fast and easy.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 14, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Best pot I've ever bought", 'author': 'Anthony S', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The quality is superior to any pot I've ever bought and I have very good pots. Even heating, nothing sticks. Just outstanding. I just wish the handles didn't get hot. Other than that, great value, great pot", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 15, 2018', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So far we like it.', 'author': 'Bwise', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Nice sized pot for cooking. used it for a variety of things so far works well on all them. Seems to cook/heat even. I was unsure on getting the nonstick vs just stainless, the nonstick has been easy to clean even when the sides get a little fried on. also nice that you can put in the oven, worked good with some chicken, browned on stove top, finished in oven. The 6 qts in a good size, and the sides come up some, I have an older revere that is only 5 qts and it splashed some, this is deeps so that is nice.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2015', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy, heavy-duty nonstick pot', 'author': 'Fish Wife', 'rating': 5, 'content': "We needed an induction-capable stock pot/Dutch oven, and this one is great. We're very careful about not using metal implements, but the pot is heavy and cooks really well; and the coating seems very tough. Really does not stick.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2016', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love this!', 'author': 'Michelle Pecheck', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Best cookware purchase I have made all year. Love, love, LOVE it! It heats quickly and evenly, and cleanup is super easy. I use it at least a few times every week, if not more. I bought it via Amazon Warehouse and the item description said some of the packaging might be missing, but everything was there from what I could tell. It arrived in perfect condition and the price was right. Very happy with my purchase!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 27, 2014', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome product', 'author': 'JFB', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is my second Zwilling product. I love these pans! They cook evenly and quickly! I wish I had known about them sooner!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 10, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Favorite pan - updated to my least favorite pan', 'author': 'J.', 'rating': 2, 'content': "This by far my favorite pan. After more than 2 months of continuous use, pan still looks new. Very happy that burnt food comes off very easily. No sign of non-stick layer wearing down. Expensive but think it's money well spend. Now just need to save money to buy more of these pans.Updated to least favorite plan. After 6 months the pan started to stick and over a year later, it's impossible to clean. Unfortunately, also bought a frying pan and that lost it's non-stick ability quickly. For the money, expected better longevity. Money not well spent.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 15, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars this is a joy to use', 'author': 'Salty', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'love this. big handles make easy to carry, just make sure you use pot holders as they get very hot.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 29, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Professional grade', 'author': 'AM', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Love it, solid without being too heavy. Even hear distribution, things Summer without burning. Would recommend!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 14, 2020', 'is_verified': True}]

The quality of the finish and manufacturing shows.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Heavy, non-stick and seems to have good quality.', 'author': 'Reiki', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Review after using it for a few days: The paint hasn't wore off at all, that's a good sign.The pot is very heavy, more than I expected but doesn't good job maintaining heat since the cast iron on it is pretty thick.My only complain is that part of the glas coating on the lid was broken when it arrived, it was like 1.5cm squared.Food doesn't stick at all, I love that, and I hope the glass cover doesn't wear off soon.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars absolutely love this dutch oven!', 'author': 'Amy K.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "i just started making sourdough recently & admit that's the only reason i bought it. this particular one was the best deal & i am amazed at the quality & durability, not to mention the functionality of the lid being used as it's own pan! i admit i haven't cooked on the stovetop with either the top or bottom, but only because i have a lot of other pans for that & haven't found a need to yet, but i totally would make stew, chili, pot roast....the possibilities are only bound to your cooking skills. for sourdough bakers, try using it upside down ;) it's so much easier to remove the loaf!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Enamel coating on an elegant design.', 'author': 'sanlow', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this to use in my outdoor kitchen with an induction "burner", mostly for deep frying. Now that I have it in hand, I see lots of additional uses, even for some healthy dishes. The 7 quart is huge and heavy, and takes a really long time to reach frying temperature on induction -- just something you need to plan for.I wanted cast iron, enamel coated and USA made, a combination that doesn\'t exist. If you want that combination, you just gotta suck it up and accept Made in China or from France at 5X the price! By the way, it appears to me that, unlike all the colors, the black of this product is not enamel coated, and therefore not protected from rust. Also, a narrow strip of the rim of both pot and lid of my Red Dutch Oven is black and not enameled, and subject to rusting if I\'m not careful. I understand why that is necessary -- enamel on the rims would chip off from the heavy contact.Integral loop handles are substantial and allow easy maneuvering of this very heavy utensil. I especially like that it doesn\'t need a little afterthought knob on top. Cleanup is easy with soap and water. I will avoid abrasive materials so as not to scratch the enamel, and carefully dry to protect the exposed rim from rust.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Dutch oven', 'author': 'nance', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this gift for a special person for Christmas. She loves it so much and uses it often. It is unusual in the way that the lid can be used as a frypan. Neat idea.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice', 'author': 'Kim Caudill', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I use this pot all the time and love it, easy to clean', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome!!', 'author': 'Jeremy Pea', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I purchased this for camping but fell in love with it so much I use it everyday for cooking!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: STAUB Ceramics Dutch Oven 16-oz Petite Tomato Cocotte, Cherry
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful, very usable, single-serve casseroles. Make quite a statement!', 'author': 'I Do The Speed Limit', 'rating': 5, 'content': "These are beautiful, darling, perfect for single-serve casseroles. They are ceramic, not enameled cast-iron like the larger Staub tomato cocottes. But they are nicely detailed and just as gorgeous. The stem end is very well done. These come packed just as well as Staub's cast-iron larger pieces.We go through a lot of tomatoes during the summertime, right from our garden. So this purchase was easily justified in our budget. We like a simple casserole of sliced zucchini, yellow squash and tomatoes on a bed of sauteed onion with a bread crumb and cheese topping. These, when not filled to the top, are just right for a large one-person serving. They are a good size for other bowl food, too. Sometimes we do baked beans in one of these, and it serves two.I was surprised to stumble across these on Amazon, and at a great price, too. I usually find my Staub pieces on other online sites. But, hey, look close and you will see it is available with Prime shipping on this product page! And I was worried about how the stem knob would travel, and was happy to rely on Amazon's return policy. title: Neoflam Kiesel 2qt Non-Stick Ceramic Casserole Pot, Dutch Oven, Clay Pot, Stockpot For Stew, Soup, Steam, Scratch Resistant, Oven Safe, Heat Resistant, Plum
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love it!', 'author': 'K', 'rating': 5, 'content': "i have had this over at least 8 years. I have had 2: The first model of this was 1.5 qt, and this is second generation of 2 qt.The first one I got it from Chinese supermarket since I had been looking for one for a while. Back then the pots in Chinese supermarket were super leaky. Since Koreans has a lot clay pot dishes, why not try? It turned out that this one really exceeded my expectations. I mostly use it to make soup, and everything is just so perfectly cooked in every way - perfect texture, and it preserves all the flavors somehow. I have tried to use all other pots, and trust me, nothing is the same. It has become my perfect heavy soup pot. Usually I cook it to boil, and turned off the stove. Let it sit and continue cooking itself. For most part that's all it takes unless it's something like big chunky bones.I just follow the instructions to use: never turn up the stove higher than medium and always has liquid in the pot. To clean it I just put water inside and boil, wipe it clean while the pot is warm with sponges. Until one day I forgot it on the stove and the bottom of the pot was completely burnt. I saw small crack lines on the bottom and even though surface was still sealed fine. At that point I decided to get my second one through Amazon, since all the local supermarket sold out, and I got the last one in stock.I thought Neoflam stopped making it, and I am glad to see this is still around (yay). Hope you enjoy this one as much as I have.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Yes', 'author': 'Toria Burton', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I use this product for Korean stews or hot pot kind of meals, it heats up and cooks really well on my electric stove top. Cute color. Easy to clean, highly recommend if you‚Äôre looking for a stew pot.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 23, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars My New Favorite Pot', 'author': 'Julia', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I got the 1QT sized kiesel and it is the perfect size for one person. Filled all the way, you can make about two portions of soup (or one large portion if you eat a lot). I use it right on the stove top and in the microwave and I haven't had any issues. Cooking with this ceramic pot is not as nonstick as teflon, but more nonstick than enameled cast iron or a stainless steel pan. I love the attractive nature-inspired design, and it sits displayed on my shelf when not in use.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 4, 2018', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This product exists and more durable than others', 'author': 'Walter Cousins', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Quality and simplicity of use', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 22, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Side handles are small', 'author': 'Bob C.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I found that the side handles are rather small as measured extending from the sides of the pot. And they are curved underneath for some of the width that they are. Not much there to hold on to a hot steamy pot. To me, it would be easy to drop this pot if not very careful due to these small width handles - and I almost did! On the (Corningware) pot that I broke and this new pot replaces, the side handles were twice as wide coming from the sides. While the top "rock" handle is cute, it is rather large. And on this somewhat tall pot I hit the inside of my microwave oven with it. I\'ll need to be careful with that too.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 21, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Who wouldn't love this cute pot.", 'author': 'socalgal', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This small pot is well made and does a super job cooking. It came out perfectly cooked and delicious. Love that it can be used for high-temperature cooking. Purchased for family use in our summer cabin. Should be getting tons of use in future years.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 26, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Neoflam Kiesel 2 Quart Stovetop Ceramic Plum cookware', 'author': 'MzVienna', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Arrived on time and in perfect condition. I did like the color, but I could see me dropping this in no time at all. I returned it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 5, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best product ive bought in years', 'author': 'Rainnforest', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Best product ive bought in years and lasts a long time with daily use goes in the oven(ive only used it at 375 regularly) and on stove at 4 temperature(what ive used it at)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 13, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Loverly small pot for one person', 'author': 'Alicia Li', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'i like its color, looks good on my stove, it is very steady as well. title: Bruntmor Pre-Seasoned 6.5 qt Enameled Cast Iron Round Dutch Oven, 6.5 Quart Dutch Oven Pot With Lid And Handle, Heavy Duty Casserole Dish, Hand Wash Only, Duke Blue
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent High-Quality Dutch Oven', 'author': 'Steve Craig Dekker', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The Bruntmor Dutch Oven is an excellent high-quality product with fantastic cost performance. It arrived in perfect condition and was very well and securely packed.I prepared a delicious rosemary, vegetable & pork roast dinner this evening and it performed beautifully. Browning the meat was easy with no sticking, and a gorgeous fond developed that quickly dissolved when cooking the vegetables.The lid fit securely and generated a good tight seal. The metallic lid knob is very strong and thick and much better than cheap plastic knobs found on most Dutch ovens.The side handles are very strong and thick for easy lifting.The dimples on the inside of the lid are an excellent idea, and help disperse condensing steam over the food during cooking that bastes the food.Cleanup was a breeze with just a little soapy water and very gentle scrubbing with a sponge.The red outer color is gorgeous and the beige interior is excellent for seeing the fond coloring.Helpful Hints:1) NEVER use metal utensils with an enabled Dutch oven. Always use a wooden or silicon spoon and NEVER use metal whisks or tongs. Invest in a good pair of silicone-coated tongs or the enamel will get scratched over time when saut√©ing meat.2) NEVER put an enameled Dutch Oven above 230C (450F) or the enamel will be ruined over time.3) Be careful not to scratch the bottom of the Dutch oven when placing on metal stove or oven rack. Scratches will eventually cause the enamel to flake off.4) invest in a good pair of silicon oven gloves for maximum heat protection and maintaining a good grip on the heavy Dutch oven.You can‚Äôt go wrong with this purchase in terms of: price, quality, design and attractiveness. It greatly exceeded my expectations.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2018', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars love it!', 'author': 'P. Hebert', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'this is a beautiful thing to behold! cooks like a dream, the only reason i gave it 4 on cleaning is that it is heavy! if you want the pros of of what cast iron can do, you have to take the cons with it. this pot is so beautiful, the color (red) is vivid and really is easy to clean. just warm water, a little soap and the dishcloth, no scrubbing and everything just dissolved. i cooked a pot roast in it, and was dirty. i am a happy cook. did i mention how pretty it is?', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great addition to my kitchen', 'author': 'anna b....', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Extremely heavy (not for elderly cooks??). Great for stovetop or oven. My new favorite. Great quality. I only hand wash this vessel. Standard procedure at my house', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Bruntmor is a new favorite.', 'author': 'EricJM', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This large Enameled Braiser has been a phenomenal work horse for me, and without any issue of chipping or cracking as I follow all directions thoroughly. It it such a beautiful addition to my collection of cookware, especially for enamel. It is well coated, and so easy to clean. It heats evenly and fast just using low heat that my recipes are actually cooking better. This is a company I never heard of, but is now at the top of my list. It is heavy at about 11.3 lbs., plus more with food, but it's size, balance and greatly designed handles make using quite easy. Personally, I do not put in dishwasher nor use metal utensils because I want it to stay beautiful and not mar the finish. Always on my stove ready to use, which is often.A NOTEWORTHY UPDATE: I am so in love with having the Bruntmor braiser, that I recently jumped at the chance to also buy a new Le Creuset 3.5 qt. braiser on a huge sale. I decided to add to my collection as everyone praises it. On my first day as I washed it with just a gentle foam sponge before 1st use, and the interior enamel just chipped off. Due to sale, it was sold out, so no exchanges and if I returned, there was no guarantee I would ever get that price again, so I am now in the process of exchanging via warranty. (Still thinking I should have just returned as my trust has been broken). Meanwhile, my Bruntmor is still perfect and looks like new. I suggest if you are pondering a purchase of Bruntmor, trust all the high reviews and treat it well and follow the instructions. Being Le Creuset didn't guarantee quality, so why pay more? Lesson learned firsthand.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful', 'author': 'CD', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I got this for my daughter‚Äôs apartment. I think is only good for cooking.I will keep it because I cooking a lot and really enjoy the quality üëå", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good quality', 'author': 'Dianne', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought it for a gift on Black Friday so I got a really great price. Food releases well from it', 'author': 'Brian', 'rating': 4, 'content': "It's a pretty decent nonstick caldero type pan. It's in my opinion just a bit wider and more shallow for a dutch oven. The metal used is single ply aluminum, but the thickness is decent. Heats up and conducts heat well, but not much in the way of bad hot spots that can scorch foods. I've made dishes like Puerto Rican Arroz con Pollo and Red Beans and Rice in it for my family and it did a decent job. You just have to understand what it's like to cook in aluminum versus something like cast iron. You can sear in it or do a low and slow braise, but absolutely do put it over super high direct heat or have it over a roaring fire or you'll burn whatever you put in it. I'm pretty sure the nonstick coating shouldn't be subjected to that kind of heat either. They don't specify the nonstick coating materials, but it's not ceramic from what I see and the old school Teflon stuff hasn't been around for some time, but it will ruin the coating if you park it over a big flame or heat it over a cranked up burner with say, nothing in it. Mind the size though. The specific one I got to try is the biggest one they offer and it's almost so big it's not as suitable for home cooking as some of the smaller ones, but with that bigger size comes bigger capacity and capability of cooking bigger and more things. So recommended, but know what you're getting and make sure you use it right.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very impressive pan', 'author': 'Judy K', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This 11 quart pan is big, but it‚Äôs perfect for cooking small, as well as large, quantities of food. It can be used on the stovetop or in the oven. It‚Äôs made of aluminum, so it isn‚Äôt very heavy for it‚Äôs size. It fits well on my largest stove burner. It is non stick, and needs very little oil. It heats evenly, and is awesome for browning, braising, and saut√©ing, which is important for lots of things I cook. It‚Äôs big enough to easily hold more than one roast, or more than one head of chopped cabbage, or numerous servings of spaghetti, etc. It‚Äôs suitable for pancakes, or steak, soups or stews, and countless other foods. It‚Äôs easy to clean, regardless of what was cooked in it. I haven‚Äôt had it long, but I know I like it a lot, and it‚Äôs uses are unlimited.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Too flimsy to hold its shape', 'author': 'ana_elite', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'As I took the pot out of the box, realized it had deformed. title: Garlic Roaster Baker, Cast Iron Dutch Oven Pre-Seasoned, Mini Cocotte, 1 Cup Capacity, Black, Ramekin with Lid, for BBQ Grill or Oven, by Bazaar LM-ents (Flat Lid)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Super cute', 'author': 'August', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'When it arrived the box was really beat up, which I took as a bad sign until I realized that the Dutch oven is so durable that it basically pulverized the box en route. 10/10 would buy again', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Better than clay', 'author': 'Cassandra', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I had a clay garlic roaster for decades until a family member shattered it. I limped by as I tried to replace it without paying a fortune and found this little guy. It does a great job with the garlic; it was flavorful and soft. I ignored the part about it being pre-seasoned and treated it as I would any good cast-iron pot, and it works great! There are absolutely no problems with this unit, unless you count a little oil discoloration on the aluminum handle, and I don't. If you've never owned cast-iron, yes, you can wash it in hot soapy water to get the dirt and debris off, but dishwashers are a big NO. Not EVER. Then, you must take a paper towel and some cooking oil and wipe a thin layer of cooking oil all over the cast iron, inside and out, and put it in a corner of the oven. Heat the oven to 350 degrees, (you can bake something if you want) then turn it off, leaving the pot inside as it cools. Wipe off any excess oil that remains with a paper towel. That conditions the pan, and it's ready to use again. It will never rust if you season it every time you use it. I'm glad to have a more durable replacement for my clay roaster at a reasonable price.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works great', 'author': 'John', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I make roasted garlic butter for my garlic bread', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars works great on BBQ', 'author': 'SWL', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'fits one head of garlic, works great on BBQ', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Garlic Roaster', 'author': 'Leone R. Burns', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'It‚Äôs a nice looking roaster, but the quality control for this product is lacking. The lid for this unit is in two parts- the lid itself and the knob. In a little plastic bag is the knob that gets screwed onto the lid. The only problem was that the screw needed to screw into the knob came missing and I had to scrounge around the house to find one that worked. Someone must have mailed this late on a Friday afternoon as obviously the screw should have been included. So I marked the score down as the customer should receive every part of this unit.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect garlic roaster', 'author': 'Michael J. Wallis', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Works great produces perfect roasted garlic', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 20, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cutest little roaster', 'author': 'Brooke Hogan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Cutest little roaster', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So cute! Can use for so many things.', 'author': 'Shonie', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Who doesn't love anything in miniature form? I love roasted garlic so I got this because its the perfect size. I can roast my garlic in the oven or melt a buttery mixture in it. It's also just cute sitting on my counter as sort of some decoration. I always receive comments about it. The quality of the iron is great. It does not rust although I always oil my cast irons after washing. It has some weight to it also, which reflects the quality. Love this, I have it forever!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 31, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars You want one like this', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The lid is the only real issue- it‚Äôs a sloppy fit and the knob is held in place with a tiny screw.Proportionally to full sized skillet, it would be well over $100 so I would have expected a touch more quality.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Useful', 'author': 'Meggie', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great idea for roasting garlic. No leaking now.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 23, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Ultra Nonstick Modern Hard-Anodized Stock Pot, 6 qt Induction Kitchen Cookware Dutch Oven with Silicone Oven Mitts,Oven Safe Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars If you are thinking to buy or not to buy this pot, BUY IT!!!', 'author': 'Alberouni', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'If you are thinking to buy or not to buy this pot, BUY IT!!! I have had my pot/Dutch oven for more than a week now and cooked chicken curry in it. Oh my God! This pot is super! It cooks very evenly! It is easy to clean ‚Äì I hand wash mine. The other best thing about this pot is that it is a Dutch oven and is safe to be used in the oven up to 400F and it comes with oven-safe silicone mitts! I can‚Äôt wait to try to use it in the oven to make some yummy shish kabobs in tomato + sour cream sauce and many other delicious recipes! It just works great - what else can I say, happy with this pot - great price and worth every penny.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 9, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love it!!! It is non-sticky as it claimed, and I also found that it not only is good for making soup, boiling noodle/pasta, but it is excellent for saut√©ing and stir-frying veggies and meat, even can add litter water to the food and cover with the lid to give a little steam for making dumpling and buns. Great pan, easy to clean with a little detergent and warm water. Also, I learned that it needs very little oil for cooking and medium heat is high heat for the pan (I usually use high heat for cooking, but for this pan medium heat is enough for saut√©ing and stir-frying stuff‚Ä¶.) It‚Äôs worth it!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 18, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Its not bad', 'author': 'timekeeperboi', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Its a nice size. This is wider that my previous pot, but I find that helps cook off more liquid & concentrate flavors faster. Important: Their customer service is excellent. Highest marks. The pot I rec'd appeared to have very minor damage to the non-stick coating - like something sharp hit the inside of the pot after manufacture. The pot comes with a card asking to give It's Millers a chance to help with issues before returning to Amazon - so I did. They sent a replacement immediately - received in 2-days. I have tried it with different type of food and it works amazing. The silicone mitts are a plus. I decided to buy another one for my sister in law based on its quality.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 21, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars It is a perfect size for cooking', 'author': 'C. Grone', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I had a 3 quart pan that wore out (coating chipped off). I bought this one as a replacement. It is wide mouth (wide circumference) and easy to clean. I try not to put it in the dishwasher but have done so on rare occasion. I like the circumference as it can be considered a tall fry pan. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy, serviceable, and beautiful, too!', 'author': 'S. Mulhall', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have an enameled cast iron pan similar to this that my mom gifted me 20 years ago. Around the holidays, i usually lament that I\'ve only got one. This year, after Thanksgiving dinner, I decided to look for another one and happened on this gorgeous Crock Pot offering. It\'s slightly larger than the one I\'ve used hundreds of times and deeper, which is an absolute plus.It just arrived this week (two weeks earlier than quoted, thankfully) and has been used twice. Tonight, I made my traditional potatoes au gratin with ham chunks with leftover ham from thanksgiving. That extra 1/2" depth is noticeable, as I made the typical amount of mornay sauce, sliced the usual amount of potatoes and there was ample room at the top. No boilover!My other pan has handles, but I like the design of these much better, as I can get a grip around them with the potholders. My husband commented that he\'s looking forward to the next lasagna being made in this pan.Crock pot, would you consider making a 9" square pan next?', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent quality but really heavy', 'author': 'Pamela L.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The color is great. Does the job and even baking.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing cast iron baking dish', 'author': 'TruthInReview', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This pan is exactly what I was looking for. I wanted a cake-size cast iron to make Detroit-style pizza. This is perfect. It shipped quickly and in good packaging, it is heavy as it should be. I got the pre-seasoned black dish and I opted to season it even tho it came pre-seasoned. I have no regrets, this dish is beautiful and perfect. I read the description and it matches exactly, the measurements are spot on. I‚Äôm glad I found one of these for relatively cheap, too. Highly recommend for pizza.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Just as good as Le Creuset', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've been using this pan for about a year and couldn't be happier with it. I have several enameled cast iron products from Le Creuset, and honestly this pan from Crock Pot is every bit as good as they are while only being a fraction of the price. It's heavy, durable, heats evenly, and is easy to clean.I've seen some reviews saying their pans chipped, but I haven't experienced this myself. (Although I'm pretty careful when handling it.) The worst thing I can say is that there is some staining in the enamel from repeated uses, but it still works as well as the day I got it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 10, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful', 'author': 'jonathan santiago-braga', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love the enamel and the heaviness of the cast iron. It‚Äôs exactly what I needed after my Pyrex all exploded in my oven. I will be getting more.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars great for roasting veggies', 'author': 'HJ', 'rating': 5, 'content': "bought this to better roast my veggies. it works great for that. but it is super heavy...so be prepared for that. cleans up well but you can't avoid some marks on a white pan", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nonstick Is a Relative Concept', 'author': 'A', 'rating': 4, 'content': "First, the specifics:The color of this pan is quite a bit darker than the pictures. It is not turquoise. It's teal. It exactly matches a tramontina dutch oven I bought a few years ago. Exactly. (That pot is holding up great, btw.) First use was for tetrazzini - cooked evenly, cleaned fairly easily by boiling vinegar and water in it and letting it soak until the water cooled, and still looks new.Now the general stuff: Enameled cast iron is not nonstick in the way that thermalon is or the way that teflon is. But as long as it isn't enameled with lead (which is why I usually buy expensive stuff), it is more nonstick than bare stainless steel. It's about the same as well-seasoned cast iron. Unless it's the rough gray enamel, in which case, it's not nonstick at all.This is a surprisingly inexpensive name brand lasagna pan. It's the white smooth enamel. It's not going to release everything or clean up with a quick sponge wipe. Best practice is to soak and wipe. Don't use harsh cleansers or scrubbers. Other best practice is try not to burn the &*&* out of it.It will cook evenly and efficiently. It won't warp for anything. It may chip -> even the more expensive pans will. But again, as long as you've bought something well sourced, it won't hurt you. Rust won't hurt you, either. It's iron. Wash it off. Dry it thoroughly.It may stain. This also won't hurt you. The super expensive brands also chip and stain. When you've paid a few hundred bucks for one of them? Now that will hurt you.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great', 'author': 'Stephanie Voss', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I truly love this baking dish üòç üòçüòçüòçüòç', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 4, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Product fit and finish look great. Shipping not so great.', 'author': 'Kelly T. Kendrick', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I really like the construction and quality of this casserole dish. It is heavy without being too heavy. The glazing seems to be well done. I‚Äôm sure it will last a long time.I can‚Äôt believe how poorly it was packaged though. Shipping damage on the handle. I shouldn‚Äôt have to tolerate a damaged product even if it‚Äôs ‚Äújust the handle‚Äù Won‚Äôt affect the product but so easily avoided.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 23, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing', 'author': 'Luanne', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is so nice and heavy I truly can't wait to use it", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Alpine Cuisine Stainless Steel Dutch Oven with Lid 6.3 Quart & Easy Cool Handle, Food Grade Stainless Steel Heavy Duty, Commercial Grade Healthy Cookware kitchen Dutch oven
Lodge Camp Dutch Oven Lid Lifter. Black 9 MM Bar Stock for Lifting and Carrying Dutch Ovens. (Black Finish)
reviews: [{'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars It's a good product.", 'author': 'Rob Gurganus', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a well-made and handy product. Great for its intended purpose of lifting hot lids off pots.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 4, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars It works as intended.', 'author': 'Glenn Cox', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I cooked two peach cobblers, and each time I uses device to lift the lid on my Dutch oven. It worked well at doing what it was supposed to do. But I might buy a little longer one if I purchased again. This one is pretty short, so your hand is close to briquettes that rest on the lid of the Dutch oven. Another 5 inches in length would be nice.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Indispensable tool for cooking outdoors with cast iron Dutch ovens', 'author': 'Chris S.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This odd looking thing is superbly designed to lift up the top of a Dutch oven from a campfire and let you check inside without spilling coals and ashes into your food from on top of the lid being lifted. Strong and sturdy, with leverage both for pulling up and for keeping the lid controlled and horizontal while lifted. Rarely have I ever found such an immensely practical tool for a reasonable investment. Can probably be passed down to your children along with your cast iron Dutch ovens.P.S. Before you lift your lid, give some thought to where you'll set it down while going back to stir your food or whatever. You need to keep it fairly level, so that ashes and coals don't spill, and you'll need a pretty clean surface, because the underside of the lid is going to go back on top of your food when you return the lid to your oven. Or else you need to be able to hold the lid lifter and lid level and straight in one hand while stirring with the other!P.P.S. Important: if you're hanging the oven by the bail/handle over the fire, you'll need to take the oven off the fire first and set it down so that you can let the bail fall to the side. The lid can't really be lifted off the top without slanting it sideways to extract it and thus spilling ashes all over the pan's contents if the bail is vertical.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works great with lodge dutch oven', 'author': 'Don', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Looks great and made well', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Jack of alll Trades / Best overall Performer', 'author': 'Brian J. F.', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I have three lifters to compare. They are the traditional styled Lodge A5 Camp Dutch Oven Lid Lifter, this Lodge A5DLL Deluxe Lid Lifter, and the Camp Chef Professional Dutch Oven Lid Lifter (Black, 9-Inch). Here is my unbiased opinion of all three.Lodge A5 Camp Dutch Oven Lid LifterPros:This is a multi-purpose item and it surprisingly has the best finish & has the least sloppily welded junctions of all three lifters.I say this is a multi-purpose item because the two deluxe lifters are pretty much dedicated dutch oven table / charcoal cooking items. If you are cooking over a campfire I would go with the A5 because it can be used as a fire poker, and a coal rake as well as a lid lifter.The A5 lifter is just as good as the Camp Chef when it comes to carrying a dutch oven by the bail handle over long distances because of the T-handle portion that is welded to the handle. The Deluxe Lodge A5DLL lifter is slightly worse because of the odd downward slope of the handle.Cons:The A5 does not have a cushioned handle like the other two.There is more of a learning curve as far as balancing the lid is concerned.... But not as drastic as other reviewers would lead you to believe unless you are truly an uncoordinated klutz. Yes, the deluxe lifters are both more stable when it comes to controlling the lid, but as of right now, the only major thing I can do with the other lifters that I cannot do with the traditional A5 is grab the lid and turn it completely upside down. Unless you are a tricked out dutch oven stunt cooking artist, then there is really no need to do this. I'm still able to use the A5 to tilt the lid to either side to knock the ashes off and whatever else I need to do while cooking and transporting (by the bail handle) the ovens. The point, I am trying to make is that the A5 is not as bad as people try to make it out to be.Lodge A5DLL Deluxe Lid LifterPros:This one has the best length for ground cooking. That is about the only good advantage that this one has over the rest of them, however, if you plan on doing deep bean hole type cooking, then I would go with the Camp Chef Professional Dutch Oven Lid Lifter, 22-Inch (which I do not own, but looks identical to the 9-inch which I do own).Cons:The finish on this model is the worst of the three. It is almost as if they baked on the finish and then tried to weld it together after the fact... as opposed to the Camp Chef which looks like it was welded first... then baked on the finished (which is how I would expect the process to be done). Then inner bar of the A5DLL Deluxe wiggles and turns inside the outer sleeve much more so than the Camp Chef, which is very annoying.I am not sure I am all that sold on the downward slope of the A5DLL handle as opposed to the straight, parallel handle configuration of the Camp Chef.To me, this is the worst lifter... and it cost the most. Looks like I paid more for the Lodge name, rather than any added or superior benefits over the Camp Chef version. However it's not really something that I would waste time trying to return through the mail because the advantages of the Camp Chef version over this one are minimal. If I had to do it all over again, knowing what I know now, I would probably have purchased the 14-inch Camp Chef version over the A5DLL, but then I would be giving up 2 inches in length which is better for ground cooking as opposed to table cooking.Camp Chef Professional Dutch oven Lid Lifter (Black, 9-Inch)Pros:This one is the best for dutch oven table cooking because of its length. It keeps you from having the move the ovens around on the table in an awkward position because the length is just right.The handle on the Camp Chef has more of a solid feel than the Lodge Deluxe A5DLL version. The parallel bar configuration works the best for me.The weld junctions on the Camp Chef are better and it has a slightly more beefier construction than the Lodge Deluxe A5DLL. However, the lodge A5 has the best welds (read: more durability) of all three lifters that I own.Cons:The only con I can see at this point is that the metal is exposed under the outer sleeve of the t-handle (I assume to make it slide better inside the sleeve) on the Camp Chef. There could be a rusting issue somewhere down the line... then again maybe not because it looks like that part is galvanized. Only time will tell. There really is no need for this portion to be unfinished, because part of the bar that slides within the tube is finished and it does not hinder the way the bar functions at all.Final thoughts:Overall I like the traditional A5 the best but that is just my personal preference because of its multi-functional versatility. It's just a jack of all trades. I can do almost everything the deluxe lifters can do, plus I can use it as a fire poker and a coal raker.If you are cooking over a campfire, go with the A-5. If your cooking is limited only to cooking on a dutch oven table, then I would go with the 9-inch Camp Chef lifter. If you are ground or bean-hole cooking then I would take a long look at both the Camp Chef 14-inch and 22-inch lid lifters before deciding to buy the Lodge A5DLL Deluxe Lid Lifter.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 28, 2013', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great useful tool for safety; excellent condition; great packaging', 'author': 'Take And Read', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The Lodge Camp Dutch Oven Lifter came in excellent condition. It was shipped in a box within a box! Inside the inner box, super care was taken to protect your Dutch Oven Lifter during shipping. All the edges on the tool were EACH wrapped with a protective covering! The Lifter is a great safety item for protecting the cook from burns when lifting hot lids from cast iron pots. Very useful tool to have at hand.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 19, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Will last a lifetime.', 'author': 'ST', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Built well and surdy.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 17, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Multiple use', 'author': 'Carol', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It is great to lift the lid off and also stoking the fire. Happy I bought it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars no glove needed', 'author': 'Scott S', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'if you have a Dutch oven you need one of these.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 22, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars A little short', 'author': 'Rob T', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Well built holds the lid well but it would be nice if it was a bit longer to keep your hands further from the heat.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 26, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Dutch Oven Pot Lid Holder - Convenient Kitchen Accessory for Dutch Ovens and Cast Iron Skillets - Keep Your Lids Handy (an odd one)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars steady and nice dutch lid holder', 'author': 'Frank Tai', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Recently bought a dutch oven but was frustrated no place to put the lid. this is a nice holder perfectly made and can hold the lid steadily', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Good in concept', 'author': 'ATXBuyer', 'rating': 2, 'content': "I wanted to like this tool so much, because I have a lot of enameled cast iron pots. In concept, it's great, but in practice, it only works on one of my pots. I have some pots with lids that are incompatible which I knew, but the ones that are compatible still didn't work. That's because the other thing that has to fit is the opening of the pot handle. This device is too big for most pot handles except for my very largest oval Staub pot. I tried it on my 5qt, 7qt, large saute, and 10qt.It's a solid piece of wood (though it arrived with a chip) and sturdy enough to hold the large, heavy lid. However, it was very awkward figuring out how to lift the heavy, hot lid and slip it on the lid holder without burning your hand. It naturally tilts the lid towards the pot which helps drip condensation back into the pot.The one kind of nice thing is that it fits perfectly in my large, oval Staub which is the only one it fits, so I can just store it in there for when I use the large pot.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 1, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars quality product. works great if it fits your pots lids and/or handles.', 'author': 'Kurt', 'rating': 5, 'content': "i love this thing. it solidly built and fits a niche. it only works with some of my pots, but that's more than what I had before. It works for my staub 6.25 qt round dutch oven and my 7 qt oval dutch oven (for the oval oven you have to put the lid horizontally and not vertically). It does not work with my le creuset 5 qt round dutch oven (the lid knob does not fit, it does fit in the pot handles). it does not work with my cuisinart 7qt chef's classic enameled cast iron dutch oven. it fits in the handles, but the lid knob does not fit. You can also use this with regular stock pots as well. You can fit/hang the lid handle inside the knob carrier. It works with my all clad 6 qt and 12 qt stock/soup pots, but not my 5qt one (it's too big for the pot handles). It works with my cuisinart multiclad pro 8 qt stock pot as well. This has a definite spot in my kitchen as it will free up counter space for the lids of these pots. love it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 2, 2023', 'is_verified': False}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great replacement for Le Creuset handles.', 'author': 'Andy Peeler', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Got a pair of these for far less than one handle for my big Le Creuset pot that had the plastic handle that was starting to leave fibers behind and become scratchy. I went out and bought a Lodge dutch oven with a metal knob, which is a great dutch oven, but small. I couldn't believe I hadn't thought to explore whether the knob could be changed. It can, aha, and so I bought this and screwed it onto the old, larger Cuisinart, and voila, now I can use it at high temps in the oven. Can't believe I hadn't thought of this before. Garlic Roaster Baker, Cast Iron Dutch Oven Pre-Seasoned, Mini Cocotte, 1 Cup Capacity, Black, Ramekin with Lid, for BBQ Grill or Oven, by Bazaar LM-ents (Flat Lid)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Super cute', 'author': 'August', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'When it arrived the box was really beat up, which I took as a bad sign until I realized that the Dutch oven is so durable that it basically pulverized the box en route. 10/10 would buy again', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Better than clay', 'author': 'Cassandra', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I had a clay garlic roaster for decades until a family member shattered it. I limped by as I tried to replace it without paying a fortune and found this little guy. It does a great job with the garlic; it was flavorful and soft. I ignored the part about it being pre-seasoned and treated it as I would any good cast-iron pot, and it works great! There are absolutely no problems with this unit, unless you count a little oil discoloration on the aluminum handle, and I don't. If you've never owned cast-iron, yes, you can wash it in hot soapy water to get the dirt and debris off, but dishwashers are a big NO. Not EVER. Then, you must take a paper towel and some cooking oil and wipe a thin layer of cooking oil all over the cast iron, inside and out, and put it in a corner of the oven. Heat the oven to 350 degrees, (you can bake something if you want) then turn it off, leaving the pot inside as it cools. Wipe off any excess oil that remains with a paper towel. That conditions the pan, and it's ready to use again. It will never rust if you season it every time you use it. I'm glad to have a more durable replacement for my clay roaster at a reasonable price.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works great', 'author': 'John', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I make roasted garlic butter for my garlic bread', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars works great on BBQ', 'author': 'SWL', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'fits one head of garlic, works great on BBQ', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Garlic Roaster', 'author': 'Leone R. Burns', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'It‚Äôs a nice looking roaster, but the quality control for this product is lacking. The lid for this unit is in two parts- the lid itself and the knob. In a little plastic bag is the knob that gets screwed onto the lid. The only problem was that the screw needed to screw into the knob came missing and I had to scrounge around the house to find one that worked. Someone must have mailed this late on a Friday afternoon as obviously the screw should have been included. So I marked the score down as the customer should receive every part of this unit.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect garlic roaster', 'author': 'Michael J. Wallis', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Works great produces perfect roasted garlic', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 20, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cutest little roaster', 'author': 'Brooke Hogan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Cutest little roaster', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So cute! title: Neoflam Kiesel 2qt Non-Stick Ceramic Casserole Pot, Dutch Oven, Clay Pot, Stockpot For Stew, Soup, Steam, Scratch Resistant, Oven Safe, Heat Resistant, Plum
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love it!', 'author': 'K', 'rating': 5, 'content': "i have had this over at least 8 years. I have had 2: The first model of this was 1.5 qt, and this is second generation of 2 qt.The first one I got it from Chinese supermarket since I had been looking for one for a while. Back then the pots in Chinese supermarket were super leaky. Since Koreans has a lot clay pot dishes, why not try? It turned out that this one really exceeded my expectations. I mostly use it to make soup, and everything is just so perfectly cooked in every way - perfect texture, and it preserves all the flavors somehow. I have tried to use all other pots, and trust me, nothing is the same. It has become my perfect heavy soup pot. Usually I cook it to boil, and turned off the stove. Let it sit and continue cooking itself. For most part that's all it takes unless it's something like big chunky bones.I just follow the instructions to use: never turn up the stove higher than medium and always has liquid in the pot. To clean it I just put water inside and boil, wipe it clean while the pot is warm with sponges. Until one day I forgot it on the stove and the bottom of the pot was completely burnt. I saw small crack lines on the bottom and even though surface was still sealed fine. At that point I decided to get my second one through Amazon, since all the local supermarket sold out, and I got the last one in stock.I thought Neoflam stopped making it, and I am glad to see this is still around (yay). Hope you enjoy this one as much as I have.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Yes', 'author': 'Toria Burton', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I use this product for Korean stews or hot pot kind of meals, it heats up and cooks really well on my electric stove top. Cute color. Easy to clean, highly recommend if you‚Äôre looking for a stew pot.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 23, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars My New Favorite Pot', 'author': 'Julia', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I got the 1QT sized kiesel and it is the perfect size for one person. Filled all the way, you can make about two portions of soup (or one large portion if you eat a lot). I use it right on the stove top and in the microwave and I haven't had any issues. Cooking with this ceramic pot is not as nonstick as teflon, but more nonstick than enameled cast iron or a stainless steel pan. I love the attractive nature-inspired design, and it sits displayed on my shelf when not in use.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 4, 2018', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This product exists and more durable than others', 'author': 'Walter Cousins', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Quality and simplicity of use', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 22, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Side handles are small', 'author': 'Bob C.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I found that the side handles are rather small as measured extending from the sides of the pot. And they are curved underneath for some of the width that they are. Not much there to hold on to a hot steamy pot. To me, it would be easy to drop this pot if not very careful due to these small width handles - and I almost did! On the (Corningware) pot that I broke and this new pot replaces, the side handles were twice as wide coming from the sides. While the top "rock" handle is cute, it is rather large. And on this somewhat tall pot I hit the inside of my microwave oven with it. I\'ll need to be careful with that too.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 21, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Who wouldn't love this cute pot.", 'author': 'socalgal', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This small pot is well made and does a super job cooking. I wish I had purchased the larger size, but this does the job for a 2lb plus meatloaf. I added all my extras to two pounds of ground beef and formed it into the bowl with a small mound on top and cooked it at 350 degrees for approximately 1 hour. It came out perfectly cooked and delicious. Love that it can be used for high-temperature cooking. Purchased for family use in our summer cabin. Should be getting tons of use in future years.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 26, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Neoflam Kiesel 2 Quart Stovetop Ceramic Plum cookware', 'author': 'MzVienna', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Arrived on time and in perfect condition. I just love stoneware and the fact that it is for stovetop, oven, microwave, and freezer was the main reason I bought this. I love this and would definitely recommend it, and performs just as it described. I hope to purchase the blue neoflam cookware set in the near future. I just prefer stoneware to pots and pans. You don't have to buy a million pans. The cookware set gives you a pan for every recipe.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 12, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "3.0 out of 5 stars doesn't work on all stove tops and not particularly attractive", 'author': 'Cerys', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I am a huge fan of Neoflam designs and this pot was a disappointment. First, it only works on electric or gas stove tops, not glass or induction, so for me, this would only work in the oven and I can get a bean pot for a lot less.2nd, I didn't like the design. I didn't think the rock top looked good and it made the lid difficult to handle. The side handles of the pot were very short and made that difficult to handle as well. I did like the color, but I could see me dropping this in no time at all. I returned it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 5, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best product ive bought in years', 'author': 'Rainnforest', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Best product ive bought in years and lasts a long time with daily use goes in the oven(ive only used it at 375 regularly) and on stove at 4 temperature(what ive used it at)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 13, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Loverly small pot for one person', 'author': 'Alicia Li', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'i like its color, looks good on my stove, it is very steady as well. Very happy', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

You will be prone to accidental burning if you are not careful', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 13, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Buen tama√±o', 'author': 'Ida', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Buen tama√±o,liviano,facil cocinar', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Big nonstick caldero great for braises, stews, or things like jambalaya. Food releases well from it', 'author': 'Brian', 'rating': 4, 'content': "It's a pretty decent nonstick caldero type pan. It's in my opinion just a bit wider and more shallow for a dutch oven. The metal used is single ply aluminum, but the thickness is decent. Heats up and conducts heat well, but not much in the way of bad hot spots that can scorch foods. I've made dishes like Puerto Rican Arroz con Pollo and Red Beans and Rice in it for my family and it did a decent job. You just have to understand what it's like to cook in aluminum versus something like cast iron. You can sear in it or do a low and slow braise, but absolutely do put it over super high direct heat or have it over a roaring fire or you'll burn whatever you put in it. I'm pretty sure the nonstick coating shouldn't be subjected to that kind of heat either. They don't specify the nonstick coating materials, but it's not ceramic from what I see and the old school Teflon stuff hasn't been around for some time, but it will ruin the coating if you park it over a big flame or heat it over a cranked up burner with say, nothing in it. Mind the size though. The specific one I got to try is the biggest one they offer and it's almost so big it's not as suitable for home cooking as some of the smaller ones, but with that bigger size comes bigger capacity and capability of cooking bigger and more things. So recommended, but know what you're getting and make sure you use it right.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very impressive pan', 'author': 'Judy K', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This 11 quart pan is big, but it‚Äôs perfect for cooking small, as well as large, quantities of food. It can be used on the stovetop or in the oven. It‚Äôs made of aluminum, so it isn‚Äôt very heavy for it‚Äôs size. It fits well on my largest stove burner. It is non stick, and needs very little oil. It heats evenly, and is awesome for browning, braising, and saut√©ing, which is important for lots of things I cook. It‚Äôs big enough to easily hold more than one roast, or more than one head of chopped cabbage, or numerous servings of spaghetti, etc. It‚Äôs suitable for pancakes, or steak, soups or stews, and countless other foods. It‚Äôs easy to clean, regardless of what was cooked in it. I haven‚Äôt had it long, but I know I like it a lot, and it‚Äôs uses are unlimited.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Too flimsy to hold its shape', 'author': 'ana_elite', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'As I took the pot out of the box, realized it had deformed. Hopefully, it‚Äôs clear from the attached pictures. The lid didn‚Äôt fit the pot anymore. It‚Äôs possible to push the pot sides so the lid can go in, but the lid pops right back out within couple of minutes. The walls of this pot are too thin to maintain its shape. It may be ok as an open container, but will not last as a closed Dutch oven.Besides, similar sized pits are available way cheaper at local big box retailers.Returning.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Would not recommend', 'author': 'Felix Paulino', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'Be careful with this item. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars If you are thinking to buy or not to buy this pot, BUY IT!!!', 'author': 'Alberouni', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'If you are thinking to buy or not to buy this pot, BUY IT!!!
