title: Lodge USA Enamel 4.5 Qt Enameled Cast Iron Dutch Oven - Cast Iron Cookware - Dutch Oven Pot with Lid - Cherry On Top Color - 4.5 Qt Capacity
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Looks great, works great, and made in America.', 'author': 'William P. Factor', 'rating': 5, 'content': "We have had a couple of Lodge cast iron fry pans for several years that we use daily and are very happy with our new Lodge Dutch Oven. It looks so nice that we leave it out on our gas cooktop even when we're not using it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This is fantastic', 'author': 'Kenneth Olson', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Heavy but way too useful. I thought it would be used occasionally but gets used several days each week. Can't beat cast iron for cooking.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Made in USA. Highly Functional and Lovely Enameled Cast Iron Dutch Oven With Stainless Steel Accents', 'author': 'Kenneth', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This review is for the LODGE Enameled Cast Iron Dutch Oven (Size - 4.5 Qt, Color - Blue). I received a free taxable sample of this Dutch oven to review in my search for a well-constructed Dutch oven.The Dutch oven arrived within a branded and decorated brown cardboard postal box with manufacturing and marketing information on all sides. Inside the box were the Dutch oven, instruction booklet, and bag of six pot protectors underneath the cardboard sleeve around the matching lid. This can be gifted as is within the box and tied with a bow and ribbon, or optionally wrapped in giftwrap with a gift tag attached.The Dutch oven weighs 8 pounds and starts with a 7 1/2" circular base that then rises approximately 4" and expands to a 10 1/4" outside diameter and 10" inside diameter at the top of the rim. There are two rounded handles located opposite of each other that extend 1 5/8" from the side of the pot and have a starting width of 6" that then tapers in to 5". The opening on each handle measures approximately 1 5/8" by 3 1/2" across. The matching lid weighs 4.2 pounds, has an outside diameter of 10 1/4", and has a T-shaped stainless-steel handle screwed onto the top of the lid. The handle measures about 2 1/4" across at the top and is 1 1/4" in height. The pot and lid are constructed in the USA of cast iron and the surfaces of the pot and lid are covered with a blue-colored enamel coating on the outside and a light creamy-white colored enamel coating on the inside. The only parts of the pot and lid that are not covered with enamel are three stainless steel accents (the lid handle and two branded nameplates on the handles) and two circles of exposed cast iron on the top rim of the pot and the bottom edge of the lid.As per the information booklet, the Dutch oven is oven safe to 500F and I have been primarily using this for baking sourdough bread. The even heat distribution from the cast iron construction and the heavy lid to trap the steam have been essential elements in making a fantastic loaf. Added bonus is that this size allows me to fit two pots into the oven at the same time to bake more efficiently. Outside of baking bread, this pot has worked great for the standard casseroles and stews, and I\'ve used it in a pinch to sear some items before finishing them directly in the oven, but I typically use a cast iron skillet for that.Besides being functional, the aesthetics on this Dutch oven are quite nice with the stainless-steel accents, the artful curves on the pot itself, and the concentric circular ridges on the lid. I was apprehensive at first about the blue color being too bright and loud, but in reality, it feels like just the right shade of blue that gives the kitchen a pop of color without being obnoxious. Cleanup has been pretty straightforward, and I recommend sticking with the hand washing and prompt drying as recommended in the care instructions. As with any enameled cookware or bakeware, there has been a slight darkening and decrease in the glossy coat on the exterior and interior bottoms from use.All in all, this Dutch oven is highly functional with a nice look, good enamel coating, and solid cast iron construction. I recommend this as an excellent option for a Dutch oven that has excellent cooking capabilities and the benefit of being easy to clean.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars this is the way to go for my bean/meatless based vegan concoctions', 'author': 'Robert Strecker', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I am not skilled in the kitchen, so that means i like to make easy things with emphasis on meatless grounds, along with various beans. I do not like having to keep the pot i am using simmering forever out of fear that i may leave the burner on. I am clumsy like that so its helpful to have a pot that can trap heat inside more so than regular pots. There are many other reasons i like to have a high temperature pot, such as the ability to remove it from the heat and have the internal build up heat take care of the rest. With this Dutch oven style pot from the Lodge USA brand i now have that cast iron design that allows for greater heat conductivity. I eat vegan often though am not totally vegan. I have found out that with meatless grounds you do not have to worry about the intricacies of real meat which is an artform; however the beans, whether they are white or kidney beans as well as chick peas, a Dutch oven can work wonders with infusing extra flavor form the included ingredients. This Lodge USA pot had a glossy dark blue color, which matches nicely with my kitchen and a set of blue pans i have displayed.I have not seen the spike protrusions on the lid for condensation release before because i am more familiar with the bulbous lid nodes which do the same thing. I like the pointy type this lid has on this Lodge USA lid. I feel the lid on any Dutch oven pot is a standout feature due to the way it handles the inner water. I like the protective rubber material along the perimeter or rim; because i often run into dinging the outer sections of lids like this.I am familiar with this brand and have always been happy with them. I definitely recommend this pot and also think it makes for a great gift.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 25, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Price v. value', 'author': 'Carole Ann', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Overpriced . Can not tell difference between the one made in China , and this one .Maybe time will tell the difference .', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The Genuine Article - Heirloom Quality', 'author': 'Samson Wick', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. This dutch oven is one of the best quality cooking implements I\'ve ever seen. It offers the best of cast iron and ceramic in a single package, and its appearance is just striking. It works great with either induction or traditional stove tops, and in the oven. The heat distribution of cast iron ensures your food will be cooked evenly no matter where it\'s arranged in the pot. You also get worry free cooking of acidic foods like chili and pasta sauces, because the surface won\'t pit. Clean up and storage is super easy - no bothering with "seasoning" or oiling the surface. You can take it from oven to table and it will probably outshine any other serving dish there.It comes with rubber (or maybe silicone) clamps to avoid chipping in storage, and the manual warns you against using metal utencils, so it is somewhat more delicate than straight up cast iron, but I will take this over mucking around with seasoning and babying the surface any day.The construction and finish are just beautiful. It\'s solid and well made, and makes it so easy for your food to turn out fantastic that if you have kids, they\'re likely to fight over who gets this when you\'re gone.It\'s heavy, but the handles are well designed to make moving it around simple.I just can\'t say enough good things about this. It\'s well worth the asking price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful and well made', 'author': 'Dan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a review of the 7.5 quart version in Red.I think this is a fantastic dutch oven. It is the perfect size for making one-pot meals that last several days. We used it to make a large pot of jambalaya, which lasted for 4 days for a family of 3. See attached image.The build quality is really nice. As it is made from cast iron, it is pretty heavy and holds a lot of heat. The ceramic coating makes the surface nice to work with and I found it easy to clean. This dutch oven can be used on the stove or in the oven, or both!The only drawback of the ceramic coating is that you cannot use anything that can scratch the surface ‚Äì metal utensils and scrubbing pads can damage the ceramic. This may be an issue for some people, but I prefer to cook using wooden utensils, so I don‚Äôt see this as an issue.Overall this is a great dutch oven.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Lodge enameled cast iron dutch oven', 'author': 'Cela', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We used this the other night to make a zuppa toscana soup and it worked really well. We could do every step in the same pot, and it fit all of the final product inside. This dutch oven heated up evenly and quickly, and then stayed warm for a long time after we had turned off the heat.We got the blue one, and the color is gorgeous. I was already a fan of lodge products, and I am stoked they are making their products in the US again, at least some of them. This thing is heavy duty, and will last for many many years.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Very good quality', 'author': 'Tawney L. Mazek', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This piece is part of the Lodge USA Enamel line. It is manufactured in Tennessee and the color choices are red, white or blue. The quality is quite good. It is a good thickness and therefore on the heavy side.The enamel is smooth and even throughout the pot and lid. Since it is cast the curvy design is an even thickness. The lid handle is tall, making it easy to grasp with pot holders. Unfortunately marketing seems to have won out over function on the pot handles. The metal inserts have screw heads on the underside and enough space both top and bottom to accumulate crud. My husband pointed out that it also weakens the actual handle by thinning it out. I got the 3 qt. size because it fits our life. It cooks wonderfully on the stove and oven. The bottom is just enough smaller than the top so that a silicone bread sling is a little too big. (I‚Äôll keep looking for a slightly smaller one, so far no luck) I would prefer straight sides. However, I got rid of a plain cast iron oven because I pretty much stopped using it. This piece is so much easier to care for and a good size and will get used a lot.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 23, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Big old pot. Beautiful', 'author': 'Ben Leggett', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I love this big old pot. It takes a while for all that mass to heat up but it distributes heat very well. This thing is really big and I can cook up a serious mess of food in it. Since it is so big it can be a wrestling match to clean it. Dishwasher is a no no, so hand wash only. Made in America too. Good pot. Good quality.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 17, 2023', 'is_verified': False}]

title: NutriChef Green Dutch Oven Pot - Stylish 4.44qt Ceramic Professional Kitchen Cookware, Top-grade Aluminum Alloy Pan, Clear Transparent Tempered Glass Lid w/Steam Escape Hole, Black Backlite Handles
Granitestone Dutch Oven, 5 Quart Ultra Nonstick Enameled Lightweight Aluminum Dutch Oven Pot with Lid, Round 5 Qt. Stock Pot, Dishwasher & Oven Safe, Induction Capable, Healthy 100% PFOA Free, Blue
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars beautiful blue color', 'author': 'Taylor', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'easy to use and clean', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars not as advertised but ---please read!', 'author': 'Geezers R Us!', 'rating': 4, 'content': "We like all the features ,,but --despite the manufacturers hype there are some considerations '--First of all this product is a coated product!! Taking knives,,,egg beaters ,,metal spoons,,any thing metalWILL eventutally tear the coating. Product has several liabilities, does not like quick temperature changes! Metals, Harsh Chemicals..Drops..extremes, and--Does not like dishwashers. !! Does not like any metal to coating beatings! Needs oil!!That stated ,,what are the beneficial rules.? Just be normal ,,any coated product has to be treated a little different. Knives WILL penetrate the coating ,take any heavy ,steak knife, you will puncture the coating!!Temperature changes---taking a hot dutch oven just emptied, to a cold sink faucet ,,---that coating willgo busto over time!! Think! Dishwashers --use alkaline soaps with hot hot water ,,that nice finish on the pot will dull as your are treating it to become dull!!OK whats good Doc? When treated properly this Stone Granite finish can last a long time!I have a Lodge 6 qt Dutch Oven ,,its heavy, not easy handle.The Stone Granite Dutch oven is much lighter ,, quicker to heat up much easier to handle ,,quicker to heat up! Easy to clean!!Rule 1 - OIL Thy Dutch Oven.!!Take some canola or coconut or Avocado or Grape oils that like high temps,,with a paper towel put the oil on the top ring profusely,, to avoid water leakage from the steamgetting into the glass enamel or coated liner. lightly oil the inside of the pot , and pot outside when using for the first time. Using LOW heat warm the pot ,,take 30 minutes ,,then go to medium heat for 30minutes , turn off the stove top,, or oven let your pot sit to cool for 2 hours then over night (24 hours) in storage. Thats called seasoning your pot.When using ,, put food in pot then - when using an oven put the lid on the dutch oven ,,put in Cold oven,turn stove oven temp to 325 or 350 gradually warm the dutch oven to cooking temp. Try never to go over 350 despite what you hear from the heat demons..!! Yes, it can do high temps,, but cooling fastis a problem, and its still not good for any coated, dutch oven ,,enameled, coated, or iron.I put a little oil in my dutch ovens every time I cook,,,makes for easy cleaning ,,longer life!Do not use Olive oil, as olive oil is designed for salads. Every 7 to 10th time of use I oil the pots ringed top, to prevent steam from seperating the coating by infiltration. Heat again to a higher temp..let sit over night .We use coated or wood utensils as not to scrape the ovens.Let oven cool naturally after use,, no cold water !To clean simply after dutch oven is back to room temp, use dish soap, warm water . If sticky,, let water soak for an hour ,,,use a sponge orif hard sticking,,,,,,,do use vinegar, or -baking soda =20 % and 80% water,,let soak first for 2 hours, then use ;;;the Green and yellow sponge. lightly ,,circular motions. Usually warm water ,,dishwater soap works wonders.Try not to soak over night as water trys to infiltrate under the enamel ,or coatings.This Amazon Dutch Oven Granite Stone is Very easy to work with ,, fast and efficient ,we prefer this to the heavy heavy normal Dutch Oven we have. A lot easier to handle ,,clean!!The heavier Dutch Oven is great for stews , longer heat banquets, big meat ,, casseroles,The Granite Stone is a joy with breakfasts, ,,yes,,, salads, ( put in refridge when made ) Deserts!!Quick meals, and ta da Fish!! As fish needs to be cooked fairy quick!!Will keep you informed as to our progress,, really will as 6 months ,,yearly ratings help out so much!Thanks for reading ,,,JackAddendum 03/05/22 we are using this Lightweight Dutch Oven as lot ,,as its a light weight ,,,easy to handle product!! Soups ,,,snacks,,scrambled eggs, eggs rancheros,,seafood stews,, so far!!! its that big,,,yet manageable!! !", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Too hot to handle', 'author': 'Marshall Hulton', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Great pot for the money, highly recommend it, in fact we have two. The problem is the handles absorb all the heat and get extremely hot, can burn yourself. Like pots that have handles that do not get so hot, but these pots are light and easy to cook in. So, use hot pads.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars So far good', 'author': 'BLJ', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Super light weight and good so far. Not used it for baking yet but stovetop has been awesome', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 17, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works great on an induction cooker', 'author': 'Shari C', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I really love this pot! I originally was looking for an enameled cast iron dutch oven to use on my induction cooker, but even the more expensive ones had bad reviews about the enamel chipping, the cast iron cracking, etc. I kept looking and found this turquoise beauty (my fave color).I love the color, and it cast aluminum which makes it a very light weight pot. It's non-stick and also has an added metal plate on the bottom that makes it compatible with induction cooktops. It heats up quickly, so go easy on the temperature. What's not to love??? I'm super pleased. :)", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 19, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I am happy', 'author': 'Jose Lugo', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I am happy', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 12, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to clean', 'author': 'Susan Streets', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Love the color, easy to clean and store. Food does not bake on in the oven. Lightweight and easy to lift.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 15, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': 'Lightweight Dutch Oven', 'author': 'Dan G.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Works as prescribed. title: Eurita Clay Roaster, Non-Stick Dutch Oven, Healthy Clay Pot Cooking, With Free Recipe Guide, 4 Quarts
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful Clay Roaster works like a charm!', 'author': 'Cindy D.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is my first clay roaster purchase. It was packaged extremely well - within layers of bubble wrap in its original heavy-duty cardboard box. That box was inside a second large box which was nested in the Amazon box. The Russian Doll or King Tut couldn't have asked for better packing! I was still pensive when opening because of the Christmas shipping glut; but alas, the roaster was unscathed. It is beautiful!Having never used a clay roaster, I was a little apprehensive. But the instructions and recipe booklet that came with the roaster put me at ease. I roasted a chicken, which came out as tender as could be, and tasted delicious! I wish I had purchased one years ago.Clean up was easy, too. I can't wait to use it again, perhaps to bake some bread.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 23, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Addition to Our Kitchen', 'author': 'CMD Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I bought this 4 quart clay cooker to bake bread. It holds 2 loaves. I can bake a white loaf and a grainy or herb loaf at the same time. I shape the loaves to be oriented the long way on the buttered pan bottom. The lid is soaked for about 20 minutes in cool water. I put the covered cooker on a cookie sheet into the cold gas oven and and set the temp to 400 degrees F. I bake for 40 minutes. Then, I take the lid off and put it on my towel-covered counter. I am careful not to shock and crack the clay. The bread is pale, but it has terrific oven spring and looks moist. I cook it for about 20 more minutes at 425. Then, I dump the bread out onto the cookie sheet, bottoms up. I put the Eurita bottom on the towel covered counter. The bread bottom is pale, so I bake it for about 5 more minutes. I check the bread's internal temp. It should be about 200 degrees F.In addition to the bread, I made the best corned beef in my Eurita. It was tender and juicy. While it is true that meat doesn't dry out if you cook it too long, you can ruin the texture. I did that with a chicken that I overcooked.Some tips: Start cooking in a cold oven. NEVER subject your clay pot to sudden temperature changes. Always have a towel-covered surface ready to place your hot Eurita. Wait until it is completely cool to wash it. DO NOT use soap on the unglazed parts. Use a soft brush to clean the unglazed parts. Baking soda can help with greasy areas. The unglazed part does discolor. It gives the clay pot character. Let it air dry completely before storing. Have a storage place where it won't get knocked around and broken.This is a wonderful kitchen tool! The bread is amazing!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great purchase for cooking enthusiasts!', 'author': 'Maria A Pena', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I'm very happy with the purchase. It's easy to use and it does what it says, it keeps foods moist and flavorful!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great quality', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Excellent product quality', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Clay Baker', 'author': 'Wendell Jones', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Excellent cookware, very pleased and economical.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful, moist properly cooked chicken', 'author': 'Charlie', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was concerned that the size (a 4 quart) would be too small for our chickens but the size is perfect. I have had chickens done in the clay pots in Europe and mine came out every bit as tasty using a recipe included with the Eurita. The shipment packaging was excellent so mine arrived ready to go to work. Very happy with this and the recipes it came with.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 17, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great baking pot', 'author': 'Kimberly N Souza', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This was given to my DIL bc she was going to take mine. title: Bruntmor 5 Quart Cast Iron Enameled Coated Dutch Oven In Modern Squoval Shaped Design, Nonstick Seasoned Pot With Stainless Steel Knob For Christmas/Thanksgiving Dinner, Grey With Grey Lid
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful!', 'author': 'Syl', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Got this dutch oven to make ghee. I wanted a smaller, hefty dutch oven (that didn't break the bank) with a white interior so I can see all the milk solids settle to the bottom as I cook my ghee. It has worked so well; however, I've also used it to make several different dishes, soups and sauces. The heat is evenly distributed throughout the pot. Clean up is easy.While the shape of this pot is very different, it looks great on my stove top. It is very well made. The pointed rim is useful when pouring out sauces or any liquid. Am very pleased with my purchase. The Bruntmor Store on Amazon carries other items that are worth perusing and possibly purchasing in the future.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 24, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Quality', 'author': 'Krista', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is very heavy, easy to clean, sturdy, & great for the price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Decent Pot for the Price', 'author': 'R. P.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'My biggest concern for buying Chinese-made enameled cast iron cookware is the possibility of lead content in the porcelain. I used a simple lead-testing swab for the interior of the pot, and it was negative. It was a crude test and while I do not trust the test result 100%, it was good enough for me since white porcelain is less likely to contain lead. The reason I took one star off is that the lid is not airtight. The reason enameled cast iron Dutch oven works well is because of the seal of the lid to keep moisture in during the braising process. I was disappointed and not at the same time because I was expecting too much at this price.It is a cute little pot, and the interesting shape allows me different ways to cook than a regular round pot. For example, I can boil veggies without breaking it up to fit the diameter of a round pot. I keep it on my stove top for everyday use without worrying too much about it. Overall, I am happy with the purchase.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 13, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect', 'author': 'Bossy', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've been looking for a medium size enameled cast iron pot and this is perfect. The pour spouts are a great touch.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I just got it....', 'author': 'Alvin Pruitt Jr', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Cooked one dish....seems to be fine.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I love it!', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Just getting used to cooking with this again otherwise I love it!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Product', 'author': 'Angie', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I bought the three quart. It is very easy to manage. Love it. Worth the money. Besides it's different and has two colors.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 8, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Not very non stick', 'author': 'ladylex', 'rating': 2, 'content': "I'm admittedly not much of a cook, but I've had things scorch very badly when I've cooked things in this pot. I used medium heat to cook in it. The pot scorched really bad, but at least the food I made was stiil edible. I made the same meal the next time over low flame/heat, and the food still stuck, but not as bad. I've given up making that dish in this pot, I just make it in my baking pan. I kind of wish I'd returned this pot, even though I got it for a low price.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 7, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Love the innovative shape, easy to clean, enamel is cracking', 'author': 'Pentiumm', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'First, love the shape. Plus, since the handles make a flat surface when the pan is on its side, that makes it very easy to clean the outside of the pan (rather than a wobbly round pan). The handles are great‚Äîsturdy and easy to grab.I‚Äôve had the pan for about a month, used daily. And the enamel is cracking on the inside. See pics. Breaks my heart‚ÄîI really loved the shape.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars wanted to like it but', 'author': 'doggiemom5', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I really wanted to like it but the style is ok just feels awkward and lid did not sit well other than that the pot seemed like it was made well it was not too heavy I did not like the lid. sent it back because of the lid I could have gotten used to the semi square/oval of it but not the lid', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 23, 2021', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Le Creuset Enameled Cast Iron Bread Oven, White, 1.75 qt.
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Looks great, bakes great bread', 'author': 'Firemonkey', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'If you‚Äôre shopping this item, you know what it‚Äôs for and what its benefits are. Baking in a closed vessel traps steam to help give a boost to your oven spring. You can do it in your Dutch oven, so why this dedicated piece? Does it bake better? Not exactly. But it does bake a beautiful loaf. And its design with a shallow base and domed lid make handling it much easier.The major difference in this vs a Dutch oven is that you can remove the dome shaped lid easily mid cook, and allow more of your loaf to get direct heat from the oven so the crust comes out even. In that regard its design is great. The included instructions/recipe say to let your loaf proof right in the pan, covered. Which does work just fine. You can also proof normally in a basket if you like - it still works great. Some people have concerns about preheating Dutch ovens empty - I‚Äôm of the opinion that it‚Äôs fine because the whole thing is heating slowly and evenly with the oven. So I sometimes preheat this as well. Most often, I preheat the dome only, just so I‚Äôm not dealing with a 450 degree pan when I‚Äôm trying to put my loaf into it.The only negative - and it‚Äôs minor - is the rings and logo on the base. They prevent you from using the bread oven for anything else besides baking bread, so this is a true unitasker. I don‚Äôt need the bottom of my loaf to have circles and a ay le creuset on it (like the Dutch oven lids (see photo)). I‚Äôd rather have a smooth surface making it easier to slide a spatula underneath so I could use it for other things too.If you like baking bread, and find some therapeutic joy in the process this is a worthwhile purchase. If you‚Äôre more of a utility baker, there‚Äôs other options much cheaper that would work the same. Lodge makes a cast iron 5qt double dutch that has the same shallow pan as a lid, which mates to a Dutch oven to create basically the same design. its not enamel coated but it gets the job done just as well. I have one‚Ä¶ I use the lid all the time for roasting other things in the oven, but I use this Le Creuset for baking bread because I just enjoy it more.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars For the bread maker in your family!', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Bought this for my sister in law as a Christmas present! She loves it! She is an amazing sourdough bread baker and she raves about it! Quality is worth every penny!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Bread oven', 'author': 'JS', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I fell in love with this bread oven. It is really heavy and holds the temperature very well. I had great results with yeasted bread and sourdough. I was a bit worried that the top knob may melt at 475F as warned my baking book, but all was fine. I wish it would be cheaper‚Ä¶', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I Love It!', 'author': 'Annie1Shopper', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Oh my! Today I used my lovely meringue colored Le Creuset Bread Oven for the first time, and I am beyond thrilled with it's performance! With my grandaughter, I made no knead cinnamon raisin bread.....Mmmmm perfection! The oven cleans up quickly and easily. I just used a damp cloth to wipe it. The lid fits securely onto the base during use, and to me, it just looks so beautiful in my oven! I highly recommend this Le Creuset product.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Expensive, but wow the results for sourdough bread is amazing!', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Really takes your baking to the next level.Best, Greg', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great for ovens', 'author': 'Phyllis Vanhook', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Bought for my daughter-in-law for Christmas & she loves it. She bakes sour dough bread in it & it is delicious.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is beautiful. Packed securely. Came undamaged. I haven‚Äôt used it yet but I know it‚Äôll be great!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I‚Äôm in love', 'author': 'Sunshine Girl', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'What an amazing bread pan.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Buy it!', 'author': 'M', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Very pricey but so worth it! I have had a different baker ( also expensive) for years and I loved it but was looking for a different crust and a bit of change. So glad I did. Now , I want to buy more of LE creuset collection. Somebody send help! üòÇ', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 11, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Mine Arrived With Deep Pits In The Finish', 'author': 'Stripes', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I was so excited to purchase this Le Creuset Bread Oven at an incredible price. It had been on my wishlist for quite some time. I decided to make the splurge. The color was lovely. Unfortunately there were a number of deep pockmarks in the finish cutting straight through to the cast iron beneath. Of course this would compromise the whole outer shell eventually leading to chips and cracks. The finish under the lid lip was likewise chipped and nicked. I was so disappointed in the lack of quality. I own over 10 pieces Le Creuset - both vintage and newer models. They are my prized possessions. However the old manufacturing standards seems to have slipped quite a bit with this Le Creuset bread oven. The product listing did not state it was a second. With the flaws it would not be considered to even qualify as a second. The pock marks in the glazing was apparent as soon as the box was opened. Is there no longer quality control? I would like to point out there is a design flaw. Since the handles are flush with the bottom of the pan, removing this heavy bread oven would be awkward at best. You would have to drag the pan across the rack in order to grasp the handles from the edge to remove. The handles should bend upwards to allow an easy grab and lift without scraping up the base of the pan by dragging it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Enameled Cast Iron Dutch Oven,3 Quart Dutch Oven Pot with Lid, Round Dutch Oven Cast Iron Pot with Non Stick Enamel Coating for Bread Baking, Gradient Blue Dutch Oven for Kitchen
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great size at 3 quart/14‚ÄùW x 2.44‚Äù H', 'author': 'LaVonia Green', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I just received this cast iron/enameled Dutch Oven and am looking forward to trying it out. I‚Äôve been thinking of clearing out my cabinets of old mismatched and missing lid cookware and replacing it all with updated and efficient pieces. When I saw this Dutch Oven I was anxious to add it to the new collection. At 3L, (14‚ÄùW x 2.44‚ÄùD and 11.4 lbs) it‚Äôs a great size for dishes that need a larger vessel than a regular skillet with rather shallow walls or a CrockPot or ovenware when I want to prepare just enough beef stew or whatever for a couple meals. Using this will allow me to make a variety of meals without dragging out an unnecessary larger pot that will require more clean up and isn‚Äôt needed for smaller quantities. The lid has has a Raindrop Design that gathers moisture in the form of condensation which will go back into the food. Never dry cook and always add liquid, butter or oil to the bottom of the pan PRIOR to heating. This pan does require seasoning along the rim and instructions for doing so are included in the packaging. Metal utensils should not be used on the enamel nor should metallic pads or brushes be used when handwashing. Never use a knife to cut inside the pan or on enamel. Avoid sudden temperature changes and NEVER submerge a hot pan into cold water. I won‚Äôt even run water over a hot pan as I was taught it could cause warping. HAND WASH ONLY Dishwasher cleaning is not recommended and if you have burned on food it is to be soaked in hot, soapy water and then hand dried after it has been cleaned up. Never store while damp. Try not to bump against other cookware or hard surfaces/objects and avoid stacking as the enamel on the inside or outside could be damaged. It can be used on any cooking surface and care should be taken to not let flames lick the sides when using open flame as in when cooking on a gas stove. Only a gradual low to medium heat should be used as this yields the most even and best results for most cooking tasks. Only keep on burner for the necessary time for cooking or boiling and do not overheat empty cookware. Remove from burner promptly after food is cooked. This pot retains and distributes heat throughout and will keep your food warm after it is removed from the heat source. Don‚Äôt scoot or slide the pan onto/off/across ceramic glass stovetops as it may cause scratching. It is oven safe up to 500‚ÄôF/260‚ÄôC. This Dutch oven has the potential to last a lifetime with proper care and handling. It is at an outstanding price point considering its features, convenience factor and capabilities.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 26, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Gorgeous enameled cast iron braising pan', 'author': 'brnt', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have enameled cast iron dutch ovens from Le Creuset, Lodge, Bruntmor and Tramontina. I find all of them to be of a similar quality and they all provide a very similar cooking experience.This is more of a braising pan than a dutch oven, but the quality is still on par with the brands I mentioned above. The one (very minor) exception is the choice of screw to attach the handle to the lid. This one uses a washer between the two, which could collect grime and germs. The highest quality brands use a tapered head screw that seats flush with the inside of the lid.As you can see in the photos, the style of this dutch oven (two-tone paint fade, integrated handles, round lid handle, white interior) runs parallel to all the other brands which, arguably, are all some degree of a copy of the original Le Creuset. One thing to note is that the lid on this one has the dimples for collecting condensation and returning it to the stew. Some brands have them, others don't. I don't have a strong preference either way.The heft of this is significant. If you haven't used cast iron before, it will be heavier than you expect. This is a design feature, however, and not a flaw.The lid fits _perfectly_ onto the pot. Like all the premium brands of dutch oven, the interface between the lid and pot has no enamel coating. The metal-on-metal collisions would chip enamel very quickly if it was there. Bare metal for the contact point is the way to go.The cast used to make the cast iron was in good shape. Neither the pot nor the lid have noticeable seams, nor do they have ground seams (that scar where the manufacturer had to grind down the protruding seam caused by two ill-fitting halves of a lousy mold).Overall, I'm very, very pleased with this braising dish. Would definitely buy again.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 24, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful and Heavy Duty Dutch Oven', 'author': 'MCB', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Obviously this is not quite Le Creuset quality, but it also has a MUCH more reasonable price tag. I like it very much and look forward to keeping it readily accessible in the future. Here‚Äôs a quick summary of the highs and lows of this product in my opinion. If you‚Äôd like more detailed information please read beyond the Pros/Cons and see the pics.Pros- Heavy duty- Very nice lid- Excellent heat retention and distribution- Perfect size for dinner for up to a 4-person family- Attractive- Can be used on any type of cooking surface (gas, glass, electric, induction, grill, or oven)Cons- No broiling- Worried about flakingI was so excited unboxing this that I made a delicious casserole in it the day that it arrived. It takes time to heat up, just like all cast iron, but once it‚Äôs up to temp the heat distribution and retention are very impressive. The lid is awesome, allowing for proper redistribution of water as it collects. Unlike normal cast iron, you only have to season the very edges (black parts) of this dish, so you‚Äôll need to remember to always use oil/butter when you fry anything up in this, or the sticking will be terrible.My only real concern with this dish is that after my first use I found a small flake missing from the inner enamel. I had only used a silicone spatula during cooking and one of the soft-scrub silicone sponges for cleanup, so there was NO way that I had scratched it, but it definitely wasn‚Äôt there before I started. It does make me worry that flaking may occur over time. For now, this is only a one-star deduction, because it‚Äôs so minimal (the size of the tip of a pencil), but I will absolutely update my review right away if I find that spot is getting larger with time or if other spots pop up.Overall I‚Äôm very happy with this Dutch Oven. It is beautiful, heavy, and has some really nice features. I am a little worried about future flaking and will update my review immediately if it gets worse over time.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 27, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars enamel cast iron dutch oven', 'author': 'SandiD', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'HUNZSIM Enameled Cast Iron Dutch Oven,3 Quart Dutch Oven Pot with Lid, Round Dutch Oven Cast Iron Pot with Non Stick Enamel Coating for Bread Baking, Gradient Blue Dutch Oven for KitchenFirst - this dutch oven looks great! it can go from oven to table. Second - dishes in the pot cook evenly. My other dutch oven is not enameled. I would recommend washing this by hand and not putting in the dishwasher.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best Kitchen Must Have', 'author': 'Letting Wild Ones Grow', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've never had a Dutch oven before, don't know why, just haven't. Decided to get myself one, as I didn't have any pots left after my most recent move. I had read this was a kind of do all pot. And they were right. I have used this as a regular pot, cooking spaghetti, mashed potatoes, and even soup. To a casserole type dish when I did sweet potato casserole for the holidays. I use it all the time to make 1 pot meals and clean up is a breeze. The enamel makes it easy to just wipe clean, but the cast iron durability makes it last. The best part is being able to combine all the ingredients in one pot then just toss it into the oven. When it's done, you have the pot lid for storing in the fridge. I did mess up and put it in the dishwasher before thoroughly reading the instructions and it was fine. I just re seasoned the non coated iron part (the rim) and it was good to go again. The color is also lovely, so if that's a factor for you, it's definitely in the plus column for me.Everything cooks evenly and it heats up very quickly, just be careful and make sure you use a pot holder or glove when taking off the lid or picking up by the handles as they get very, very hot.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 5, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful and Heavy', 'author': 'KC Skiddles', 'rating': 5, 'content': "What I do not like is that it is very heavy and needs a lot of care in curing it and then having to always hand wash it so it will not rust. What I do like is once the Dutch oven is cured, stews, chicken and gravy, fried steak and stir-fried vegetables and chicken, and corn bread straight out of the oven, turn out beautifully. I do not have to change any of my recipes to use the Dutch oven. Everything cooks evenly and I don't need to cook everything on high to get it browned. I like that the seller has included very detailed instructions on how to cure, care for, and clean the Dutch oven. I LOVE the color and I look forward to using it for years.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 18, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Well made, heavy duty Dutch oven.', 'author': 'Keith Wheeler Books', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love using a Dutch oven both at home as well as when camping.This cast iron Dutch oven is very durable and has been able to withstand the wear and tear of daily use.Just as a warning, because it‚Äôs cast iron (including the handle), remember that the handle will also get hot, so use potholders when removing the lid during cooking.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 31, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect kitchen addition', 'author': 'Watts of Reading', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I absolutely love this Dutch oven. It has been the perfect addition to my kitchen. While I was concerned about going a little smaller quart size surprisingly it holds a good amount of food and heats evenly throughout the meals. It has been great throwing it from the stove to the oven. Cleaning is a breeze and so far I haven't had an issue with anything sticking to it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 25, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice', 'author': 'chompers', 'rating': 4, 'content': "It's nice, but to be honest I've never used a cast iron pan or dutch oven, so I can't really tell how it compares to a regular cast iron pan or dutch oven. To me, I associate cast iron with nice crusty bread or cornbread, and this seems like a regular pot for stews or something.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 13, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': "4.0 out of 5 stars You want to know if it's equal to Le Creuset, huh?", 'author': 'Mathieu Goodwin', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Le Creuset will last a lifetime, we have one in the family that is easily 60 years old. But, as we all know, they are terribly expensive for a pot. This lovely little dish is an inexpensive but nicely made enameled cast iron pot. It is the fifth enameled cast iron pot I've owned, and as durability matters, I'll update this review in the future to see how it is in the long run. I've had one that was terrible and chipped enamel into my food, but I sense this one will not be like that.In the short run, it's a good weight, the knob is screwed on which will require tightening someday. Integrated knobs are better for a lot of reasons...It's not too heavy unless you are very frail. It's equally good in the oven as on the stove top. Like all enamel ware, it will not stay a pretty white inside after you use it, and cleaning requires more mature attention. It should be hand washed. In short, treat it like it cost you an arm and a leg and it will treat you well right back. I honestly don't think you'll be disappointed with it. I'll let you know how it goes down the line.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 22, 2023', 'is_verified': False}]

Hope it lasts.Shipper must have seen the ‚Äúarrived damaged‚Äù reviews. This one came surrounded by three boxes.Made a gumbo tonight. This pot cleaned up so much easier that non enameled cast iron. Really great for browning the sausage and caramelizing the onion.Could not resist adding a dried arbol chili with seeds for some heat.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 17, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Works great', 'author': 'AJ', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This product works well. The only issue that I have seen is that there was a big cosmetic chip on the outside. Other than that, works great!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 6, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best Dutch Oven ever!', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this dutch oven for a bread recipe and my recipe turned out great! Only thing is it is on the heavier side, but, it is 5.5 quarts and goes up to 540 degrees. Love the red color; it matches my Kitchen Aid mixer.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So far...two thumbs up!', 'author': 'Ann', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Based on some of the reviews I was a little hesitant to order this Puricon 5.5 Quart Enameled Cast Iron Dutch Oven, but I gritted my teeth and bit the bullet. I guess I was one of the fortunate ones. I received my Dutch Oven in perfect condition and I love it! I realize that Le Creuset is the Cr√®me de la Cr√®me, but their cost for a Dutch Oven that I would use only occasionally is prohibitive. The Puricon Dutch Oven serves my purposes perfectly, is waaaaay more affordable, and the best news...I can lift it. It's really heavy but not so heavy that I cannot manage to cook with it and, more importantly...wash it after I've used it! I pray that I never drop the pan or the lid on my glass stove top...that would not be pretty! The directions state not to clean it in the dishwasher so fortunately, the 5.5 qt size I purchased fits just fine in my manufactured home sink (which is slightly smaller than normal sinks.) The inside of the Dutch Oven cleans up really easily, which was a surprise to me! It's a learning curve to use it on my electric stove, but I'm getting there. And for now...I can feel confident in recommending this Puricon Dutch Oven. If there are any changes to my review...I'll add an edit! So far...two thumbs up!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 3, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Worth its weight in Iron', 'author': 'Black Peacock', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is very, very sturdy and can be used for almost anything when cooking. I've used it to steam, boil, fry and everything! It stains easily meaning once you put something in there it takes on that color immediately and it stays there. I made carrots in it when I first used it and that stain is still there but hey, the Dutch is still clean so all good!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 13, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars A whole new cooking experience', 'author': 'Mrs.Robin', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Bought for my husband, who often cooks for our household. He loves using it and it's inspired him to try a lot of different foods. He also has found ways to prepare old recipes in tasty new ways. The Dutch oven is very heavy--it is cast iron, after all--and not easy to wash, though I'm not sorry I bought it. Things like tomato stains are particularly hard to remove from the interior. However, I found some helpful advice when I googled how to clean it. I also got him a cookbook with good recipes and hints for successful Dutch oven cooking.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love it', 'author': 'Vamos Arriba, Vamos Abajo', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I‚Äôve had this a few weeks now. I have used the pot for searing lamb, soups, baking bread, deep frying. I have a glass top stove so I‚Äôm gentle with the pot because it‚Äôs heavy. I have had no issues so far I‚Äôve seen other complain about. Some food had gotten stuck so since I don‚Äôt (or shouldn‚Äôt) use abrasive cleaners, I soaked the pot in water that night. I didn‚Äôt want to risk seeing what others complained about peeling. Used a sponge and it was good as new. I was worried about the complaints I saw regarding breaking in the oven too: I baked bread (with parchment paper inside) at 450 degrees, 40 min, with preheating the Dutch oven without the lid for 15 min- No issues!I use silicone hand mitts to handle the pot and lid. For storage, since I have the beautiful red colored one, I leave it on the counter. But when I have a full counter then I store it with the other pots/pans etc, but by itself (not stacked like I usually do).', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 8, 2021', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Staub Round 5qt. Cocotte in Basil
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Husband is obsessed', 'author': 'KMcG', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This pan is great, my husband is obsessed. I asked him if he likes the pan more than me and he said it depended on the day. The price we got it for was WAY lower than anywhere else so we were concerned about the condition it would come in and it arrived in perfect condition.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 7, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Expensive. Worth it.', 'author': 'Erica Moon', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Is this pricey for a pot? Mmmmnn-hnnnn. BUT. Enameled cast iron is amazing - you can saute in it, brown meat in it, cook bacon in it, etc., to do all the starting bits of a dish, then put in the wet ingredients and make a stew or something else fabulous. And, I've used both Lodge & Le Creuset and I like Staub better for two reasons: 1) The dark surface of the interior is BETTER on a Staub. Le Creuset tends to have stains you can't get out, and browning meat sticks to the inside of a Lodge pot like glue, which ruins the crust on your meat. Staub tends to be much more non-stick and good at browning, also easier to clean. Maybe it does stain, too, but you can't see it. 2) The spikes on the inside of the lid send condensation back into your dish and make your meat come out tenderer. This size is better for me than the 5qt size, because I like to cook for a crowd, and the red color is beautiful!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 16, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This pot is the Bomb! Cherry color is AMAZING!!!', 'author': 'Lucy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought a 9 Quart, round Staub, in Basil and the green color is very pretty.The 9 quart is VERY heavy, if you are not super strong, think aboutlifting that pot out of a low oven, filled with food!I wanted a smaller pot and looked at Staub pots,trying to decide~ for 2 months!I narrowed it down to this beautiful Staub pot in color "Cherry"! Itarrived and my husband and I lifted it out of the packagingand both stopped breathing, it was so gorgeous!!! The finish istwo shades of red. It is like my little red corvette in the kitchen!!The first dish that I made in it was Chicken tikka masalafrom Cooks Illustrated. It was amazing! Both the pot and the recipe!If you plan on making the dish, order a wonderful gramm masala from agood spice place!I can\'t wait to create more wonderful meals for my husbandand myself in this gorgeous pot!! We are thrilled with the look and performanceand feel that it\'s so much prettier than Le Creuset\'s red.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2013', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best size best color!', 'author': 'Arn Wilson', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'If you have one STAUB Cocotte, make it this one. It‚Äôs 5 1/2 quarts and it says it on the box. I know black is not the most exciting color but it will look like new forever. Once the newness wears off you‚Äôll be happy you bought it in black. I love all my Staub Cocottes, but it seems like this is my new go to. Just does everything right. So I had to buy the piggy knob, because it deserves it! Most sought after size of the top French brands. Treat yourself to this one you won‚Äôt be sorry, Happy cooking!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 4, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great deal!', 'author': 'A. title: Ecolution Stainless Steel Stock Pot with Encapsulated Bottom Matching Tempered Glass Steam Vented Lids, Made Without PFOA, Dishwasher Safe, 5-Quart, Silver
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Not Impressed After A Couple Months Use', 'author': 'Straight Up', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This was a replacement for an aluminum ceramic interior Dutch oven I really liked. The non-stick surface pitted and I decided to replace it with stainless steel this time. It's difficult to find a well made stainless Dutch oven for a reasonable price. This Ecolution was about the cheapest I could find. It did have some things going for it. I actually like a glass lid for a quick peek of what's going on in there. It also had the aluminum encapsulated bottom to spread heat evenly. That said, don't expect All Clad results from this pan, watch your heat so you don't burn your sauce. The handles are solid enough and the knob on the lid doesn't get too hot. One of the best attributes is the shape and design. So many Dutch ovens have too tall of sides. The Ecolution is shaped just right for braising in the oven. I'm not a fan of the way the lid sits on top, and the side walls are a little thin so food tends to scorch on the sides (that's why I took a star). Since it's stainless cleanup is a breeze if you soak it with a squirt of Cascade (or just throw it in the dishwasher). Overall it's a nice Dutch oven for the money.Update 6/23/2021: Mea culpa. I deleted a negative review and I am updating my review (again). I've completely reversed on this. Yes the lid rattles when boiling something, but it's just a signal. After several more uses it does spread heat fairly well and you can simmer things on low without scorching them. What I've learned to like about this Dutch oven is the stainless interior. You do have to be careful not to scorch certain foods such as chili or marinara, just keep the heat very low, but the ability to sear certain foods properly is a plus. It turns out I'm keeping it after all. Sometimes you need a non-stick, other times you need stainless. It's really a good stainless pan for the money.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 29, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Quality cookware', 'author': 'Anthony Stout', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This pot is very good quality. The stainless steel cleans up easily. The heat cooks evenly and the encapsulated bottom prevents scorching or burning the food. I cook a lot and I‚Äôm very picky about the equipment in my kitchen. I am very pleased with the pot and it‚Äôs lid and the overall performance and price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 20, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Sometimes you get more than you pay for', 'author': 'P K Browne', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have been using the 5 qt stockpot as well as the 2 smaller pots, on a daily basis, for about 5 months now and am totally pleased. I bought these after we had our conventional ceramic cooktop replaced with an induction cooktop. At the price point of the Ecolution products we were prepared to be disappointed; we were not. The finish on these is mirror like and stays that way with a modicum of care. The pots all have near perfect heat distribution as is evidenced by the uniform bubbles created by a simmer. We have both hand washed and dishwasher washed these and they are still like new. We thought initially that these, due to their light weight, would probably not hold up but, happily, we were wrong, they perform like heavyweights.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 23, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars 5 quart pan with lid', 'author': 'Samuel P Finegold', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Secure delivery.
